schemes.scheme_name: Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide an opportunity for personnel from various government departments of the state to participate annually in the All-India level competitions in
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide an opportunity for personnel from various government departments of the state to participate annually in the All-India level competitions in various sports, organized by the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions, Government of India. ﻿

benefits.summary: There is a provision to provide travel allowance, accommodation allowance, food allowance, sports kits, and other necessary support to all players and team members participating in the 'Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita', in accordance with departmental standards. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: There is a provision to provide travel allowance, accommodation allowance, food allowance, sports kits, and other necessary support to all players and team members participating in the 'Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita', in accordance with departmental standards. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an employee of a government department in Uttarakhand. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Submission of documents is required in accordance with the department's guidelines to avail the benefits of the scheme.

application_process: Offline Selection trials for the competition are conducted at the district and state levels, and the selected players are given the opportunity to participate in the Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita

Every year, approximately 150 personnel from various government departments of Uttarakhand benefit from this scheme by participating in the All-India Level Competition in various sports, organized by the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances, and Pensions, Government of India, for Central and State Government employees
schemes.ministry_department: Department of Sports
schemes.implementing_agency: Department of Sports

schemes.scheme_name: Assistance for Exhibitions Abroad and Out of State
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Assistance for Exhibitions Abroad and Out of State" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and promote artists originally from Gujarat in the field of fine arts—such as painting, sculpture, graphic arts, and photography—by
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Assistance for Exhibitions Abroad and Out of State" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and promote artists originally from Gujarat in the field of fine arts—such as painting, sculpture, graphic arts, and photography—by offering financial assistance to organize exhibitions abroad and outside the state. The scheme ensures support for artists with a record of conducting prior solo or group exhibitions, helping them to gain national and international exposure through structured financial aid. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: Up to ₹1,00,000/- for organizing exhibitions abroad. Particulars Maximum Allowable Amount Gallery rent and decoration 15,000/- Transportation of artworks 10,000/- Publication of catalogues or printed materials related to the exhibition ₹25,000/- Framing, mounting, and display preparation of artworks ₹20,000/- Inaugural ceremony, publicity, and advertisement costs ₹15,000/- Artist’s accommodation, travel, food, local transport, and miscellaneous ₹15,000/- ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: Up to ₹1,00,000/- for organizing exhibitions abroad. Particulars Maximum Allowable Amount Gallery rent and decoration 15,000/- Transportation of artworks 10,000/- Publication of catalogues or printed materials related to the exhibition ₹25,000/- Framing, mounting, and display preparation of artworks ₹20,000/- Inaugural ceremony, publicity, and advertisement costs ₹15,000/- Artist’s accommodation, travel, food, local transport, and miscellaneous ₹15,000/- ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artist originally from Gujarat. The applicant must have organized either: Individual Artists: Artists practicing in fields of visual arts (painting, sculpture, printmaking, etc.) who wish to participate in or organize exhibitions outside Gujarat or internationally. Registered Art Organizations or Groups: Art societies, academies, educational institutions, or cultural organizations that promote visual arts and are organizing such exhibitions. Applicants must exhibit a minimum of 30 original artworks at the exhibition for which financial assistance is being sought The exhibition must be: Outside the State (interstate exhibitions), or Outside the Country (international exhibitions abroad), and Must be art-related, such as showcasing paintings, sculptures, mixed media, or visual art forms. ﻿ ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form for the "Publication Support Scheme for Fine Arts" scheme
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, including career details in the field of art, photographs, or color slides of work (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority at the Academy office to whom the application has been submitted
Note: Applications for book publication are invited every year through advertisement in daily newspapers
Contact Us: Gujarat State Academy of Fine Arts Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan, Opposite Bhaikaka Bhavan, Law Garden, Ellisbridge, Ahmedabad - 380006

schemes.scheme_name: All Goa One-Act Play Competition in Konkani
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "All Goa One-Act Play Competition in Konkani" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to attract youth towards dramatic activities and provide ample opportunities to showcase their talents in dramatics whi
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "All Goa One-Act Play Competition in Konkani" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to attract youth towards dramatic activities and provide ample opportunities to showcase their talents in dramatics while promoting Goan culture through Konkani theatre. The scheme provides cash awards for the top 3 performances along with mementos and certificates, individual awards for various categories like direction, acting, music, and stage setting, and reimbursement of transport costs as per Regional Transport Office norms. The applicant must be an individual, club, or association capable of presenting a One-Act Play in Konkani with duration between 35 to 45 minutes, and must submit a typed copy of the play in Roman script along with written permission from the playwright. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash awards for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd best performances (amount as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa). Mementos and certificates for top 3 performances. Individual awards with mementos (no cash) for Direction, Male Actor, Female Actor, Background Music, Stage Setting, Light Effects, Make-up, and Script. Reimbursement of transport expenses as per Regional Transport Office norms. Video recording of all plays for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa Library. *Performance must not contain adverse remarks
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash awards for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd best performances (amount as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa). Mementos and certificates for top 3 performances. Individual awards with mementos (no cash) for Direction, Male Actor, Female Actor, Background Music, Stage Setting, Light Effects, Make-up, and Script. Reimbursement of transport expenses as per Regional Transport Office norms. Video recording of all plays for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa Library. *Performance must not contain adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion. *Participants must abide by all competition rules and regulations. *Any violation may result in disqualification and forfeiture of benefits. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an individual, club, or association. The applicant must present a One-Act Play in Konkani language. The applicant must ensure the play duration is not less than 35 minutes and not more than 45 minutes. The applicant must ensure participation only when at least 5 groups are participating in the competition. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card (if applicable).
Typed Copy of the One-Act Play in Roman Script.
Security Deposit of ₹1,000/- in Cash or Demand Draft in favour of Member Secretary, Tiatr Academy of Goa, payable at Panaji.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds
*Performance date and time will be determined by draw of lots
*If applicant withdraws after schedule is drawn, full security deposit will be forfeited

schemes.scheme_name: Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to recognize and financially assist artists aged 60 years or above who have retired from professional artistic practice and have made distinguished con
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to recognize and financially assist artists aged 60 years or above who have retired from professional artistic practice and have made distinguished contributions in the field of plastic arts at the national level. The fellowship is intended to support such artists by enabling them to acquire necessary equipment and continue contributing meaningfully to the arts. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. In this scheme, 10 artists are given a monthly fellowship of ₹5,000/- for one year, and it is extendable for a maximum of two years, depending on the quality and impact of the artist’s continued work.

benefits.summary: Details The scheme "Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to recognize and financially assist artists aged 60 years or above who have retired from professional artistic practice and have made distinguished contributions in the field of plastic arts at the national level. The fellowship is intended to support such artists by enabling them to acquire necessary equipment and continue contributing meaningfully
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Details The scheme "Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to recognize and financially assist artists aged 60 years or above who have retired from professional artistic practice and have made distinguished contributions in the field of plastic arts at the national level. The fellowship is intended to support such artists by enabling them to acquire necessary equipment and continue contributing meaningfully to the arts. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. In this scheme, 10 artists are given a monthly fellowship of ₹5,000/- for one year, and it is extendable for a maximum of two years, depending on the quality and impact of the artist’s continued work.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artist. The applicant must be 60 years or older. The applicant should be retired from the professional field of plastic arts. The applicant should have attained national-level fame and established a distinct identity through excellence in painting, sculpture, or graphic arts.

required_documents.document_name: Proof of Age (Government-issued ID showing age 60 years or above)
Proof of Retirement from Professional Art Practice.
Career Details in the Field of Art.
Photographs or Color Slides of Artworks.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form for the "Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist" scheme
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, including career details in the field of art, photographs, or color slides of work (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority at the Academy office to whom the application has been submitted
Contact Us: Gujarat State Academy of Fine Arts Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan, Opposite Bhaikaka Bhavan, Law Garden, Ellisbridge, Ahmedabad - 380006

schemes.scheme_name: Award of Puduvai Kalaimamani
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Award of Puduvai Kalaimamani" scheme was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide prizes of ₹50,000/- and 30 awards to artists or authors/writers in the fields of Literature, Music, Dance, Drama, Painting and Sculpture, and Folk arts. The appli
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Award of Puduvai Kalaimamani" scheme was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide prizes of ₹50,000/- and 30 awards to artists or authors/writers in the fields of Literature, Music, Dance, Drama, Painting and Sculpture, and Folk arts. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Director of Art and Culture Department.

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance of ₹50,000/-. No. of Awards: 30
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance of ₹50,000/-. No. of Awards: 30

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artist or author/writer. The applicant's age should be 30 years or above. The applicant should be performed in the field of literature, music, dance, drama, painting and sculpture, and folk arts. The author/writer should have published books of high repute in poetry, prose, and research articles in literature and grammar in their respective languages. The applicant should participate in literary and research. The applicant should not have been given any such award by other Government and Organisations like Universities etc. The applicant should be a native of Puducherry or residence in Puducherry continuously for a period of 5 years. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Degrees / Honours / National and State Level Certificate.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Department of Art and Culture and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications
OR The interested applicant downloads the application form

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the superintendent, Department of Art and Culture, No
1, Roman Roland Road, Puducherry 605 001
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the superintendent to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)
schemes.ministry_department: Department of Art and Culture and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the applic

schemes.scheme_name: Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles - Folk Artists
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles" scheme was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, The Tamil Nadu Folk Artiste's Welfare Board provides assistance of ₹500/- for the purchase of spectacles to registered folk artists. The assistance
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles" scheme was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, The Tamil Nadu Folk Artiste's Welfare Board provides assistance of ₹500/- for the purchase of spectacles to registered folk artists. The assistance shall be restricted to two thousand registered folk artists per year on “First come – First serve” basis.

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance maximum of ₹500/- Note: This assistance shall be given only once.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance maximum of ₹500/- Note: This assistance shall be given only once.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a registered folk artist. The applicant should not have any dues payable to the board. The applicant must not have availed similar benefits from any other government scheme.

required_documents.document_name: Registration Card of the Folk Artist.
Medical Prescription (from a registered eye specialist).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the regional office and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form XV from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director/Deputy Director in the regional offices
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Assistant Director/Deputy Director to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

schemes.scheme_name: Assistance for Purchase of Traditional Musical Instruments and Costumes for Scheduled Caste/Tribe Individuals
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Assistance for Purchase of Traditional Musical Instruments and Costumes for Scheduled Caste/Tribe Individuals" scheme was launched by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support scheduled caste and scheduled tribe individuals whose liv
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Assistance for Purchase of Traditional Musical Instruments and Costumes for Scheduled Caste/Tribe Individuals" scheme was launched by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support scheduled caste and scheduled tribe individuals whose livelihood depends on traditional arts by providing them with essential musical instruments and costumes. ﻿

benefits.summary: Persons belonging to the Scheduled Castes or Scheduled Tribes, whose source of income is through their traditional art, and who do not possess musical instruments or costumes, are provided with traditional musical instruments (such as Dhol, Damaun, Masakbeen, Ransingha, Trumpet, Nagada, Shield, Sword, etc.) and costumes free of cost to help them sustain their livelihood. The instruments are provided only once in a lifetime. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Persons belonging to the Scheduled Castes or Scheduled Tribes, whose source of income is through their traditional art, and who do not possess musical instruments or costumes, are provided with traditional musical instruments (such as Dhol, Damaun, Masakbeen, Ransingha, Trumpet, Nagada, Shield, Sword, etc.) and costumes free of cost to help them sustain their livelihood. The instruments are provided only once in a lifetime. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant must be a folk artist. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community. The applicant's monthly income must not exceed ₹2,000/-. Only one set of musical instruments is provided per artist in a family under this scheme. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Certificate of monthly income of ₹2,000/- issued by the Tehsildar
Bank account details including account number and IFSC code
Affidavit stating that the beneficiary has not received any grant under other schemes

application_process: Offline The Directorate of Culture publishes an advertisement for providing traditional musical instruments and costumes to eligible SC/ST individuals

Following the advertisement, the concerned individuals are required to submit to the Director of the Culture Directorate a certificate of monthly income of ₹2,000/- issued by the Tehsildar, a certificate of artist/instrument, Aadhaar card, caste certificate, bank account details including account number and IFSC code, PAN card, permanent residence certificate, and an affidavit stating that the beneficiary has not received any grant under other schemes
Eligible beneficiaries are selected by a committee constituted under the chairmanship of the Secretary of Culture at the Directorate level
After the selection process, beneficiaries can collect the musical instruments from the Directorate
schemes.ministry_department: Department of Culture and Endowments
schemes.implementing_agency: Department of Culture and Endowments

schemes.scheme_name: Ambubhai Purani Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Ambubhai Purani Award" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote the development of gymnasiums and traditional Indian physical culture by honoring individuals who have shown exceptional contribution in this field. The scheme p
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Ambubhai Purani Award" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote the development of gymnasiums and traditional Indian physical culture by honoring individuals who have shown exceptional contribution in this field. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹51,000/- and state-level recognition to outstanding individuals, fostering motivation and continuity in preserving indigenous physical training traditions. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: ₹51,000/-.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: ₹51,000/-.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a male individual. The applicant should have performed excellent work in the field of Gymnasiums (Akhadas). ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Applicant's Photo (Allowed formats: jpg/png/jpeg/gif; Maximum Size: 2MB).

application_process: Online Registration Process: Step 1: Visit the official homepage of the Sports Authority of Gujarat
Step 2: On the homepage, navigate to the Player Registration option after clicking on the "Register" button in the top-right corner
Step 3: Fill out the Player Registration Form with the required personal details and click on "Register"
Step 4: After completion, the login ID and password information will be shared via email
﻿ Login and Application Process: Step 1: Go to the Login page and select the user type as "Player"
Step 2: Log in using the credentials received via email
Step 3: After logging in, select the concerned scheme
Step 4: Fill in the required details and upload documents as required
Click on "Submit" to apply

﻿ Contact Us: Director General, Sports Authority of Gujarat Sport, Youth & Cultural Activities Department Administrative Building, Sector 13-B, Near Kh-3 Circle, Near Vavol Railway Crossing, Beside EVM warehouse, Gandhinagar - 382016 Contact Number-97140 97760 ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Adivasi Sanskriti Evam Kala Kendra/Majhi Bhavan, Manki Munda Bhavan, Parha Bhavan, Pargana Bhavan, Dumkuria Bhavan Evam Gosade Nirman Tatha Majhi Than Shed Nirman Yojana
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Adivasi Sanskriti Evam Kala Kendra/Majhi Bhavan, Manki Munda Bhavan, Parha Bhavan, Pargana Bhavan, Dumkuria Bhavan Evam Gosade Nirman Tatha Majhi Than Shed Nirman Yojana" by the Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Minorities, and Backward Classes Welfare Department, Government of Jharkh
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Adivasi Sanskriti Evam Kala Kendra/Majhi Bhavan, Manki Munda Bhavan, Parha Bhavan, Pargana Bhavan, Dumkuria Bhavan Evam Gosade Nirman Tatha Majhi Than Shed Nirman Yojana" by the Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Minorities, and Backward Classes Welfare Department, Government of Jharkhand aims to preserve, protect, and develop tribal culture and traditions. Under this scheme, essential infrastructure, including community centers, cultural hubs, and traditional venues, are built to serve the tribal population as focal points for cultural and social activities.

benefits.summary: Grants and Allocations: Financial assistance of ₹25,00,000/- to ₹5,00,00,000/- per project, based on the scope of work and infrastructure required. Construction of Cultural Hubs: Dedicated centers for tribal cultural preservation such as Majhi Bhavans, Dumkuria Bhavans, and Pargana Bhavans. Basic Infrastructure Development: Facilities include boundary walls, multipurpose halls, drinking water arrangements, seating spaces, driveways, and parking. Beautification and Cultural Representation: Tribal
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Grants and Allocations: Financial assistance of ₹25,00,000/- to ₹5,00,00,000/- per project, based on the scope of work and infrastructure required. Construction of Cultural Hubs: Dedicated centers for tribal cultural preservation such as Majhi Bhavans, Dumkuria Bhavans, and Pargana Bhavans. Basic Infrastructure Development: Facilities include boundary walls, multipurpose halls, drinking water arrangements, seating spaces, driveways, and parking. Beautification and Cultural Representation: Tribal-themed landscaping, wall paintings, and decor to showcase tribal traditions.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should represent a village with a significant tribal population. The applicant village must have recognized traditional tribal leaders, such as Manki, Munda, or Pahan. The applicant committee must be formed under the leadership of tribal leaders with 7-11 tribal members. The applicant village must have government-approved land for the construction of the infrastructure.

required_documents.document_name: Beneficiary Committee Details (Including Tribal Leader Authorization).
Bank Account Details of the Committee (Joint Account).
Technical Project Plan and Cost Estimate.

application_process: Offline Formation of Beneficiary Committee: Conduct a Gram Sabha meeting in eligible villages
Form a committee under the leadership of recognized tribal leaders
Appoint a chairperson, secretary, and treasurer within the committee
﻿ Proposal Submission: Submit the proposal to the District Welfare Officer (DWO) or ITDA Project Director
Ensure the proposal includes the required documents
﻿ Approval Process: District Welfare Officer reviews and forwards the proposal for technical and administrative approval
Final approval is granted by the department and sanctioned funds are disbursed

schemes.scheme_name: Artist Honor (Gaurav Award)
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Artist Honor (Gaurav Award)” scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy under the Sports, Youth and Culture Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to recognize and honor artists who have made a lifetime contribution in the field of fine arts, sp
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Artist Honor (Gaurav Award)” scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy under the Sports, Youth and Culture Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to recognize and honor artists who have made a lifetime contribution in the field of fine arts, specifically in painting, sculpture, and graphic arts, and have achieved outstanding accomplishments. Every year, a total of nine (9) artists are honored under this scheme, three in painting, three in sculpture, and three in graphic arts with the Gaurav Award. This award has been conferred annually since 1964-65. ﻿

benefits.summary: Award Details: Cash prize of ₹51,000/- per artist. Copper plate, citation, and shawl presented during the award ceremony. Exhibition of artworks held for 5–7 days at Ravishankar Raval Kala Bhavan, Ahmedabad. Catalogue publication of Gaurav Award-winning artists and their art. Number of Awards: Total of 9 artists are honored every year. 3 in painting, 3 in sculpture, and 3 in graphic arts. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Award Details: Cash prize of ₹51,000/- per artist. Copper plate, citation, and shawl presented during the award ceremony. Exhibition of artworks held for 5–7 days at Ravishankar Raval Kala Bhavan, Ahmedabad. Catalogue publication of Gaurav Award-winning artists and their art. Number of Awards: Total of 9 artists are honored every year. 3 in painting, 3 in sculpture, and 3 in graphic arts. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The artist must be a resident of the State of Gujarat. The artist must be associated with the field of fine arts, specifically in Painting, Sculpture or Graphic Arts. The artist must have made a lifetime contribution in their respective field. The artist should have achieved outstanding accomplishments or the highest level of recognition in their art form. The applicant must be active in the art community and have a recognized body of work. ﻿

application_process: Offline Application Process: Applications are invited annually through public advertisements (daily newspapers)

Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy
Post-Application Process: Step 1: A committee reviews and shortlists applicants based on merit
Step 2: The final selected artists are notified and invited to the award ceremony
Step 3: Awards are distributed along with the art exhibition and catalogue release

schemes.scheme_name: Award Of Scholarships To Young Artists In Different Cultural Fields
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Award of Scholarships to Young Artists in Different Cultural Fields” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. This scheme seeks to give assistance to young artists of outstanding promise for advanced training within India in the field of Indian Classical Musi
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Award of Scholarships to Young Artists in Different Cultural Fields” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. This scheme seeks to give assistance to young artists of outstanding promise for advanced training within India in the field of Indian Classical Music, Indian Classical Dance, Theatre, Mime, Visual art, Folk, Traditional and Indigenous Arts, and Light Classical Music. Subjects/Fields in which Scholarships can be awarded: Indian Classical Music - Classical Hindustani Music (Vocal and Instrumental), Classical Carnatic Music (Vocal & Instrumental, etc.) Indian Classical Dance/ Dance Music - Bharatnatyam, Kathak, Kuchipudi, Kathakali, Mohiniattam, Odissi Dance/ Music, Manipuri Dance/ Music, Thangta, Gaudiya Nritya, Chhau Dance/ Music, Sattriya dance. Theatre - Any specialized aspect of theatre art, including acting, direction, etc., but excluding playwriting and research. Mime. Visual Arts - Graphics, Sculpture, Painting, Creative Photography, Pottery & Ceramics, etc. Folk, Traditional, and Indigenous Arts - Puppetry, Folk Theatre, Folk dances, Folk Songs, Folk Music, etc. Light Classical Music - a) Thumri, Dadra, Tappa, Qawali, Ghazal, b) Light Classical music based on Carnatic Style, etc. c) Rabindra Sangeet, Nazrul Geeti, Atulprasad. Terms of Scholarship: The nature of training will be determined in each case after taking into consideration the previous training and background of the scholar. Normally, it will be in the nature of advanced training under a Guru/Master or in a recognized institution. The Scholar will be required to undergo a rigorous training. Such training will include minimum of three hours a day for practice alone apart from the time spent for acquiring knowledge of the theory of the subject/field concerned and also an appreciation of the related disciplines.

benefits.summary: Under the scheme, total number of scholarships is 400. Each scholar will be paid ₹5000/- per month for a period of two years to cover his/ her living expenses on travel, books, art material, or other equipment and tuition or training charges, if any. The scholarships are provided in the field of Indian Classical Music, Classical Dances, Light Classical Music, Theatre, Visual Arts, and Folk/ Traditional and Indigenous Arts.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under the scheme, total number of scholarships is 400. Each scholar will be paid ₹5000/- per month for a period of two years to cover his/ her living expenses on travel, books, art material, or other equipment and tuition or training charges, if any. The scholarships are provided in the field of Indian Classical Music, Classical Dances, Light Classical Music, Theatre, Visual Arts, and Folk/ Traditional and Indigenous Arts.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Candidates should be Indian Nationals. Candidates should have adequate general education to pursue their training effectively. Candidates must give evidence of their desire to make the pursuit of their training effectively. As the scholarships are meant for advanced training and not for beginners, candidates must have already acquired a degree of proficiency in the chosen field. The candidate should have undergone a minimum of 5 years of training with their Guru/Institutes. The Certificate duly signed by the present Guru / Institute and former Guru/ Institute (if any) should be submitted along with the application. Candidates should have adequate knowledge of the connected arts/ disciplines. The candidate's age should not be less than 18 years and not more than 25 years as of 1st April of the year in which the application is being made. Age relaxation is not permissible.

required_documents.document_name: One self-attested copy of Education Qualifications (Degrees, Diplomas, etc.), experiences, etc.
One self-attested copy of the Matriculation or equivalent certificate or other admissible evidence of age.

In the case of candidates applying for scholarships in the field of Painting, Sculpture, and Applied Arts, they are required to come with self-attested copies of photographs of the Original works. The minimum qualification for Visual Arts is BFA or equivalent.

As the scholarships are awarded for advanced training, the candidates should have undergone a minimum of 5 years of training with their Gurus/Institutes. The certificates to this effect duly signed by the present Guru/ Institute and former Guru/ Institute (if any) should be submitted along with the application.

application_process: Online Application Process: Step 01: An advertisement inviting applications will be issued by the Centre for Cultural Resources and Training (CCRT), New Delhi
Step 02: Applicants are required to submit online applications on the CSMS Portal which is made available on the website of the Ministry of Culture & CCRT
Step 03: The applicant needs to visit the official website and click on “MOC Schemes Application”
Step 04: Click on Registration and fill up the registration form
Step 05: Get Username and Password for Login Step 06: Go to the current scheme status and click on the appropriate scheme
Step 07: Fill up the form and submit it

Post-Application Process: Step 01: The shortlisted applicants after the process of scrutiny which is done through the software made available by NIC on the CSMS portal, are called for an Interview/Test before the Expert Committee constituted by the Ministry of Culture
Step 02: Candidates will be required to appear for an interview/ performance before the expert Committee
The date, time, and venue of the interview/performance will be intimated to the candidates through e-mail given by the candidates in their online application
The selection will be made purely on merit

Step 03: The list of recommended candidates is sent to the Ministry of Culture for approval and after approval, the selected candidates are informed about the selection by sending an Award letter by post as well as by email, and the list of selected candidates is also uploaded on CCRT’s website and Ministry of Culture respectively
Note 01: Any change in the address may be given to the Ministry in writing
While doing so subject/field of training, File No
(if any) should invariably be given
Note 02: Separate online applications should be submitted for each field if the candidate wants to apply for more than one field

011-24642157 or through E-Mail: scholar-culture[at]nic[dot]in Director, Centre for Cultural Resources and Training, 15-A, Sector-7, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 at Phone Numbers: 011- 25309300 extns
or through e-mail: dir[dot]ccrt[at]nic[dot]in

schemes.brief_description: Details The Arts and Culture Department of Puducherry launched the "Awarding of Tamil Mamani, Telugu Ratna and Malayala Ratna" scheme aims to provide cash award of ₹75, 000/- to the author/writer who has published books of high reputed in poetry, prose, and research articles in literature and gramma
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Arts and Culture Department of Puducherry launched the "Awarding of Tamil Mamani, Telugu Ratna and Malayala Ratna" scheme aims to provide cash award of ₹75, 000/- to the author/writer who has published books of high reputed in poetry, prose, and research articles in literature and grammar in their respective languages.

benefits.summary: Award amount: Cash award : ₹75,000/-. ﻿ Number of Awards: Tamil Mamani - 6 awards. Malayala Ratna - 4 awards. Telugu Ratna - 4 awards.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Award amount: Cash award : ₹75,000/-. ﻿ Number of Awards: Tamil Mamani - 6 awards. Malayala Ratna - 4 awards. Telugu Ratna - 4 awards.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an author/writer. The applicant's age should be 60 years or above. The applicant should participate in literary and research. The applicant should not have been given any such award by other Government and Organisations like Universities etc. The applicant should be a native of Puducherry or residence in Puducherry continuously for a period of 5 years.

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Assistance to Trusts/Institutions for Setting Up Cultural Centers/Auditoriums in the Municipal Area" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to strengthen cultural development and encourage the preservation and promotion of arts and he
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Assistance to Trusts/Institutions for Setting Up Cultural Centers/Auditoriums in the Municipal Area" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to strengthen cultural development and encourage the preservation and promotion of arts and heritage by supporting the creation and improvement of cultural infrastructure in urban regions. Under this initiative, eligible trusts and institutions are provided financial assistance either for constructing new cultural centres or for renovating existing ones. The scheme is implemented by the Sangeet Natak Academy, Gujarat. ﻿

benefits.summary: Assistance for New Construction: 50% of the total cost or ₹30,00,000/- whichever is lower. Assistance for Renovation: Up to ₹15,00,000/-. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility A trust or institution operating within the municipal areas of Gujarat shall be eligible for this scheme. ﻿

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Assistance to Women for Trainer and Coaches Training Course” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote and enhance the participation of women in sports through structured academic training by supporting them financially for pur
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Assistance to Women for Trainer and Coaches Training Course” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote and enhance the participation of women in sports through structured academic training by supporting them financially for pursuing diploma courses in sports. It seeks to enable women to take up professional training to become certified coaches and trainers, thereby boosting employment opportunities and representation in the sports sector. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: Eligible female candidates receive financial support to enroll in recognized diploma courses in sports to become trainers or coaches.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: Eligible female candidates receive financial support to enroll in recognized diploma courses in sports to become trainers or coaches.

schemes.scheme_name: Award Winning Tiatr Festival
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Award Winning Tiatr Festival" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to popularize award winning tiatrs by organizing an annual festival comprising of tiatrs which have won 1st, 2nd and 3rd places in var
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Award Winning Tiatr Festival" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to popularize award winning tiatrs by organizing an annual festival comprising of tiatrs which have won 1st, 2nd and 3rd places in various competitions, and will be organized in various Talukas of Goa with venues decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The scheme provides financial remuneration to directors/producers for staging their award-winning tiatrs and covers payment to service providers for arranging stage, lights, sound etc. when no furnished auditorium is available. The applicant must be a director/producer of a tiatr that has won 1st, 2nd or 3rd place in specified competitions and must submit self-attested copies of Aadhaar and Permanent Account Number Card along with the application. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Remuneration for Tiatr Performance Tiatr Academy of Goa Popular Tiatr winners: ₹40,000/- for each tiatr. Kala Academy Group 'A' winners: ₹35,000/- for each tiatr. Kala Academy Group 'B' winners: ₹30,000/- for each tiatr. Tiatr Academy of Goa Children Tiatr winners: ₹25,000/- for each tiatr. Infrastructure Support Payment to service providers for arranging stage, lights, sound etc. at rates fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa (applicable when no furnished auditorium is available). Performance
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Remuneration for Tiatr Performance Tiatr Academy of Goa Popular Tiatr winners: ₹40,000/- for each tiatr. Kala Academy Group 'A' winners: ₹35,000/- for each tiatr. Kala Academy Group 'B' winners: ₹30,000/- for each tiatr. Tiatr Academy of Goa Children Tiatr winners: ₹25,000/- for each tiatr. Infrastructure Support Payment to service providers for arranging stage, lights, sound etc. at rates fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa (applicable when no furnished auditorium is available). Performance Platform Opportunity to showcase award-winning tiatrs in various Talukas of Goa. Venues for the festival will be decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be the director/producer of a tiatr that has won 1st, 2nd or 3rd place in any of the following competitions: The applicant must be the director/producer of a tiatr that won 1st, 2nd or 3rd prize in Tiatr Academy of Goa Popular Tiatr Competition. The applicant must be the director/producer of a tiatr that won 1st, 2nd or 3rd prize in Kala Academy Group 'A' tiatr Competition. The applicant must be the director/producer of a tiatr that won 1st, 2nd or 3rd prize in Kala Academy Group 'B' tiatr Competition. The applicant must be the director/producer of a tiatr that won 1st, 2nd or 3rd prize in Tiatr Academy of Goa Children's Tiatr Competition. Post-Selection Conditions Presentation of tiatr including kantaram should be done exactly the way it was presented in the respective competitions. The tiatr should be shown without charging tickets. Non-adherence to performance norms may result in withholding the payments. Tiatr Academy of Goa may depute an observer to verify whether the performance is as per the norms. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self Attested Copy of Aadhaar Card.
Self Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card.

It awards the best books published each calendar year in various languages through the Gujarat Sahitya Akadem
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Best Book Award scheme by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, promotes high-quality literary creation and recognition of literary talent. It awards the best books published each calendar year in various languages through the Gujarat Sahitya Akademi. Under this scheme, the first prize includes ₹11,000 along with a certificate and shield; the second prize includes ₹7,000 with a certificate and shield; and the third prize includes ₹5,000, also with a certificate and shield. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Sahitya Akademi.

benefits.summary: Monetary Benefits: First Prize: ₹11,000/-. Second Prize: ₹7,000/-. Third Prize: ₹5,000/-. Other Benefits: Certificate of Achievement Commemorative Shield
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Monetary Benefits: First Prize: ₹11,000/-. Second Prize: ₹7,000/-. Third Prize: ₹5,000/-. Other Benefits: Certificate of Achievement Commemorative Shield

The applicant’s book should be written in a language recognised by the Gujarat Sahitya Academy. Note: Prizes are awarded to the best books in the respective language published by Cha Sahitya Academy every calendar year. The scheme is applicable to Gujarat as well as across the country.

schemes.scheme_name: Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Best Contribution to promotion of Sports and Games
schemes.brief_description: Details The “ Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Best Contribution to Promotion of Sports and Games ” is a category of award under the “ Biju Patnaik Sports Award " Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Bi
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “ Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Best Contribution to Promotion of Sports and Games ” is a category of award under the “ Biju Patnaik Sports Award " Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju Patnaik, the ex-Chief Minister of Odisha, towards the development of Sports & Games in the State by conferring the highest honor of the Government of Odisha in the field of Sports in his name. The award is given the individuals who have substantially contributed in various ways such as Sports Administration and sports Support Staff (other than Coaches) and also to the organizations that have substantially contributed by recruiting sportspersons, providing financial support to sportspersons for advanced coaching & International participation, and sponsorship support for the organization of National and international sporting events. Objective: To encourage the development of Sports and Games in the State. To honor meritorious sportspersons who have made the State Proud. To inspire and motivate young talents to excel in sports and games by emulating the seniors. Sports Discipline: The sports disciplines recognized by the International Olympic Committee (I.O.C.), Indian Olympic Association (I.O.A.), Government of India (G.O.I.), Sports Authority of India (S.A.I.) and Government of Odisha (G.O.O.) including Sports Event for Persons with Disability.

benefits.summary: The award shall be presented every year subject to the availability of a suitable candidate, which will carry a cash award of ₹1,00,000/-. A statue, a scroll of honor, and a blazer with a tie shall be given along with all the Cash Awards. The Awardees shall be invited to receive the awards in person. They shall be given T.A. and D.A. at the rate admissible to a Grade 'A' Officer. Note: Canvassing for the award in any form is prohibited. The award can also be given posthumously to the next of kin
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The award shall be presented every year subject to the availability of a suitable candidate, which will carry a cash award of ₹1,00,000/-. A statue, a scroll of honor, and a blazer with a tie shall be given along with all the Cash Awards. The Awardees shall be invited to receive the awards in person. They shall be given T.A. and D.A. at the rate admissible to a Grade 'A' Officer. Note: Canvassing for the award in any form is prohibited. The award can also be given posthumously to the next of kin of the awardee (In the case of the applicant). In case of selection of more than one person/organization for an award, the award money will be shared amongst the awardees. It will not be binding on the Department of Sports & Youth Services to confer the award every year. In case of non-availability of suitable persons/organizations for the award, the award shall not be given for the respective year.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Both individuals/organizations will be eligible for this award. Individual applicant: The applicant should be a permanent resident of the State of Odisha or shall be staying at least for a period not less than 07 years. The minimum age of the applicant should be 45 years as of 1st January of the year of the Award and must have substantially contributed in various ways such as Sports Administration and sports Support Staff (other than Coaches). The applicant should not have been convicted of any criminal offence. The award will be conferred on a person only once in his/her lifetime, pertaining to the concerned category. The award can be given posthumously to the next of kin of the selected sportsperson. Applicant Organization: The organization must have substantially contributed by recruiting sportspersons, providing financial support to sportspersons for advanced coaching & International participation, and sponsorship support for the organization of National and international sporting events. Annulment Cancellation of Award: The Award may be cancelled in case it is found that it has been obtained by fraudulent means. In such event, the concerned person shall be asked to refund the award failing which steps will be taken to recover the involved cost from him/her with simple interest @ 5% per annum.

required_documents.document_name: The details of the achievement along with supporting documents/papers.
Adequate documentary evidence in support of the claim for the award.
The details of the achievement of the organization along with supporting documents/papers.
Adequate documentary evidence in support of the claim for the award.

application_process: Online Offline Visit the official website of the department and click on the " Biju Patnaik Sports Award " tab under the Sports Service category
On clicking, sign in web page for the applicant will open
Click on " New Applicant " for registration of new applicant on the portal
Once clicked, application form will open
Fill all the details and submit
After registration, enter registration number on the sign in web page to apply for a scheme

Once application form is filled the Hard copy of the applications may be sent along with supporting documents to Director Sports, Sports and Youth Services Department, Kalinga Stadium Sports Complex Bhubaneswar, 751012

If the applicant is unable to upload any document or unable to fill details, he/she can send hard copies of applications along with necessary documents by Registered post/speed post/courier to the Director Sports, Sports and Youth Services Department, Govt of Odisha, Kalinga Stadium Sports Complex, Bhubaneswar,751012
For latest updates about the scheme, the applicant may visit https://sports

schemes.scheme_name: Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Excellence in Coaching
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Excellence in Coaching” is a category of award under the “Biju Patnaik Sports Award" Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju Patnaik, the ex-Chief Ministe
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Excellence in Coaching” is a category of award under the “Biju Patnaik Sports Award" Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju Patnaik, the ex-Chief Minister of Odisha, towards the development of Sports & Games in the State by conferring the highest honour of the Government of Odisha in the field of Sports in his name. The award is given to the coaches who have devoted their career to imparting Coaching in any of the major sports disciplines and have coached Sportspersons achieving excellence at National and International levels. Objective: To encourage the development of Sports and Games in the State. To honour meritorious sportspersons who have made the State Proud. Coach: A person who has been employed as a Coach in State Government, Sports and Youth Services Department, SAI, O.C.S., Sports Associations, or any other Corporate, Private Sectors, Organizations, Clubs with regular sports activities in pursuing active coaching in individual capacity or a person who produces outstanding result in different Olympic Sports Disciplines and non-Olympic Sports Disciplines recognized by G.O.I. and State Government and such Indigenous Sports which are recognized by the State Government under extant Rule. Sports Discipline: The sports disciplines recognized by the International Olympic Committee (I.O.C.), Indian Olympic Association (I.O.A.), Government of India (G.O.I.), Sports Authority of India (S.A.I.) and Government of Odisha (G.O.O.) including Sports Event for Persons with Disability.

benefits.summary: The award shall be presented every year, subject to the availability of suitable candidates, which will carry a cash award of ₹1,00,000/-. A statue, a scroll of honour, and a blazer with a tie shall be given along with all the Cash Awards. The Awardees shall be invited to receive the awards in person. They shall be given T.A. and D.A. at the rate admissible to a Grade 'A' Officer. Note 01: Canvassing for the award in any form is prohibited. Note 02: The award can also be given posthumously to th
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The award shall be presented every year, subject to the availability of suitable candidates, which will carry a cash award of ₹1,00,000/-. A statue, a scroll of honour, and a blazer with a tie shall be given along with all the Cash Awards. The Awardees shall be invited to receive the awards in person. They shall be given T.A. and D.A. at the rate admissible to a Grade 'A' Officer. Note 01: Canvassing for the award in any form is prohibited. Note 02: The award can also be given posthumously to the next of kin of the awardee. Note 03: In case of selection of more than one person for an award, the award money will be shared amongst the awardees. Note 04: It will not be binding on the Department of Sports & Youth Services to confer the award every year. In case of non-availability of suitable persons for the award, the award shall not be given for the respective year. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a permanent resident of the State of Odisha or shall be staying at least for a period of not less than 07 years. To be eligible for this award, a coach should have devoted his/her career to imparting Coaching in any of the major sports disciplines and should have coached Sportspersons achieving excellence at National and International levels. The applicant should not have been convicted of any criminal offence. The award will be conferred on a person only once in his/her lifetime, pertaining to the concerned category. The award can be given posthumously to the next of kin of the selected awardee. Annulment Cancellation of Award: The Award may be cancelled in case it is found that it has been obtained by fraudulent means. In such event, the concerned person shall be asked to refund the award, failing which steps will be taken to recover the involved cost from him/her with simple interest @ 5% per annum. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Details of Career as a Coach (Supported documents)
Details of Qualification as a Coach (Necessary documents)
Details regarding the Sports person(s) who have achieved excellence at National/International recognized competitions under his/her Coaching and guidance
Adequate documentary evidence in support of the claim for the award

application_process: Offline Application process: Step 01: Advertisement for the award shall be uploaded every year in January on the Department Website with the prescribed format for the application

Step 02: The applicants can download the application form from the official website or collect it from the office of District Collector, DSOs, SPs, NYKS, Odisha Council of Sports and Sports & Youth Services Department
Step 03: Fill in the all necessary details in the application form and attach all the relevant documents

Step 04: The application forms can be sent by the Collector, SP, DSO, NYKS concerned Sports Association, the person himself/herself, or Odisha Council of Sports to the Sports & Youth Services Department
Note 01: The Department of Sports and Youth Services also reserves the right to suo moto nominate names for the award
Note 02: The application form and all supporting documents must be self-attested by the applicant, i
there is no need for attestation by any Gazetted officer

Scrutiny of Application: The Secretary, Sports, and Youth Services Department will constitute a five-member scrutiny Committee comprising senior officials and coaches of the Department with Director-cum-Addl

Secretary, Sports and Youth Services Department or the senior most officer of the Department as head of the Committee to scrutinize all the applications and place the scrutiny result before the selection committee for consideration
Selection Procedure: An eight-member Selection Committee will be constituted by Govt
under the chairmanship of Secretary, Sports and Youth Services Department for the selection of awardees
The Selection Committee shall examine the scrutinized nominations/applications and recommend names for each award for approval of Government at the level of Hon'ble Minister, Sports & Youth Services

The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju Patnaik, the ex-
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “ Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Excellence in Sports Journalism ” is a category of award under the “ Biju Patnaik Sports Award " Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju Patnaik, the ex-Chief Minister of Odisha, towards the development of Sports & Games in the State by conferring the highest honor of the Government of Odisha in the field of Sports in his name. The objective of the scheme is to encourage the development of Sports and Games in the State. The award is given to the journalists who have done significant work in the sphere of journalism for the promotion and popularization of sports and games as well as fighting for the causes of sports and sportspersons in the State of Odisha. Sports Journalist: Sports reporter, Journalist (Mobile or desk) of a major daily newspaper, or magazine. Accredited Journalists: A journalist who has been granted accreditation under the Rule "The Odisha Press Accreditation (Constitution Rules-1994 notified on 31st January 1994 Resolution in I & P.R. Department Govt. of Odisha) and includes accredited Sports & Photo Journalist and awarded from time to time. Freelance Reporter of Print media and/or Electronic media operating within the State of Odisha (As per the eligibility criteria under the resolution (Para-2 (I) of the I& P.R. Department of Government of Odisha. Photo Journalist/Cameraman-Cum-Correspondent: A cameraman representing a newspaper, News Photo Agency, or TV news Unit (as per the eligibility criteria under resolution (Para-2 (i) & P.R. Department)

benefits.summary: The award shall be presented every year subject to the availability of suitable candidates, which will carry a cash award of ₹1,00,000/-. A statue, a scroll of honor, and a blazer with a tie shall be given along with all the Cash Awards. The Awardees shall be invited to receive the awards in person. They shall be given T.A. and D.A. at the rate admissible to a Grade 'A' Officer. Note: Canvassing for the award in any form is prohibited. The award can also be given posthumously to the next of kin
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The award shall be presented every year subject to the availability of suitable candidates, which will carry a cash award of ₹1,00,000/-. A statue, a scroll of honor, and a blazer with a tie shall be given along with all the Cash Awards. The Awardees shall be invited to receive the awards in person. They shall be given T.A. and D.A. at the rate admissible to a Grade 'A' Officer. Note: Canvassing for the award in any form is prohibited. The award can also be given posthumously to the next of kin of the awardee. In case of selection of more than one person for an award, the award money will be shared amongst the awardees. It will not be binding on the Department of Sports & Youth Services to confer the award every year. In case of non-availability of suitable persons for the award, the award shall not be given for the respective year.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a permanent resident of the State of Odisha. To be eligible for this award, a journalist must have done significant work in the sphere of journalism for the promotion and popularization of sports and games as well as fighting for the causes of sports and sportspersons in the State of Odisha. The applicant should not have been convicted of any criminal offence. The award will be conferred on a person only once in his/her lifetime, pertaining to the concerned category. The award can be given posthumously to the next of kin of the selected awardee. Annulment Cancellation of Award: The Award may be cancelled in case it is found that it has been obtained by fraudulent means. In such event, the concerned person shall be asked to refund the award failing which steps will be taken to recover the involved cost from him/her with simple interest @ 5% per annum.

application_process: Offline Application process: Step 01: The advertisement for the award shall be uploaded every year in January on the Department Website with the prescribed format for the application

Step 02: The applicant can download the application form from the official website or collect it from the office of District Collector, DSOs, SPs, NYKS, Odisha Council of Sports and Sports & Youth Services Department
Step 03: Fill in the all necessary details in the application form and attach all the relevant documents

Step 04: The application forms can be sent by the Collector, SP, DSO, NYKS concerned Sports Association, the person himself/herself, or Odisha Council of Sports to the Sports & Youth Services Department

there is no need for attestation by any Gazetted officer

Selection Procedure: An eight-member Selection Committee will be constituted by Govt
under the chairmanship of the Secretary, Sports and Youth Services Department for the selection of awardees
The Selection Committee shall examine the scrutinized nominations/applications and recommend names for each award for approval of Government at the level of Hon'ble Minister, Sports & Youth Services

schemes.brief_description: Details The “Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Lifetime Achievement in Promotion of Sports & Games” is a category of award under the “Biju Patnaik Sports Award" Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Lifetime Achievement in Promotion of Sports & Games” is a category of award under the “Biju Patnaik Sports Award" Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju Patnaik, the ex-Chief Minister of Odisha, towards the development of Sports & Games in the State by conferring the highest honour of the Government of Odisha in the field of Sports in his name. The award is given to the sportspersons who have not only good performances at the National and International levels but also have continued to contribute to the promotion of sports and games in his/her individual capacity even after retirement from an active sporting career. Objective: 1. To encourage the development of Sports and Games in the State. 2. To honour meritorious sportspersons who have made the State Proud. 3. To inspire and motivate young talents to excel in sports and games by emulating the seniors. Sports Discipline: The sports disciplines recognized by the International Olympic Committee (I.O.C.), Indian Olympic Association (I.O.A.), Government of India (G.O.I.), Sports Authority of India (S.A.I.) and Government of Odisha (G.O.O.) including Sports Event for Persons with Disability.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a permanent resident of the State of Odisha or shall be staying at least for a period not less than 07 years. To be eligible for this Award, a sportsperson should have not only good performances at the National and International levels but should also have continued to contribute to the promotion of sports and games in his/her individual capacity even after retirement from an active sporting career. The minimum age of the applicant should be 45 years as of 1st January of the year of the Award. The applicant should not have been convicted of any criminal offence. The award will be conferred on a person only once in his/her lifetime, pertaining to the concerned category. Persons found positive for use of drugs/banned substances for performance enhancement, will not be eligible for this Award. The objective of the scheme is to provide knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing to Bhajan performers through e
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Bhajan Pakhawaj Workshops" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to provide knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing to Bhajan performers through experts from the respective field. Applications are invited by announcement in local print and electronic media. Certificates are awarded to the participants. A Suitable Honorarium is paid to conductors of workshops.

benefits.summary: Knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing is provided to the Bhajan performers through experts from the respective field. Certificates are awarded to the participants. A suitable Honorarium is paid to conductors of workshops. *The venue of the workshop is decided by Kala Academy.

Documents supporting that the applicant is an expert in traditional Bhajan Singing or Pakhawaj playing.

schemes.scheme_name: Bima Yojana - Direct Benefit to Artisan
schemes.brief_description: Details Launched on 15th August 2022, the scheme "Bima Yojana - Direct Benefit to Artisan (BYDBTA)" is a Social Welfare Scheme by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India. This scheme aims to provide financial assistance of up to ₹8,000 per month to senior and award-winning artisans, thereby en
schemes.detailed_description: Details Launched on 15th August 2022, the scheme "Bima Yojana - Direct Benefit to Artisan (BYDBTA)" is a Social Welfare Scheme by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India. This scheme aims to provide financial assistance of up to ₹8,000 per month to senior and award-winning artisans, thereby ensuring their financial security and supporting the handicraft sector. The applications are accepted offline through the nearest Handicrafts Service Centre. The scheme is being implemented by the Office of Development Commissioner (Handicrafts), Ministry of Textiles.

benefits.summary: Assistance from the government may be either in the form of monthly allowance, or lump sum grant or both. In no case however shall the assistance exceed ₹ 8,000/- (Rs. Eight thousand only) per month.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Assistance from the government may be either in the form of monthly allowance, or lump sum grant or both. In no case however shall the assistance exceed ₹ 8,000/- (Rs. Eight thousand only) per month.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a master craftsperson who has received Shilp Guru Awards, National Awards, Merit Certificates, or similar honours. The applicant should be aged 60 years or above (relaxation is available for artisans with disabilities). The applicant’s annual income should not exceed ₹1,00,000. The applicant should not be receiving similar financial assistance from other sources. The applicant should submit an income certificate and an affidavit annually, countersigned by a 1st Class Magistrate.

application_process: Offline Handicraft artisan registered with the office of DC (H) having valid photo identity card and such other conditions as deemed fit
The artisans should submit the application form duly filled in all respect to the nearest Handicrafts Service Centre for recommendation of loan or directly to the bank for availing MUDRA loan

schemes.scheme_name: Cash Award to Women Players of the State
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Cash Award to Women Players of the State" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote participation of women in sports and recognize their achievements by awarding them cash incentives for outstanding performance in state-level
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Cash Award to Women Players of the State" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote participation of women in sports and recognize their achievements by awarding them cash incentives for outstanding performance in state-level and national-level competitions. Female athletes securing the first, second, or third position in individual or team sports at the state level, or representing Gujarat at national competitions, receive annual scholarships based on their rank and category. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat. ﻿

benefits.summary: First Position (Individual & Team Sports at State Level/ National Representation): ₹4,800/- per year Second Position (Individual & Team Sports at State Level): ₹3,600/- per year Third Position (Individual Sports at State Level): ₹2,400/- per year ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: First Position (Individual & Team Sports at State Level/ National Representation): ₹4,800/- per year Second Position (Individual & Team Sports at State Level): ₹3,600/- per year Third Position (Individual Sports at State Level): ₹2,400/- per year ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a woman. The applicant should be a student. The applicant should have passed the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examination. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should have secured first, second, or third position in individual or collective sports competitions held at the state level. The applicant should have represented Gujarat state in national-level sports competitions. The applicant’s accomplishment must have occurred within the respective financial year. ﻿ ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Certificate of Participation and Rank from State Level Sports Competition.
Certificate of Representation from National Level Sports Body (for national-level participants).

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the below address of the Sports Authority of Gujarat
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted

Contact Us: Director General, Sports Authority of Gujarat Sport,Youth & Cultural Activities Department Administrative Building, Sector 13-B, Near Kh-3 Circle, Near Vavol Railway Crossing, Beside EVM warehouse, Gandhinagar - 382016 Contact Number-97140 97760 ﻿
