schemes.scheme_name: Chetan Chauhan Labor Sports Promotion Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The Chetan Chauhan Shramik Krida Protsahan Yojana (CCSKPY) stands out as a remarkable initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government in 2022. Recognizing the potential for sporting talent to blossom even from underprivileged backgrounds, the scheme bridges the financial gap for the chil
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Chetan Chauhan Shramik Krida Protsahan Yojana (CCSKPY) stands out as a remarkable initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government in 2022. Recognizing the potential for sporting talent to blossom even from underprivileged backgrounds, the scheme bridges the financial gap for the children of registered construction workers. By offering a one-time grant, the CCSKPY empowers these young athletes who have excelled at district, state, national, and even international levels. This financial support proves to be a game-changer, allowing them to focus on rigorous training, acquire necessary equipment, and participate in upcoming competitions. The CCSKPY not only fosters a love for sports among these children but also paves the way for them to achieve recognition and success in the sporting arena, etching their names in the history of Indian athletics.

benefits.summary: Provide financial assistance who have been selected in district, state, national and international sports. District level : ₹25,000/- per son/daughter in lump sum once. State level : ₹50,000/- per son/daughter in lump sum. National level : ₹75,000/- lump sum per son/daughter. International level : ₹1,00,000/- lump sum per son/daughter.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Provide financial assistance who have been selected in district, state, national and international sports. District level : ₹25,000/- per son/daughter in lump sum once. State level : ₹50,000/- per son/daughter in lump sum. National level : ₹75,000/- lump sum per son/daughter. International level : ₹1,00,000/- lump sum per son/daughter.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The worker must be working in an establishment registered under the Factories Act, 1948. The monthly salary (basic salary + dearness allowance) of the worker should not exceed ₹15,000/-. The worker must have worked continuously for at least six months in the establishment/factory and must be in service at the time of applying. The benefit will be admissible to the worker or his two daughters only. The benefit will be admissible to the worker or his two children only. Only those players will be eligible who have been selected on or after March 23, 2021. In case of the female worker herself being a player, she will be given the benefit.

required_documents.document_name: Attested copy of the online application form filled in relation to the scheme.
Self-certified copy of the beneficiary's bank passbook (with the bank's IFSC code).
Copy of ration card, family register or other government record in confirmation of the relationship of the dependent.
Attested copy of Aadhar card of the beneficiary father and mother.
Attested copy of the certificate of the office bearers of the recognized sports association on being selected in district, state, national and international games.

application_process: Online Step-1: Access the official website of the Uttar Pradesh Labour Welfare Board at https://skpuplabour
﻿ Step-2: Select the "Shramik Application" option from the homepage
Step-3: For new users, proceed with the " Register New User " option
Fill out the registration form accurately and submit it
The system will generate a unique user ID and password, which will be sent to the registered mobile number
Step-4: Utilize the provided credentials to log in to the portal
Step-5: Choose the relevant scholarship scheme from the available options
Diligently complete the application form, ensuring all details are accurate and complete
Upload a recent photograph of the applicant
Finally, submit the application form for further processing
Step-6: Obtain a printed copy of the duly submitted application form for future reference
Step-7: Present the application form at the concerned educational institution and the factory/establishment for verification and endorsement
Step-8: Log in again using the registered user ID and password
Access the "Scheme Application Details" section and upload a scanned copy of the verified application form along with the required supporting documents
Save the information for successful submission
Step-9: Upon successful verification and validation of the application, the scholarship amount will be disbursed to the beneficiary's bank account
The beneficiary will be notified through an SMS on the registered mobile number
Step-10: Applicants can track the status of their application by selecting the "Application Status" option on the portal

schemes.scheme_name: Cultural Function And Production Grant Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Cultural Function and Production Grant Scheme” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. The scheme covers all ‘not-for-profit’ organizations, NGOs, Societies, Trusts, and Universities for supporting Seminars, Conference, Research, Workshops, Festivals, Exhibi
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Cultural Function and Production Grant Scheme” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. The scheme covers all ‘not-for-profit’ organizations, NGOs, Societies, Trusts, and Universities for supporting Seminars, Conference, Research, Workshops, Festivals, Exhibitions, Symposia, Drama-Theatre, Music, etc., and small research projects on different aspects of Indian Culture. Purpose of financial assistance: Holding Conferences, Seminars, Workshops, Symposia, Festivals, Exhibitions, Production of Dance, Drama Theatre, Music, etc., and undertaking small research projects, etc. on any art forms/important cultural matters. To meet expenditure on activities of a development nature like the conduct of surveys, pilot projects, etc. on cultural subjects including publications thereof. Installments: The Grant will be released in two installments of 75% (First Installment) and 25% (Second Installment). Mode of Payment: All payments will be made only through electronic transfers. Accounting Procedures: Separate accounts shall be maintained in regard to the grants released by the Central Government: The Accounts of the grantee organization shall be open to audit at any time by the Comptroller and Auditor General of India or his nominee at his discretion. The grantee organization shall submit to the Government of India, a Statement of Accounts audited by a Chartered Accountant, stating out the expenditure incurred on the approved project and indicating the utilization of the Government grant in the preceding years. If the utilization certificate is not submitted within the prescribed period, the grantee shall arrange to refund immediately the whole amount of the grant received together with interest thereon at the prevailing borrowing rate of the Government of India unless specially exempted by the Government. The grantee organization will be open to a review by the Government of India, Ministry of Culture by appointing a committee or in any other manner decided by the Government as and when deemed necessary by the Government. The grantee organization shall not invite foreign delegations without obtaining permission from the Ministry of External Affairs, the application for which shall invariably be routed through the Ministry of Culture. It will be subjected to such other conditions and rules as may be prescribed by the Government of India guidelines from time to time. Output of the Scheme: The grantee organizations are required to upload videos of their Production/Function/ Seminar etc. on Youtube and provide a link to the Youtube/Facebook/Twitter page of the Ministry of Culture.

benefits.summary: The grant for specific projects shall be restricted to 75% of the expenditure, subject to a maximum of ₹5.00 lakhs per project as recommended by the Expert Committee. The Ministry may in exceptional circumstances, increase the assistance to any project of outstanding merit and relevance up to ₹20 Lakhs with the approval of Hon’ble Minister of Culture.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The grant for specific projects shall be restricted to 75% of the expenditure, subject to a maximum of ₹5.00 lakhs per project as recommended by the Expert Committee. The Ministry may in exceptional circumstances, increase the assistance to any project of outstanding merit and relevance up to ₹20 Lakhs with the approval of Hon’ble Minister of Culture.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant organizations that are voluntary organizations or NGOs, should, in order to qualify for the grant, have a properly constituted managing body with its powers, duties and responsibilities clearly defined and laid down in the form of a written constitution. The Organization should have been functioning and registered under the Societies Registration Act (XXI of 1860), Trusts Act, Companies Act, or any Central or State Act for at least three years. The applicant organizations that are voluntary organizations or NGOs must register themselves on the NGO Darpan Portal of NITI Aayog and obtain a Unique ID from the Portal. The organizations are required to intimate the Unique ID as obtained from the NGO Darpan Portal and PAN Number of the organization while applying under the Scheme. The Organization must have tied up or planned the matching resources at least to the extent of 25 % of the project cost. The Organization should have facilities, resources, personnel, and experience to take up the event/project for which a grant is required. Note 01: Past experience of holding such functions, as applied for, would be given preference.

required_documents.document_name: Constitution of the Organization with appropriate details
Constitution of the Board of Management or Governing Body or particulars of each member (in the case of NGOs/VOs)
Copy of the latest available Annual Report or similar documents

A statement of income and expenditure of the applicant organization for the previous three years and a copy of the balance sheet for the previous year certified by a Chartered Accountant or a Government Auditor
An Indemnity Bond in the prescribed proforma on a stamp paper of appropriate denomination
Details of the bank account in the prescribed proforma to enable the electronic transfer of sanctioned funds
Description of the project for which assistance is requested along with its duration and qualifications and experience of the staff to be employed for the project;
Item-wise details of recurring and non-recurring expenditures separately, and
the source(s) from which counterpart funds will be obtained

application_process: Offline Application Process: Step 01: Applications are invited for financial assistance under the scheme from Not-For-Profit Organizations including Societies, Trusts, Companies, and Universities for supporting the seminars, research, workshops, festivals, production and exhibitions, etc
organized by them on different aspects of Indian Culture

Step 02: Applicant Organization may send the completely documented applications, in the prescribed proforma , along with the recommendation of any of the National Academies, any culture-related organization under the Government of India, or by State Government/UT Administration/ State Academies
Step 03: The application should be addressed to The Director, North Central Zone Cultural Centre (NCZCC), 14, CSP Singh Marg, Allahabad-211001
Telephone No
Note 01: For any clarification please contact Section Officer, (S&F) Section at Telephone No
011-24642157 and Director, North Central Zone Cultural Centre (NCZCC) at Telephone No
Note 02: Organizations may apply for financial assistance under the scheme throughout the year
Mode of Selection: The grant under the scheme will be considered and recommended by the Expert Committee constituted for the purpose
The scrutiny of applications by the Expert Committee will be done in its meetings held from time to time throughout the year subject to the availability of funds and applications for the grant
The same Expert may not be allowed to recommend the proposal of the organization of which he is the Office bearer or in any other way related to the organization

All the Expert Committee Members are required to give an undertaking that he/she is neither an office-bearers nor in any other way related to any of the organizations being considered for a grant in that CFPG meeting
If an Expert is found to have recommended the proposal of his/her organization, the Expert and his/her organization may be debarred from selection in that particular meeting

schemes.scheme_name: Cash Incentive Award to Bonafede Meritorious Sportspersons
schemes.brief_description: Details The Incentive Awards in the form of Cash assistance to Meritorious Sports Persons of Sikkim constitute a Government policy aimed at encouraging the youth to pave their future by engaging themselves in any sports. The scheme seeks to promote all-round development physically, socially, mentall
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Incentive Awards in the form of Cash assistance to Meritorious Sports Persons of Sikkim constitute a Government policy aimed at encouraging the youth to pave their future by engaging themselves in any sports. The scheme seeks to promote all-round development physically, socially, mentally and emotionally, thereby, contributing to the overall wellbeing of citizens in general. The award has been introduced with a view to encourage and motivate sportspersons in their pursuit of excellence. The scheme applies for sub-junior/cadet, junior and senior level of sports competitions with equal quantum of awards for both men & women. However, the achievement in an unauthorized or invitational tournament will not be considered under this scheme. Only tournaments organized under the aegis of Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports/ SAI/ recognized Sports Federation at the zonal, national and international levels will be eligible. The disbursement of the cash award under this scheme is organized annually. Eligibility is restricted to sports persons who are Bonafide domiciles of Sikkim. ﻿ ﻿

benefits.summary: 1. Recognition and motivation 2. Financial Support 3. Equal Opportunities/ Gender equality across all age group 4. Promotion of Sports culture 5. Holistic development of individual ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: 1. Recognition and motivation 2. Financial Support 3. Equal Opportunities/ Gender equality across all age group 4. Promotion of Sports culture 5. Holistic development of individual ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility 1. Medal winner in recognized Games/Competitions/ Tournaments/ Championship etc. 2. Eligible for Zonal Level Competitions and above. 3. Bonafede/possessing domicile of Sikkim State 4. Tournaments organized under the aegis of Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports/ SAI/ recognized Sports Federation. 5. Both Olympic and Non-Olympic Sports Disciplines 6. Achievement in Veteran tournaments is not included in this scheme. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: No Documents required for this Scheme

application_process: Invites application through State Sports Associations in format 2
Screening by the Department Committee 3
Approval of the Government 4
Preparation of cash Award for eligible sports persons in terms of Government Notification 5
Disbursement of Cash Awards in any occasion e
National Sports Day, State Government functions etc

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme " Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tribe Sportsperson Students" was launched in 1996 by the Department of Tribal Area Development, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to promote and encourage sports participation among Scheduled Tribe (ST) students residing in scheduled areas of
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme " Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tribe Sportsperson Students" was launched in 1996 by the Department of Tribal Area Development, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to promote and encourage sports participation among Scheduled Tribe (ST) students residing in scheduled areas of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, cash awards, certificates, and mementos are provided as a form of encouragement to Scheduled Tribe sportspersons students who secure the top three positions in national and international sports events.

benefits.summary: Students who have secured top positions at national and international levels are rewarded with the following incentives as a form of encouragement: Cash Prize Certificate of Appreciation Memento
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Students who have secured top positions at national and international levels are rewarded with the following incentives as a form of encouragement: Cash Prize Certificate of Appreciation Memento

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a student. The applicant should be a resident of Scheduled Tribe area of Rajasthan. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category. The applicant should participate in a national or international-level sports competition. The applicant should have secured a top-three position at national or international level competition.

required_documents.document_name: Domicile Certificate (Proof of residence in a Scheduled Tribe area)

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications: For districts under Tribal Sub-Plan: Commissioner, Tribal Area Development Department / Deputy Commissioner, Tribal Area Development Department For non-TSP (Tribal Sub-Plan) areas: Chief Executive Officer, Zila Parishad
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Concerned Tribal Area Development Department office/Chief Executive Officer, Zila Parishad

schemes.scheme_name: Commemoration of Jubilees/Birth Anniversaries of Tiatr Artistes of Yesteryears
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Commemoration of Jubilees/Birth Anniversaries of Tiatr Artistes of Yesteryears" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make our younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of Tiatr art
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Commemoration of Jubilees/Birth Anniversaries of Tiatr Artistes of Yesteryears" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make our younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of Tiatr artistes of yesteryears. The scheme provides for organizing functions to celebrate jubilee/birth anniversaries of deceased Tiatr artistes, including wide publicity through print and electronic media, display and garlanding of portraits, cultural programmes (tiatr and songs), and financial assistance along with provision of auditoriums/halls and additional amounts for village programmes. Applications for this scheme are accepted at least 30 days in advance on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: An amount as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Auditorium/Hall Provision: Provision of an auditorium or hall by the Tiatr Academy of Goa to stage the programme. Additional Financial Assistance for Village Programmes: An additional amount as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for hall charges or stage erection charges if the programme is held in a village. Programme Staging: A maximum of 4 shows at 4 different places, including 3 shows in Panaji, Margao, Curchorem, Vasco, or
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: An amount as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Auditorium/Hall Provision: Provision of an auditorium or hall by the Tiatr Academy of Goa to stage the programme. Additional Financial Assistance for Village Programmes: An additional amount as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for hall charges or stage erection charges if the programme is held in a village. Programme Staging: A maximum of 4 shows at 4 different places, including 3 shows in Panaji, Margao, Curchorem, Vasco, or any other city, and 1 show compulsorily staged in the artiste’s area of residence. Optional Additional Shows: An additional 2 shows may be granted for performance in villages only, subject to the availability of funds, at an amount (as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa) plus an additional amount (as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa) for Pandal/Hall/Auditorium including Stage, Sound, etc.. Publicity: Wide publicity will be given through print and electronic media. Banner Provision: One banner for Tiatr performances, to be collected from and returned to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa, must be displayed on the front side wing of the stage. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an organizing institution or an individual. The applicant must propose a programme to celebrate jubilee/birth anniversaries of artistes of yesteryears who are no longer living. The applicant must ensure the programme aims to make the younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of these Tiatr artistes. The applicant must ensure the programme includes the narration of the history of the life of the late artiste to whom the programme is dedicated. The applicant must ensure the family members of the deceased artiste are compulsorily invited for the function. The applicant must give the proposal well in advance, providing all details of the programme, including typed script and lyrics to be presented, and the names of the artistes. The applicant must insert/publish/announce "This programme is held in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa" in all advertisements, whether oral, print, or electronic media, and on banners. The applicant must display the Tiatr Academy of Goa’s banner on the front side wing of the stage if it is a Tiatr, and return it after all shows. The applicant must display a banner of minimum size 6ft.x10 ft. carrying the Tiatr Academy of Goa’s logo as a back drop if it is a Musical Show. The applicant must discuss with the Tiatr Academy of Goa and decide about the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour well in advance. The applicant must ensure the President/Vice President of the Tiatr Academy of Goa will either be the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour at the function. The applicant must ensure the duration of the programme is at least 2 hours. The applicant must ensure there are no adverse remarks made in any form, either written or verbal, against any Government/Individual/Institution, etc., or anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting religious sentiments. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: • No Objection Certificate (From Nearest Family Member/s of the deceased artiste)
• Proposal (Including Typed Script, Lyrics, And Names Of Artistes)
• Statement Of Expenditure (Enclosing All Original Bills, Stamped Receipt If Amount Exceeds ₹5,000/-)
• Photographs Of The Function (5 Copies, Two Showing Tiatr Academy Of Goa’s Banner)

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The application must be submitted to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days in advance of the proposed programme date
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds

schemes.scheme_name: Appointment of Contract Sports Coaches
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Appointment of Contract Sports Coaches” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to appoint sports coaches on a contract basis to ensure the smooth functioning of local training camps for various sports across the state. ﻿
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Appointment of Contract Sports Coaches” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to appoint sports coaches on a contract basis to ensure the smooth functioning of local training camps for various sports across the state. ﻿

benefits.summary: Every year, around 250 coaches benefit from these training camps and gain employment. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Every year, around 250 coaches benefit from these training camps and gain employment. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a sportsperson or a coach from Uttarakhand. The applicant must be between 21 and 70 years of age. The applicant must possess the relevant educational and sports qualifications. The sports coach is not required to be a domicile or permanent resident of Uttarakhand. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Submission of documents is required in accordance with the department's guidelines to avail the benefits of the scheme.

application_process: Offline The department organizes local training camps for various sports every year
To ensure the smooth functioning of these camps, sports coaches are appointed on a contractual basis
At the district level, applications for conducting local training camps are submitted by the District Sports Officers
Each year, a notification regarding the scheme is published in daily newspapers, usually in the month of March
The training camps are then organized for a maximum duration of 11 months, from 15th April to 15th March

schemes.scheme_name: Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT) – Artiste’s Pension
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT) – Artiste’s Pension" by the Dept. of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur provides a monthly pension of up to ₹ 4,000/- to the aged reputed artists who have contributed to making the tradition, culture, and art forms of Manipur more vib
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT) – Artiste’s Pension" by the Dept. of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur provides a monthly pension of up to ₹ 4,000/- to the aged reputed artists who have contributed to making the tradition, culture, and art forms of Manipur more vibrant by working in various fields of arts such as Theatre (traditional/modern) / Shumang Leela / Nupi Leela / Mime/ Classical Dance / Traditional Dance / Folk Dance / Tribal Dance, etc.

benefits.summary: Category A: Awardees & Gurus (150 number) @ ₹ 4,000/- per month will be supported. Category B: Non-Awardees (850 number) @ ₹ 2,500/- per month will be supported.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Category A: Awardees & Gurus (150 number) @ ₹ 4,000/- per month will be supported. Category B: Non-Awardees (850 number) @ ₹ 2,500/- per month will be supported.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a domicile of the State of Manipur. The applicant should be an Artist. The applicant should be 60 years or above in age, as of 1st April of the current financial year. The applicant should not be employed in any public/private undertakings. For Category (A): The applicant should be a National / State Awardee, such as Padma Awardee, Sangeet Natak Akademi, Sahitya Akademi, Lalit Kala Akademi or Manipur State Kala Akademi Awardee, Manipur State Film Development Society or National Award Winners in Film. For Category (B): The applicant should have made a substantial contribution to the preservation and promotion of Arts during his / her young age and should be a well-known artiste recognized by a competent authority of Government including Shree Shree Govindaji Temple Board, Sanamahi Temple Board for Sankirtana and Lai Haraoba or recommended by any reputed registered organizations authorized by the Government, etc in the concerned field. The income of the applicant including that of the spouse from all sources should not exceed ₹ 1,50,000/- per annum. Any dependent spouse of the Artiste who enjoyed Pension and Medial benefits under the CMAT shall be eligible for financial assistance / medical assistance. ﻿ Reservation/Preference/Priority: The artiste who is in indigent circumstances will be given preference.

required_documents.document_name: Residential/Domicile Certificate of the State of Manipur
Life Certificate to be issued either by any Gazetted Officer / SDC / SDO / Elected Councillor / MLA etc.
Income Certificate to be issued by Gazetted Officer / SDC / SDO / Elected Councillor / MLA etc.
Bio Data with Relevant Supporting Documents/Certificates
Proof of Age / Date of Birth

After selection for the pension scheme, the artiste should submit Life Certificate duly certified by authorities every six months to the Department of Art & Culture, Government of Manipur failing which subsequent pension will not be released.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The applicant should take print of the format of the application form provided in the scheme guidelines
Step 2: The applicant should fill in all the mandatory fields and attach all the (self-attested) required documents

Step 3: The duly filled-in application form should be submitted to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Manipur office at Palace Compound, Imphal along with a cover letter addressed to the Director (Art & Culture)

schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT) - Scheme for Award to Distinguished Artistes" is a scheme by the Dept. of Art & Culture, Govt. of Manipur, to encourage and felicitate the artistes (in the field of culture) belonging to different fields for their achievements such as winning National Awards namely Padma Awards, Sangeet Natak Akademi, Sahitya Akademi, Lalit Kala Akademi Awards including Young Awardees, National Film Award winners and on winning any national level competitions, and International Awards in the field of Art & Culture.

benefits.summary: Individual (Young Awardees / Competition Winner) – 15 numbers @ ₹ 50,000/- each (once a year) Individual (Senior Awardees) – 15 numbers @ ₹ 1,00,000/- each (once in a year) Group (Competition Winner – Young) – 5 numbers @ ₹ 1,00,000/- each (once a year) Group (Competition Winner – Senior) – 5 numbers @ ₹ 1,50,000/- each (once a year) The award money will be released to the personal account of the beneficiary/group through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Individual (Young Awardees / Competition Winner) – 15 numbers @ ₹ 50,000/- each (once a year) Individual (Senior Awardees) – 15 numbers @ ₹ 1,00,000/- each (once in a year) Group (Competition Winner – Young) – 5 numbers @ ₹ 1,00,000/- each (once a year) Group (Competition Winner – Senior) – 5 numbers @ ₹ 1,50,000/- each (once a year) The award money will be released to the personal account of the beneficiary/group through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a domicile of the state of Manipur. The applicant should be National Award winners viz Padma Awardee, Sangeet Natak Akademi Awardee, Sahitya Akademi Awardee, Lalit Kala Akademi Awardee, and Zonal Cultural Centre’s Award including Young Awardees, National Level Competition, and National Film Awards for individuals and groups. The award winners whose age is below 40 will come under the Young / Junior category and those above 40 will come under Senior Category. ﻿ Note 1: The scheme will cover those awards announced or received during the current financial year and current calendar year. Note 2: The selection of artistes for Awards / Felicitation will be done by a Screening / Selection Committee constituted by the Government.

schemes.brief_description: Details Musical instruments or equipment have been essential items for the students and artistes to carry out their learning or performance. The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT): Support for Purchase of Instruments / Equipment" by the Department of Art and Culture, Govt. of Man
schemes.detailed_description: Details Musical instruments or equipment have been essential items for the students and artistes to carry out their learning or performance. The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT): Support for Purchase of Instruments / Equipment" by the Department of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur aims to support many talented students and budding artistes, who are economically well but in need of instruments/equipment for their learning and performance purpose to help them groom towards professionalism. In every academic year, 300 students will be supported through this scheme.

benefits.summary: Reimbursement towards the purchase of instruments/equipment. In every academic year, 300 students will be supported. The applicant may avail of the benefit of this scheme twice during his studentship with a gap of one year. ﻿ Note: The extent of financial assistance will be decided by the Screening Committee.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Reimbursement towards the purchase of instruments/equipment. In every academic year, 300 students will be supported. The applicant may avail of the benefit of this scheme twice during his studentship with a gap of one year. ﻿ Note: The extent of financial assistance will be decided by the Screening Committee.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Manipur. The applicant should be a Student at one of the following institutes: Government Dance College, Shree Shree Bal Mukunda Dev Music College, Imphal Art College, Manipur University of Culture, Jawaharlal Nehru Manipur Dance Academy, and Manipur University (Dance, Music, and Fine Art Department). The applicant should be pursuing a course in one of the art forms. The applicant should be below 30 years of age (age to be reckoned on 1st April). The annual income of the parents, as well as the applicant, should be less than ₹ 1,00,000/-.

Certificate from the teacher on the requirement of instruments/equipment.
Income Certificate (issued by a Gazetted Officer)
Bill / Voucher for purchasing the equipment/instrument.

schemes.scheme_name: Chief Ministergi Artistessingi Tengbang - Assistance To The Cultural Group For Training With New Production
schemes.brief_description: Details Manipur is widely known for its varied traditions and culture belonging to different communities that have been passed on from generation to generation through practice and oral traditions. The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistessingi Tengbang - Assistance to the Cultural Group for Training wi
schemes.detailed_description: Details Manipur is widely known for its varied traditions and culture belonging to different communities that have been passed on from generation to generation through practice and oral traditions. The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistessingi Tengbang - Assistance to the Cultural Group for Training with New Production" by the Department of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur aims at providing financial assistance to registered cultural groups that have been relentlessly working on providing training to the younger generation with new products to enrich the traditions, art forms, and culture. ﻿

benefits.summary: Category (A) (For Registered Groups above 25 Years with a minimum of 15 productions) Theatres: Traditional / Modern / Shumang Leela Dance: Classical / Folk / Tribal Dance Music: Hindustani / Sankirtana / Folk / Tribal Music Visual Arts: Painting / Sculpture / Graphic Literature: ﻿ Category (B) (For Registered Groups above 3 years and below 25 Years) Theatres: Traditional/Modern/Shumang Leela: Dance: Classical/Folk/Tribal Dance Music: Hindustani/Sankirtana/Folk/Tribal Music Visual Arts: Painting
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Category (A) (For Registered Groups above 25 Years with a minimum of 15 productions) Theatres: Traditional / Modern / Shumang Leela Dance: Classical / Folk / Tribal Dance Music: Hindustani / Sankirtana / Folk / Tribal Music Visual Arts: Painting / Sculpture / Graphic Literature: ﻿ Category (B) (For Registered Groups above 3 years and below 25 Years) Theatres: Traditional/Modern/Shumang Leela: Dance: Classical/Folk/Tribal Dance Music: Hindustani/Sankirtana/Folk/Tribal Music Visual Arts: Painting / Sculpture / Graphic Literature: Research & Book Publication (For individual) Training on Instrument Making / Costume Making (For individuals) ﻿ Mode of Release of Assistance: The amount of Assistance will be released to the account of the applicant/organization through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Only the residents/domiciles of the state of Manipur are eligible to apply to this scheme. ﻿ Eligibility: (Category A) Registered Groups (for all categories mentioned above) should have already made a minimum of 15 remarkable productions in the last 25 years. Registered Groups (for all categories mentioned above) should have given a performance/show in at least 3 or 4 National Festivals and participated in 3 or 4 State Level Programme. The applicant group (for all categories mentioned above) should not receive any kind of assistance from any other sources for the same purpose. ﻿ Eligibility: (Category B) Registered Groups (for all categories mentioned above) should have already made a minimum production of their organization as below: Minimum 5 remarkable productions for the registered group of 3 above 15 years. Minimum 6-10 remarkable production for the registered group of 15 above 25 years. Registered Groups (for all categories mentioned above) should have given performance/show in at least 3 or 4 State Level or National Level Programme The applicant group (for all categories mentioned above) should not receive any kind of assistance from any other sources for the same purpose For Visual Art, Research & Book Publication, and Instrument / Costume Making, individual artists/artists/writers/artisans who have enough knowledge in their respective fields will be eligible. Research & Book Publication should be based on Manipuri culture and also the translation of (a) old manuscripts to modern Manipuri language only (b) the books of other languages on art & culture to Manipuri language which may be used as reference. ﻿ Method of Selection: The selection of artists/groups will be done by a Screening / Selection Committee constituted by the Government.

required_documents.document_name: Detail proposal with an estimated cost
Bank Account Detail (for Individual / Registered group)
Last 3 years’ Audited Statement of Accounts (for the group)
Utilization Certificate of previous grants / financial assistance
Detailed Report of the Remarkable Productions with supporting documents that qualify the group to apply for CMAT.
Bio Data (for the individual artiste) or Activities Report (for the group) with relevant supporting documents/certificates

application_process: Offline Step 1: The applicant should take print of the format of the application form ﻿ provided in the scheme guidelines
Step 2: The applicant should fill in all the mandatory fields and attach all the (self-attested) required documents

Step 3: The duly filled-in application form should be submitted to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Manipur office at Palace Compound, Imphal along with a cover letter addressed to the Director (Art & Culture) latest by a month before the travel schedule
schemes.ministry_department: Department of Art and Culture
schemes.implementing_agency: Department of Art and Culture

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT) – Scheme of Festival Assistance for Participating in International & National Festival" is a scheme by the Dept. of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur. Through this scheme, the artists will be extended a sum of financial assistance to
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT) – Scheme of Festival Assistance for Participating in International & National Festival" is a scheme by the Dept. of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur. Through this scheme, the artists will be extended a sum of financial assistance to meet their travel costs and journey costs when they are invited to participate in International Festivals abroad with conditions that they have to bear international travel costs, visa fees, performance remuneration, etc.

benefits.summary: The expenditure will be reimbursed to the applicant through DBT after receipt of all bill / vouchers / tickets / Boarding Pass etc in original. ﻿ For International Festival: 1. Individual artiste (3 Nos.) once a year will be supported. 2. Group Artistes (3 Nos. of the registered cultural group) once a year will be supported. ﻿ For National Festival: 1. Individual artiste (3 Nos.) once a year will be supported. 2. Group Artistes (3 Nos. of the registered cultural group) once a year will be suppor
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The expenditure will be reimbursed to the applicant through DBT after receipt of all bill / vouchers / tickets / Boarding Pass etc in original. ﻿ For International Festival: 1. Individual artiste (3 Nos.) once a year will be supported. 2. Group Artistes (3 Nos. of the registered cultural group) once a year will be supported. ﻿ For National Festival: 1. Individual artiste (3 Nos.) once a year will be supported. 2. Group Artistes (3 Nos. of the registered cultural group) once a year will be supported.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility For International Festival Assistance: The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the State of Manipur. The applicant should be an Artist. The individual artists or groups should have already given a performance/show in at least 2/3 of the National Festival recognized by the National Academies / Zonal Cultural Centres / Ministry of Culture, Government of India / Culture Department of State Government. The individual artists or groups should have participated in 3/4 of the State Level Programme. The applicant individual or group should not have been sponsored wholly by any individual or institution for the same purpose. ﻿ For National Festival Assistance: The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the State of Manipur. The applicant should be an Artist. The individual artists or groups should have already given a performance/show in at least 3/4 of recognized National Festivals. The individual artists or groups should have participated in 3/4 State Level Programmes. The applicant individual or group should not have been sponsored wholly by any individual or institution for the same purpose. ﻿ Method of Selection: The selection of artists/groups will be done by a Screening / Selection Committee constituted by the Government. This Committee will also decide whether a festival/event is to be considered an International or National Festival.

required_documents.document_name: Ticket Copies (both Bus / Train / Air) with the list of Artistes.
Bank Account Detail (for Individual / Registered group).
Bio-Data of the individual artiste or activities report of the group with relevant supporting documents.
Receipt of all bills / vouchers / tickets / Boarding Pass etc in original.

Step 3: The duly filled-in application form should be submitted to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Manipur office at Palace Compound, Imphal along with a cover letter addressed to the Director (Art & Culture) latest by a month before the travel schedule

schemes.scheme_name: Cash Prize to Players and their Coaches for Winning Medals in National and International Competitions
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Cash Prize to Players and Their Coaches for Winning Medals in National and International Competitions” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to recognize and honor players and their coaches from the state who have achieved remarkable
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Cash Prize to Players and Their Coaches for Winning Medals in National and International Competitions” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to recognize and honor players and their coaches from the state who have achieved remarkable success and won medals at the national and international level in the field of sports. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, athletes who achieve significant success at the national and international levels, along with their coaches, are awarded cash prizes. There is a provision to award prize money ranging from a minimum of ₹10,000/- to a maximum of ₹2 crore. ﻿ ﻿ Detailed information about the awards is available on the department's website: https://sports.uk.gov.in . ﻿ ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under this scheme, athletes who achieve significant success at the national and international levels, along with their coaches, are awarded cash prizes. There is a provision to award prize money ranging from a minimum of ₹10,000/- to a maximum of ₹2 crore. ﻿ ﻿ Detailed information about the awards is available on the department's website: https://sports.uk.gov.in . ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Players and their coaches from Uttarakhand who have achieved remarkable success at the national and international levels in the field of sports are eligible. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Complete Details and Certificate of the Competition in which the medal has been won
One year sports diploma of the coach or equivalent or 06 weeks certificate
Certificate of training of the National Association of the concerned sport
Details related to the training of the coach on a stamp paper of ₹ 10 / - (by which the player has been regularly trained for at least 180 days or more a year before the medal win)
Bank Account Number of the Coach

National School Games medal winners by the School Education Department, World / All India University Competition / Championship medal winners by the Higher Education Department / University, Khelo India, Indian Rural Sports Competition / National Women Sports Festival medal winners by the Youth Welfare Department and All India Police Sports Competition / World Police / Fire Games medal winners by Uttarakhand Police Department It will be mandatory to get the sports certificates

application_process: Offline Offline applications are invited twice a year by the Sports Directorate
Applications are accepted in the month of January for prize distribution of games held from 01 January to 30 June, and again in July for prize distribution of games held from 01 July to 31 December
The application form can be downloaded from the department’s website

The form must be accompanied by the following documents: the athlete’s Aadhaar card, bank account number, passport-size photograph, details of the medal won at the competition along with complete certificates, permanent residence certificate of Uttarakhand, and the coach’s qualification documents (either a one-year sports diploma or an equivalent certificate, or a six-week training certificate issued by the National Federation of the concerned sport)

In addition, a declaration on a ₹10/- stamp paper must be provided, certifying that the player has been regularly trained by the coach for at least 180 days during the one year preceding the medal achievement
The coach’s Aadhaar card and bank account details must also be submitted

It is mandatory for medal-winning players of the National School Games to get their sports certificates verified by the School Education Department; for winners of World/All India University Competitions or Championships by the Higher Education Department/University; for winners of Khelo India, Indian Rural Sports Competitions, or National Women’s Sports Festivals by the Youth Welfare Department; and for winners of All India Police Sports Competitions or World Police/Fire Games by the Uttarakhand Police Department

After verification, the application form must be submitted to the Sports Directorate within the stipulated period along with the recommendation of the concerned department, institution, or recognized State Sports Association
Once the documents are examined and verified by the Sports Directorate, the prize money is released to both the player and the coach
schemes.ministry_department: Department of Sports
schemes.implementing_agency: Department of Sports

schemes.scheme_name: Children's Tiatr Competition
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Children's Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage the development of Tiatr by providing a platform for children aged up to 16 years to participate in traditional Konkani t
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Children's Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage the development of Tiatr by providing a platform for children aged up to 16 years to participate in traditional Konkani theatre productions, addressing the growing enthusiasm among students and individuals to involve children in Tiatr activities. The scheme provides financial support to participating groups and awards mementos and certificates across multiple categories including best performance, individual artistes, direction, technical aspects, and musical components. The applicant must ensure all child performers are aged 16 years or below on the application submission date and themes must be compulsorily based on the lives of children only. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline through prescribed application forms. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial support as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Financial assistance covers expenditure towards Music (Live Band with at least two blowing instruments), Light Effects, Stage Setting, Background Music, Make up, Costumes, Refreshments for rehearsals, and Transport. All payments made by cheques in the name of the Educational Institutions, Sports and Cultural Associations, or Individual Producer. Free DVD copy of the recorded performance provided to the producer or director. Mementos and certifi
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial support as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Financial assistance covers expenditure towards Music (Live Band with at least two blowing instruments), Light Effects, Stage Setting, Background Music, Make up, Costumes, Refreshments for rehearsals, and Transport. All payments made by cheques in the name of the Educational Institutions, Sports and Cultural Associations, or Individual Producer. Free DVD copy of the recorded performance provided to the producer or director. Mementos and certificates awarded to winners in different categories (No Cash Prizes). Video recording of all tiatrs for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa Library. First three award winners of the previous year's Children Tiatr Competition get direct entry into the festival. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an Educational Institution, Sports and Cultural Association, or Individual Producer. The applicant must ensure all child performers are aged up to 16 years on the date fixed for submission of application. The applicant must ensure themes of Tiatr are compulsorily based on the lives of children only. The applicant must ensure the duration of the tiatr is not less than one hour and a half and not more than two hours and a half (including interval of minimum 10 minutes and maximum 15 minutes). The applicant must present the Tiatr in the traditional format as approved by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must ensure the Tiatr has 6 to 7 acts (podd'dde) with at least 4 cantos. The applicant must ensure comedy is linked to the story of the play. The applicant must include at least 8 Kantaram which should include 1 duet (Interactive), 1 Duo (Interactive), 1 Trio (Interactive), 1 Quartet/Quintet (Interactive), 1 Choral Song and Solos. Priority The first three award winners of the previous year's Children Tiatr Competition will get a direct entry into this festival, provided their entries are received before due date. Other Conditions Not more than 2 shows of the given script must have been performed prior to the performance at the competition. No adverse remarks against any Governments, Individuals, Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the scripts, lyrics of songs, performances, or speeches. Artistes including technicians and backstage artistes whose names appear in the submitted list shall be permitted to participate only under that troupe (Only musicians can take part in more than one troupe). ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copies of Birth Certificate or Baptism Certificate for All Child Performers (Original Should Be Produced for Verification).
Certificate by the Headmaster or Headmistress of a Recognized School Certifying the Birth Date (Alternative to Birth/Baptism Certificate).
Self-Attested Copies of Permanent Account Number Card.
Typed Copy of the Complete Script of Tiatr.
Typed Copy of Lyrics of Kantaram.
Refundable Security Deposit of ₹3,000/- in the Form of Cash or Demand Draft in Favour of Member Secretary, Tiatr Academy of Goa Payable at Panaji.
Final Typed Copy of the Script.

application_process: Offline (The scheme announcement will be made in the local press
Wait for this official announcement before proceeding with the application) Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds
*If any applicant withdraws after the schedule is drawn by Tiatr Academy of Goa, full security deposit will stand forfeited
*15 Educational Institutions, Sports and Cultural Associations, or Individual Producers will be given an opportunity to participate
*In case Tiatr Academy of Goa receives more than 15 applications, a meeting of all applicants will be called and the selection of remaining 12 troupes will be done by lots
*In case any of the 15 participants withdraws from the competition, the vacant place will be filled by the Troupe which is first on the waiting list

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Await Script Scrutiny Feedback After submission, Tiatr Academy of Goa will scrutinize the script to verify whether it is related to the lives of children and check the interactive nature of kantaram
Feedback, if any, will be provided to the applicant within 10 days
The Academy has the right to make suggestions for improvement or reject the script completely if found unrelated to children's lives

Step 2: Participate in Selection Process (If Applicable) If more than 15 applications are received, attend the meeting called by Tiatr Academy of Goa where selection of the remaining 12 troupes will be done by lots
The first three award winners of the previous year get direct entry if their applications are received before the due date

Step 3: Submit Final Documentation Before Competition Submit the final typed copy of the script, typed copy of songs (kantaram), cast of the tiatr, and summary of songs to Tiatr Academy of Goa during office hours exactly 3 days before the date of commencement of the tiatr competition
Step 4: Participate in Competition Stage the Tiatr at the place and day identified by Tiatr Academy of Goa according to the announced schedule
The performance will be judged by a panel of judges appointed by the Academy, and their decision will be final and binding on all participants

schemes.scheme_name: Competition of Zomnivoilo Khell
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Competition of Zomnivoilo Khell" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve and promote the traditional folk theatre of Goa called 'The Khell', also known as 'Fell' or 'Zomnivoilo Khell', by orga
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Competition of Zomnivoilo Khell" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve and promote the traditional folk theatre of Goa called 'The Khell', also known as 'Fell' or 'Zomnivoilo Khell', by organizing annual competitions in different parts of Goa to maintain this cultural heritage for future generations. The scheme provides financial assistance towards production costs for participating troupes and creates a platform for showcasing traditional Khell performances through structured competition format. The applicant must be an institution or individual with a Khell that has been staged during the current carnival season and must comply with the traditional format requirements including 8 to 10 cantos with specific duration limits. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline through prescribed application forms. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial assistance towards production costs as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa from time to time. Mementos awarded to first three winning positions (no cash prizes). Video recording of all performances for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa library. Complimentary Digital Versatile Disc copy of the performance provided to the director. Platform for showcasing traditional Khell performances to wider audiences. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial assistance towards production costs as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa from time to time. Mementos awarded to first three winning positions (no cash prizes). Video recording of all performances for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa library. Complimentary Digital Versatile Disc copy of the performance provided to the director. Platform for showcasing traditional Khell performances to wider audiences. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an institution or individual organizing a Khell performance. The applicant must have staged the Khell during the current carnival season. The applicant must comply with the exact format of Zomnivoilo Khell comprising 8 to 10 songs called Cantos. The applicant must ensure each canto consists of 2 verses and one chorus with limited dialogues. The applicant must maintain the duration of each Khell between 40 to 60 minutes. The applicant must ensure comedy in the Khell is related to the story. The applicant must use traditional musical instruments including drums and two blowing instruments. The applicant must ensure no adverse remarks are made against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion. Artists can participate in only one group and one Khell (except musicians who can participate in multiple Khells). Mandatory attendance at discussion session on positive and negative aspects of performances. No adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion. The three Khell troupes which won 1st, 2nd, and 3rd places in the previous competition receive direct entry provided they apply within stipulated time. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self Attested Copy Of Aadhaar Card.
Self Attested Copy Of Permanent Account Number Card.
One Typed Copy Of The Script/Lyrics Of The Khell (Handwritten Copies Not Accepted).
Cast List With Names Of Characters And Artists.
Details Of Costumes, Live Music Band, Writer, And Director.
*Handwritten copies of script and lyrics are not accepted.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment

Selection Process If more than 12 applications are received, attend the meeting of all applicants where selection of 9 remaining troupes (after 3 direct entries from previous winners) will be done through lottery system
Step 1: Await Communication Wait for communication regarding the date, time, and place of staging of the Khell performances which will be provided well in advance to all selected participating groups

Step 2: Attend Mandatory Discussion Participate in the compulsory discussion session on positive and negative aspects of performances at the Conference Hall of Tiatr Academy of Goa, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Campal, Panjim on the appointed date and time
Step 3: Performance and Payment Perform the Khell as scheduled and receive the financial assistance cheque issued in the name of the applicant as mentioned in Serial Number 1 of the application form
schemes.ministry_department: Ministry of Electronics & IT (MeitY) Government of India ® Connect on Social Media Quick Lin
schemes.implementing_agency: Ministry of Electronics & IT (MeitY) Government of India ® Connect on Social Media Quick Lin

schemes.scheme_name: Documentation And Research Assistantship Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Documentation And Research Assistantship Scheme" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage documentation and digitisation of valuable Tiatr-related materials such as manuscripts, photos, handbi
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Documentation And Research Assistantship Scheme" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage documentation and digitisation of valuable Tiatr-related materials such as manuscripts, photos, handbills, advertisements, newspaper or magazine clippings, video and audio recordings that are with Tiatr artistes, tiatr lovers and institutions, addressing the high degree of risk that some of these materials may be lost to posterity if efforts are not undertaken to preserve and document them. The scheme provides assistance to possessors of Tiatr-related materials to organize and document their holdings. ﻿

benefits.summary: One-time Incentive: A reasonable amount as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be paid to the holder for converting materials into electronic formats. Hourly Honorarium: Documentation assistants will be paid an honorarium on clock-hour basis as determined by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Reimbursement: Tiatr Academy of Goa will reimburse costs incurred towards conversion according to rates determined by it if services of other agencies become necessary. Assistance provided to organize and document mate
benefits.raw_benefits_text: One-time Incentive: A reasonable amount as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be paid to the holder for converting materials into electronic formats. Hourly Honorarium: Documentation assistants will be paid an honorarium on clock-hour basis as determined by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Reimbursement: Tiatr Academy of Goa will reimburse costs incurred towards conversion according to rates determined by it if services of other agencies become necessary. Assistance provided to organize and document materials in holdings. Copy of digitised material provided to the holder on Digital Versatile Disc or Pen-drive. Professional documentation and preservation services. Conditions *The work done must be certified by the holder of the material. *Tiatr Academy of Goa will periodically review the work undertaken and accordingly extend or curtail the assistantship. *Holders must indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation tasks. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility For Material Holders The applicant must be a possessor of materials related to Tiatr such as manuscripts, photos, handbills, advertisements, newspaper or magazine clippings, video and audio recordings. The applicant must indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation and organization tasks. For Documentation Assistants The applicant must be willing to serve as Documentation Assistant. The applicant must be capable of performing tasks including compilation and organisation of materials, typing or word-processing of textual materials, scanning and converting by Optical Character Recognition, conversion of images by scanning or photographing with digital camera, and converting video or audio recordings from analogue to digital format. ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form

The form requires details including name of artiste or documentation assistant, complete address, contact number, email identification, Aadhaar Card number, and specific aspect of Tiatr on which documentation can be done
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields including personal details, contact information, and specify the aspect of Tiatr on which documentation work can be undertaken
Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *For material holders, indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation tasks, and may also indicate proximate candidates willing to undertake the documentation work
*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment received for future reference
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Assignment of Tasks Tiatr Academy of Goa will assign documentation tasks to candidates according to the requests received from the holders of materials
The academy will match documentation assistants with appropriate holders based on proximity and requirements

Step 2: Work Execution and Certification Documentation assistants will perform assigned tasks including compilation, organization, digitisation, and conversion of materials under the supervision and certification of the material holder
The quality and progress of work will be periodically reviewed by Tiatr Academy of Goa
Step 3: Payment and Delivery Upon completion and certification of work, documentation assistants will receive honorarium payment on clock-hour basis as determined by Tiatr Academy of Goa
A copy of digitised material will be provided to the holder on Digital Versatile Disc or Pen-drive, while Tiatr Academy of Goa will retain a similar copy for its uses
*The Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules of the scheme

schemes.scheme_name: D. D. Kosambi Research Fellowship Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa to encourage Goan Scholars to undertake research in the field of Goan history, culture, arts, social studies etc. Three fellowships shall be awarded, upto o
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa to encourage Goan Scholars to undertake research in the field of Goan history, culture, arts, social studies etc. Three fellowships shall be awarded, upto one at junior, upto one at senior & upto one at the post-doctoral level each for research in the specified areas every year. ﻿ Objectives To encourage the Goan scholars to undertake research in the areas of society, economy, polity, history, art and culture of Goa. Only topics that are closely connected to Goa will be accepted. However authentic topics pertaining to Goa may also be considered for the fellowship depending upon the decision taken by the selection committee constituted for the purpose. To create, promote and develop research activities in the State of Goa. To promote interdisciplinary research programmes in colleges and universities.

benefits.summary: Eligible scholars for the junior category shall be awarded a fellowship up to ₹ 15,000/- per month for a maximum period of 2 years, on a case-to-case basis. Eligible scholars for senior & post-doctoral categories shall be awarded a fellowship of ₹ 20,000/- per month for a maximum period of 2 years, on a case-to-case basis. However, the applicant who undertakes to complete the research work on a full-time basis may be awarded the scholarship upto ₹ 30,000/- per month. In such cases, the research
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Eligible scholars for the junior category shall be awarded a fellowship up to ₹ 15,000/- per month for a maximum period of 2 years, on a case-to-case basis. Eligible scholars for senior & post-doctoral categories shall be awarded a fellowship of ₹ 20,000/- per month for a maximum period of 2 years, on a case-to-case basis. However, the applicant who undertakes to complete the research work on a full-time basis may be awarded the scholarship upto ₹ 30,000/- per month. In such cases, the research period shall be as decided by the selection committee. ﻿ Number of Fellowships A maximum of one fellowship in each category shall be awarded every year. ﻿ NOTE: The amount of fellowship shall be assessed on the recommendation of the selection committee after the submission of his/her project.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Any individual who has completed post-graduation and is upto 35 years of age shall be eligible to undertake research in the junior category. Any individual who has completed post-graduation and is above the age of 35 shall be eligible to undertake research in the senior category. Any individual who has completed a PhD shall be eligible to undertake research in the post-doctoral category. There shall be no age bar in this category. The fellowship shall be awarded to any scholar only once in his lifetime under each category.

required_documents.document_name: Birth Certificate (Photo Copy Attested by Gazette Officer)
Fifteen Years Certificate of Residence in Goa/ Proof of Residence in Goa i.e. School Leaving Certificate etc.
Certificate of Passing of Maximum Qualification.

Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the ACO-II, Directorate of Art & Culture, Phone: 0832-2404623, Email: aco3-dac

schemes.scheme_name: District Level Sports School
schemes.brief_description: Details Launched in 2013-14, the scheme "District Level Sports School" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide intensive sports training and quality education to young athletes by establishing district-level sports schools under a Public-Privat
schemes.detailed_description: Details Launched in 2013-14, the scheme "District Level Sports School" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide intensive sports training and quality education to young athletes by establishing district-level sports schools under a Public-Private Partnership (PPP) model. The scheme seeks to identify sporting talent from events such as Khel Mahakumbh and train them using modern infrastructure, scientific methods, expert coaching, and proper nutrition, while ensuring access to formal school education. The initiative began with 9 schools (6 residential and 3 non-residential), and expanded to 24 schools by 2017-18, catering to over 2,500 students in 21 sports disciplines. Selected athletes receive benefits such as accommodation, food, school uniforms, books, sports kits, and equipment. An average of ₹2.25 lakh is spent per player annually, including ₹1 lakh Mediclaim security. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat (SAG). ﻿

benefits.summary: Monetary Support & Facilities: Players are provided with free education, stationery, books, accommodation, meals, school uniforms, and modern sports equipment and kits. Medical Insurance: A Mediclaim security cover of up to ₹1,00,000/- is provided to each selected athlete. Expert Coaching & Training: Intensive sports training is imparted in morning and evening sessions by expert coaches. In-school players receive additional training in 5 Physical Training (PT) periods. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Monetary Support & Facilities: Players are provided with free education, stationery, books, accommodation, meals, school uniforms, and modern sports equipment and kits. Medical Insurance: A Mediclaim security cover of up to ₹1,00,000/- is provided to each selected athlete. Expert Coaching & Training: Intensive sports training is imparted in morning and evening sessions by expert coaches. In-school players receive additional training in 5 Physical Training (PT) periods. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be below 14 years of age. The applicant must qualify under one of the following categories: Proven Talent (PT): The applicant should have already performed at School Games Federation of India (SGFI), State-level, or National-level sports events. The applicant must participate in a selection camp for final admission. Young Talent (YT): The applicant should have participated and secured first place at Taluka/District/Corporation level in Khel Mahakumbh (Under-9 or Under-11 category). The applicant must register for Khel Mahakumbh and undergo the selection process. In-School Talent: The applicant should be identified within a school already running the DLSS program. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

application_process: Offline For Young Talent: Step 1: The applicant must register under the Khel Mahakumbh before reaching 13 years of age
Step 2: Upon qualifying, the names are registered automatically by the authorities for the next stage of selection
For Proven Talent: Step 1: The applicant must send an email to dlss
com with basic details like age, academic standard, game, and achievements
Step 2: The authorities will process the application and contact the candidate for further steps

Contact Us: Director General, Sports Authority of Gujarat Sport,Youth & Cultural Activities Department Administrative Building, Sector 13-B, Near Kh-3 Circle, Near Vavol Railway Crossing, Beside EVM warehouse, Gandhinagar - 382016 Contact Number-97140 97760 ﻿

The third prize winner will receive a cash prize of ₹2,000/-. The participating organization will receive cash prizes based on their ranking.
