schemes.scheme_name: Financial Assistance to Troupes Going to Mumbai/Poona and Other Parts of the Country & Vice Versa
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Financial Assistance to Troupes Going to Mumbai/Poona and Other Parts of the Country & Vice Versa" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG), Goa, aims to compensate Goan dramatic troupes towards their transportation costs, recognizing that staging Tiatrs in Mumbai, Poona, and other part
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Financial Assistance to Troupes Going to Mumbai/Poona and Other Parts of the Country & Vice Versa" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG), Goa, aims to compensate Goan dramatic troupes towards their transportation costs, recognizing that staging Tiatrs in Mumbai, Poona, and other parts of the country is not always financially viable. The scheme provides financial support to cover transport expenses for Goan troupes staging a minimum of five shows of the same Tiatr in Mumbai/Poona, or for Mumbai/Poona troupes staging five shows in Goa. Benefits can also be availed for only one show staged in other locations such as Kolkata, Delhi, Gujarat, Nagpur, Bangalore, or Udaipur. Applications for this scheme are accepted one month in advance of the performance date, on a 'First Come First Serve' basis, and are subject to the availability of funds. ﻿

benefits.summary: The scheme provides financial support to compensate for transportation expenses incurred while staging Tiatrs, thereby promoting Goan Tiatr. The extent of the financial support shall be fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿ Conditions *The Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) may appoint a representative to witness the performance, and payments will be released based on their report. *A compulsory announcement stating ‘This Tiatr is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG)’ must be made b
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The scheme provides financial support to compensate for transportation expenses incurred while staging Tiatrs, thereby promoting Goan Tiatr. The extent of the financial support shall be fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿ Conditions *The Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) may appoint a representative to witness the performance, and payments will be released based on their report. *A compulsory announcement stating ‘This Tiatr is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG)’ must be made both before the commencement of the Tiatr and again during the interval. *No adverse remarks must be made, either in written or verbal form, against any Governments, Individuals, Institutions, or on the basis of caste, creed, or religion within the scripts, song lyrics, performances, or speeches. If such remarks are proven, the Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) reserves the right to disqualify the performance and either withhold payment or recall any payment already made to the applicant. *For performances at Mandd Sobhann, Mangalore, the payment will only be made after a certificate of performance is issued by the Mandd Sobhann. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility 1. The applicant must be the writer or director of the Tiatr. 2. The applicant must stage the Tiatr as per its traditional format. 3. The applicant's Tiatr must have 6 or 7 acts (podd’dde). 4. The applicant's Tiatr must include the following - At least 4 ‘cantos’ and comedy linked to the story of the play. At least 10 ‘Kantaram’. 5. The applicant's 'Kantaram' must include the following - At Least 2 Duets. At Least 1 Duo. At Least 1 Trio. At Least 1 Quartet/quintet. At Least 1 Choral Song and Solos. 6. The applicant must not have any adverse remark made in any form (written or verbal) against any Governments, Individuals, Institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion in the scripts, lyrics of songs, performances, speeches, etc., which may hurt the sentiments of anybody. 7. All advertisements, press notes, banners, tickets, and handbills must explicitly state that ‘This Tiatr is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG)’. 8. The applicant's troupe must stage a minimum of 5 shows of the same Tiatr in Mumbai/Poona (if a Goan troupe) or 5 shows in Goa (if a Mumbai/Poona troupe) to qualify for transport support. 9. The applicant's troupe can avail benefit even if only one show is staged in other places like Kolkata, Delhi, Gujarat, Nagpur, Bangalore, Udaipur, etc. 10. The applicant can avail the scheme only twice in a financial year for two different Tiatrs. ﻿ Earmarking 1. For performances at Mandd Sobhann at Mangalore, financial assistance is extended to two troupes from Goa. 2. Of these two Tiatrs for Mandd Sobhann, one should be from Commercial Troupes and one from a prize-winning Troupe of Goa Kala Academy ‘A’ Tiatr Competition. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: • Typed Copy of Script And Lyrics
• Hall Booking Proofs (Required one month in advance with the application)
• Self-Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card
• Letter of Authority (Required if hall/auditorium is booked in the name of a person other than the applicant)
• Letter from Organizers (Required as proof instead of hall booking receipts if the Tiatr is performed in Parishes)
• Receipts of Hall/Auditorium Booking (To be submitted to Tiatr Academy of Goa for making payments)
• Certificate of Performance (Issued by Mandd Sobhann, Mangalore, required for payment for performances there)
• 5 Photographs of the Performance on Stage (To be sent to the Tiatr Academy of Goa for records)
*If the halls/auditoriums are booked in the name of any person other than the applicant, the applicant must provide a letter of authority to that person stating authorization for booking.
*In case the Tiatr is performed in Parishes, a letter from the organizers to this effect should be produced as proof instead of hall booking receipts.
*The applicant must send 5 photographs of the performance on stage to the Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) for records.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
The form may also be obtained directly from the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa, requiring a physical visit to the office for collection
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 Deadline: The submission must be made at least one month in advance of the scheduled performance date
*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Await Performance Witnessing and Verification Upon application, the Tiatr Academy of Goa may choose to appoint and depute its own representative to witness the Tiatr performance
This representative will observe the show in Mumbai, Poona, or any other specified location and subsequently submit a report to the Tiatr Academy of Goa for review
﻿ Step 2: Release of Financial Assistance Based on the report provided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa's representative, the financial assistance payments will be released to the concerned applicant
For Tiatrs performed at Mandd Sobhann in Mangalore, the payment will be disbursed only after a formal certificate of performance has been issued by Mandd Sobhann, Mangalore

schemes.brief_description: Details The “Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists” scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial security to artists who are aged, physically disabled, and living in extreme poverty. Under this scheme, mon
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists” scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial security to artists who are aged, physically disabled, and living in extreme poverty. Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance is provided to artists and their dependents who are physically disabled, above 60 years of age, have a monthly income of less than ₹600, and are unable to sustain themselves due to age or disability. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to artists to help them sustain themselves in old age or in case of disability. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to artists to help them sustain themselves in old age or in case of disability. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant must be an artist who has made significant contributions in the field of art and literature. The applicant must be 60 years of age or above. The applicant must have a monthly income of less than ₹600/- (₹7,200/- annually). The applicant must be physically disabled. The applicant must be in poor economic condition. ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should write the application on plain paper
Step 2: Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required) along with the application
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the documents to the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department

schemes.scheme_name: Financial Assistance to Indigent Artistes
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Financial Assistance to Indigent Artistes" was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month to indigent artists aged 50 years and above and contributions to music, dance, drama, folk, painting and s
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Financial Assistance to Indigent Artistes" was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month to indigent artists aged 50 years and above and contributions to music, dance, drama, folk, painting and sculpture etc. The indigent artists resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry either by birth or by domicile. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance of ₹1,000/- per month.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance of ₹1,000/- per month.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an indigent artist. The applicant's age should be 50 years and above. The annual income is less than ₹24,000/-. The applicant should contribute to music, dance, drama, folk, painting, and sculpture. The applicant should not be the recipient of any other assistance from any other Organizations. The applicant should be a resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry either by birth or by domicile. The applicant’s wife/children shall be eligible to receive assistance after the death of the indigent artist.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Department of Art and Culture, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the superintendent, Department of Art and Culture,1, Romain Rolland Street, Puducherry
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the superintendent to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

Applicable to national medalists and international participants, it ensures their holistic development.

3. Utilization certificate for the previous grant released.
4. A certificate giving justification for the continuance of the scholarship issued by the Director/Head of the Department duly forwarded by the Registrar/Principal.

schemes.scheme_name: Financial Grant for Sports Associations
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Financial Grant for Sports Associations" by the Tourism, Art-Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to support recognized sports associations in organizing and promoting various sports activities in the state. Under this scheme, financial gra
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Financial Grant for Sports Associations" by the Tourism, Art-Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to support recognized sports associations in organizing and promoting various sports activities in the state. Under this scheme, financial grants are provided to sports associations that meet the eligibility criteria to conduct training camps, host competitions, and encourage sports development.

benefits.summary: Financial grants are provided to recognized state-level sports associations for organizing sports competitions and training camps. Assistance is offered for conducting training camps before national-level competitions for selected players. ﻿ NOTE: The grant includes coverage for competition organization costs, training camp expenses, and administrative support. The funds are disbursed based on the recommendations of the committee constituted under Jharkhand Sports Policy 2022.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial grants are provided to recognized state-level sports associations for organizing sports competitions and training camps. Assistance is offered for conducting training camps before national-level competitions for selected players. ﻿ NOTE: The grant includes coverage for competition organization costs, training camp expenses, and administrative support. The funds are disbursed based on the recommendations of the committee constituted under Jharkhand Sports Policy 2022.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The association should be a recognized state sports association registered under the Jharkhand State Registration Department. The association must be affiliated with the Jharkhand Olympic Association and the relevant National Sports Federation. The association association should have district-level units functioning in at least 18 districts of the state. Para-sports associations or associations related to sports included in the Olympics, Asian Games, or Commonwealth Games are eligible. Associations for other sports require at least 15 affiliated districts. ﻿ ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Registration Certificate (from the Jharkhand State Registration Department)
Affiliation Letter (from the Jharkhand Olympic Association and the National Sports Federation)
Bank Account Details (Nationalized Bank) with Proof
Audit Reports of the Last 3 Years
An Undertaking Ensuring Compliance with Departmental Guidelines
Details of District-Level Units (at least 18 districts)
Supporting Documents for the Proposed Sports Activities
An Official Letter Declaring the Association’s Independent Website Link

application_process: Offline Obtain the Application Form: Download the prescribed application form from the Directorate of Sports and Youth Affairs' official website
Fill Out the Form: Provide complete details about the association, including registration details, affiliations, and proposed activities
Attach Documents: Attach all required documents, such as audit reports, PAN card, and bank account details
Submit the Application: Submit the filled application form along with documents to the Directorate of Sports and Youth Affairs, Ranchi, or through the online application portal
﻿ Additional Requirements: The association must have a functional independent website
A PAN card and a nationalized bank account are mandatory
The association must submit the audit report of the last three years
Associations affiliated with National Federations receiving central government grants for specific projects cannot apply for state grants for the same purpose

schemes.scheme_name: Film Finance Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The Film Finance Scheme of Assam plays a crucial role in boosting the regional film industry by providing financial support to filmmakers. It aims to promote the creation of high-quality films that showcase the rich cultural heritage and talent of Assam. The scheme recognizes the importance
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Film Finance Scheme of Assam plays a crucial role in boosting the regional film industry by providing financial support to filmmakers. It aims to promote the creation of high-quality films that showcase the rich cultural heritage and talent of Assam. The scheme recognizes the importance of cinema as a powerful medium of storytelling and seeks to encourage local filmmakers to produce engaging and impactful content. ﻿ Through this scheme, filmmakers can access funds at different stages of film production. Financial assistance is provided for script development, which helps in nurturing creative ideas and developing strong storytelling elements. Funding is also available for pre-production activities like casting, location scouting, and production design. Once the film enters the production stage, financial support covers various expenses, including equipment rental, shooting, and production crew wages. Post-production, marketing, and distribution costs are also eligible for funding under this scheme. ﻿ By offering financial aid, the Film Finance Scheme of Assam aims to create an enabling environment for filmmakers to realize their artistic vision, enhance the production quality of films, and promote the growth of the Assamese film industry. It not only supports established filmmakers but also encourages emerging talent to explore their creativity and contribute to the cinematic landscape of Assam. ﻿

benefits.summary: • Financial assistance at different stages of film production, including script development, pre-production, production, post-production, marketing, and distribution. • Support for both feature films and documentaries. • Access to professional guidance and expertise. • Opportunities for exposure and recognition within the industry. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: • Financial assistance at different stages of film production, including script development, pre-production, production, post-production, marketing, and distribution. • Support for both feature films and documentaries. • Access to professional guidance and expertise. • Opportunities for exposure and recognition within the industry. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility • Applicants must be Indian citizens and residents of Assam. • The film project should be in the Assamese language or any other recognized regional language of Assam. • Filmmakers must have a valid registration with the appropriate film bodies or associations. • The applicant should have a bank account in a recognized Indian bank. • The film project should have a well-developed script and a compelling storyline. • The applicant must demonstrate the feasibility and commercial viability of the project. • The project should have a clear budget and financial plan. • Filmmakers may be required to fulfill specific reporting and documentation requirements as per the scheme's guidelines. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Any additional documents: Depending on the specific requirements of the film finance scheme, there may be additional documents needed. These can include identification proof, address proof, certificates of registration with film associations or bodies, NOC (No Objection Certificate) from relevant authorities, or any other specific documents mentioned in the scheme guidelines.

application_process: Offline Download the application form https://filmfinance
in/portlets/film-finance from the official website
Fill in the required details accurately and completely
Attach supporting document Submit the application by visiting the designated government office
After submitting the application, it's advisable to follow up with the concerned department or officials to track the progress of your application

schemes.scheme_name: Girnar Arohan-Avrohan Competition
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Girnar Arohan-Avrohan Competition” by the Department of Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities, Government of Gujarat, aims to encourage physical endurance, sports participation, and cultural spirit among individuals by organizing an annual state-level stair-climbing competition o
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Girnar Arohan-Avrohan Competition” by the Department of Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities, Government of Gujarat, aims to encourage physical endurance, sports participation, and cultural spirit among individuals by organizing an annual state-level stair-climbing competition on Mount Girnar. Out of the 9,900 steps of the mountain, the competition mandates male participants to complete 5,500 steps and female participants to complete 2,200 steps. Participants who secure positions among the top 10 are rewarded with substantial cash prizes, thereby motivating individuals of all backgrounds to embrace physical challenges and celebrate Gujarat’s heritage. ﻿ ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prize: A total of ₹8,40,000/- is distributed among the first 10 winners. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize: A total of ₹8,40,000/- is distributed among the first 10 winners. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should be physically fit and willing to participate in the stair-climbing competition. The applicant should complete the required number of steps: 5,500 steps for men and 2,200 steps for women. ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form for the "Publication Support Scheme for Fine Arts" scheme
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, including career details in the field of art, photographs, or color slides of work (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority at the Academy office to whom the application has been submitted
Note: Applications for book publication are invited every year through advertisements in daily newspapers
Contact Us: Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department Block No
2, 8th Floor, Sardar Bhavan, (New Secretariat) Sector-10, Gandhinagar - 382 010
Phone: 079-23251374; 079-23252995 Mail: secsyc[at]gujarat[dot]gov[dot]in http://sycd

schemes.scheme_name: Grant to Films
schemes.brief_description: Details The Uttarakhand film policy - 2024 “Grant to Films” is implemented by the Department of Information and Public Relations, Government of Uttarakhand. The policy aims to promote film production in Uttarakhand by providing financial grants to films, TV serials, and web series shot in the state,
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Uttarakhand film policy - 2024 “Grant to Films” is implemented by the Department of Information and Public Relations, Government of Uttarakhand. The policy aims to promote film production in Uttarakhand by providing financial grants to films, TV serials, and web series shot in the state, encouraging filmmakers to showcase Uttarakhand’s culture, heritage, and locations, and boosting local employment and the state's film economy. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under the provisions of the Uttarakhand Film Policy–2024, grants are provided as follows: For films made in regional languages and dialects, a grant of 50% of the amount spent in the state or up to ₹2 crore, whichever is lower, will be provided. For films made in Hindi or in the languages listed in the 8th Schedule of the Indian Constitution, a grant of 30% of the amount spent in the state or up to ₹3 crore, whichever is lower, will be provided. For films made in foreign languages that have incu
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under the provisions of the Uttarakhand Film Policy–2024, grants are provided as follows: For films made in regional languages and dialects, a grant of 50% of the amount spent in the state or up to ₹2 crore, whichever is lower, will be provided. For films made in Hindi or in the languages listed in the 8th Schedule of the Indian Constitution, a grant of 30% of the amount spent in the state or up to ₹3 crore, whichever is lower, will be provided. For films made in foreign languages that have incurred an expenditure of at least ₹3 crore in the state, and in which the shooting locations of the state have been appropriately showcased, a grant will be provided of 50% of the amount spent in the state or up to ₹3 crore, whichever is lower. For TV serials or web series produced in Hindi or in the languages listed in the 8th Schedule of the Indian Constitution, as well as in the regional dialects of Uttarakhand, a grant will be provided of either 30% of the amount spent in Uttarakhand during the shooting period or up to ₹3 crore, whichever is lower. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a film producer. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Details of all expenditures related to film production
Other relevant supporting documents and records related to production

application_process: Offline After obtaining the Film Censor Certificate and the release/exhibition of the film, the film producer applies for the grant
For this, the producer must submit all expenditure details, contracts, invoices, and other related documents concerning the film production to the department
The technical and financial committees constituted for granting film subsidies examine the film proposals and review the films before considering the grant
Based on the recommendation of the financial committee, the grant amount is approved and sanctioned by the Hon’ble Chief Minister/Chairman of the Film Development Council
(Applications for the grant must be submitted offline to the Film Development Council, Information and Public Relations Department, Dehradun

Through this scheme, the meritorious wards of the ESM are provided grants for their achievements in sports at n
schemes.detailed_description: Details "Grant to Meritorious Wards of ESM in Sports: National / International Level" is a Welfare Scheme by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. Through this scheme, the meritorious wards of the ESM are provided grants for their achievements in sports at national and international levels. The application should be submitted offline within three months from the date of the achievement.

benefits.summary: Grant of ₹50,000/- for achievements in sports at the international level. Grant of ₹30,000/- for achievements in sports at the national level. The amount is credited to the beneficiary’s Bank Account through RTGS/ NEFT.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Grant of ₹50,000/- for achievements in sports at the international level. Grant of ₹30,000/- for achievements in sports at the national level. The amount is credited to the beneficiary’s Bank Account through RTGS/ NEFT.

The ESM / Ward of the Widow of an ESM should be registered with the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. The event should be organised by a body approved/recognized by the Government. The applicant should have achieved merit in a sport at the national/international level.

schemes.brief_description: Details The "Gen Next Competition" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Dept, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to ensure that the traditional handicrafts of Tamil Nadu survive and are passed on to the next generation, it is necessary to enthuse the youngste
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Gen Next Competition" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Dept, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to ensure that the traditional handicrafts of Tamil Nadu survive and are passed on to the next generation, it is necessary to enthuse the youngsters in the field. To achieve this, a craft competition was introduced from the year 2013-2014 onwards for artisans below 30 years of age.

benefits.summary: Cash Prize of ₹2,000/-. Silver Medal. Certificate.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize of ₹2,000/-. Silver Medal. Certificate.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an Artisan. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu. The applicant should be below 30 years of age. Handicraft competitions will be conducted in the following 16 types of handicrafts: Panchaloka Idols, Brass Lamps and Brass Artifacts, Thanjavur Paintings, Thanjavur Plates, Wood Carvings, Stone Sculptures, Fire Clay Sculptures, Applique and Kalamkari work, Paper Pulp Toys, Weaving, Bamboo and Palm Leaf Products, Neti Work, Fiber Products, Temple jewelry, Image Stitching Work, Other Handicrafts. The examination will be conducted based on places of prominence in handicraft industries. The center and date of the exam will be announced later. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Address Proof (Family Card / Voter ID Card / Driving License).
Artisan's Affidavit on ₹20/- Stamp Paper, attested by a First Class Criminal Judge or Notary Public.

Recommendation Certificate, attested by any of the Managers of Poombucar Outlets and Manufacturing Plants / the respective Area Assistant Directors (Handicrafts / Craft Council (Tamil Nadu/India/World) under the Office of the Development Commissioner, New Delhi.

schemes.scheme_name: Grant For Oru Kala Pooja
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Grant For Oru Kala Pooja" was launched by the Hindu Religious Institutions and Wakf Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. The primary aim is to help these temples meet the ongoing expenses towards the performance of Oru Kala Pooja. The scheme offers ₹20,000/- per annum per t
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Grant For Oru Kala Pooja" was launched by the Hindu Religious Institutions and Wakf Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. The primary aim is to help these temples meet the ongoing expenses towards the performance of Oru Kala Pooja. The scheme offers ₹20,000/- per annum per temple for Oru Kala Pooja. Additionally, assistance of ₹1,000/- and ₹500/- per annum per temple is granted for Current Consumption Charges and Water Consumption Charges, respectively, upon producing paid bills. The concerned temple authority must apply using the prescribed format along with specific documents. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial assistance of ₹20,000/- per annum per temple for meeting expenses towards the performance of Oru Kala Pooja. Financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per annum per temple for meeting expenses towards Current Consumption Charges. Financial assistance of ₹500/- per annum per temple for meeting expenses towards Water Consumption Charges. Disbursement Financial assistance shall be sanctioned within three months time. Sanction is dependent upon the availability of funds. Assistance for Current Cons
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial assistance of ₹20,000/- per annum per temple for meeting expenses towards the performance of Oru Kala Pooja. Financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per annum per temple for meeting expenses towards Current Consumption Charges. Financial assistance of ₹500/- per annum per temple for meeting expenses towards Water Consumption Charges. Disbursement Financial assistance shall be sanctioned within three months time. Sanction is dependent upon the availability of funds. Assistance for Current Consumption Charges and Water Consumption Charges is granted on the production of bills paid by the temple authority. Conditions for Availment/Continuation of Benefits The grant of financial assistance sanctioned must be utilized strictly for the purpose for which it is sanctioned. The temple authority must produce the Original Vouchers for having utilized the amount towards the performance of Oru Kala Pooja. The temple authority must provide an Utilization Certificate for having fully utilized the amount for the purpose sought. Any portion of the amount which remains unspent or unutilized shall be duly surrendered to the Commissioner, Hindu Religious Institutions, Puducherry. The Government reserves the power to call for the accounts of the temple for the amount sanctioned. The accounts relating to the financial assistance sanctioned are subject to audit by the Directorate of Accounts & Treasuries, Puducherry or any other competent authority. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be the concerned temple authority. The temple must be situated in the Union Territory of Puducherry. The temple must have poor resources. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Copy Of Document Regarding The Land In Which The Temple Is Situated.
Photographs Showing The Present Condition Of The Temple.
Copy Of The Bank Account Held In The Name Of The Temple.
Certificate In Form II Obtained From An Officer Nominated By The Commissioner, Hindu Religious Institutions (To certify the total annual income from all sources).
Bills Paid By The Temple Authority (Required for claiming Current Consumption Charges and Water Consumption Charges assistance).
Original Vouchers (Required post-sanction to prove utilization).
Utilization Certificate (Required post-sanction to prove utilization).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Alternatively, the interested applicant may request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned authority at the temple
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form, along with the documents, to the concerned authority at the temple
Application Processing and Concurrence The processing time for the application shall be 15 days
Eligibility factors are assessed in accordance with the scheme rules and subsequently processed to the Finance Department for concurrence
Final Sanction and Disbursement Financial assistance shall be sanctioned in three months' time
The final decision involves the Commissioner, the Secretary (Hindu Religious Institutions), and the Chief Secretary

schemes.scheme_name: Gaurav Puraskar Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Gaurav Puraskar Award" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to recognize and encourage individuals who have demonstrated excellence in the fields of music, dance, drama, and folk art through a combination of financial and honorary be
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Gaurav Puraskar Award" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to recognize and encourage individuals who have demonstrated excellence in the fields of music, dance, drama, and folk art through a combination of financial and honorary benefits. The scheme confers a cash award of ₹1,000/-, a trophy, and a letter of appreciation to 12 deserving artistes every year. It also facilitates opportunities for awardees to contribute to state-sponsored cultural events and festivals in various expert capacities. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prize: Each awardee receives a cash prize of ₹1,000/-. Honorary Recognition: Awardees are presented with a trophy and a letter of appreciation. Post-Award Engagement: Awardees may be included as members in committees of the Academy. Awardees can offer their services as adjudicators or experts in state cultural programs such as Rajya-level Navratri festivals, Kalamahakumbh, and other events. ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize: Each awardee receives a cash prize of ₹1,000/-. Honorary Recognition: Awardees are presented with a trophy and a letter of appreciation. Post-Award Engagement: Awardees may be included as members in committees of the Academy. Awardees can offer their services as adjudicators or experts in state cultural programs such as Rajya-level Navratri festivals, Kalamahakumbh, and other events. ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant must have made a significant contribution or demonstrated excellence in the fields of music, dance, drama, or folk art. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form for the "Publication Support Scheme for Fine Arts" scheme
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, including career details in the field of art, photographs, or color slides of work (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority at the Academy office to whom the application has been submitted
Note: Applications for book publication are invited every year through advertisements in daily newspapers
Contact Us: Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy Block No - 14, 2nd Floor, Dr
Jivaraj Maheta Bhavan, Sector 10-A, Gandhinagar-382010

schemes.scheme_name: Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa envisaging grant of awards for one meritorious Library and one Librarian serving either in any Government or Government–aided Libraries in the State of Goa,
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa envisaging grant of awards for one meritorious Library and one Librarian serving either in any Government or Government–aided Libraries in the State of Goa, which include the Public/Academic/Special/Research Libraries every year. ﻿ Objective To recognize the hard work put in by the management of the Libraries and the Librarians and to give an impetus and encouragement to them by conferring awards on them for their contribution in the field of library movement.

benefits.summary: Nature and Quantum of Assistance ﻿ Goa State Best Library Award A cash prize of ₹ 50,000/-, a Memento, a Citation and a Certificate. ﻿ Goa State Best Librarian Award A cash prize of ₹ 25,000/-, a Memento, a Citation and a Certificate. ﻿ Number of Awards Every year one Library and one Librarian will be selected for the award.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Nature and Quantum of Assistance ﻿ Goa State Best Library Award A cash prize of ₹ 50,000/-, a Memento, a Citation and a Certificate. ﻿ Goa State Best Librarian Award A cash prize of ₹ 25,000/-, a Memento, a Citation and a Certificate. ﻿ Number of Awards Every year one Library and one Librarian will be selected for the award.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility For Library The library should be in existence for a minimum period of 15 years. The library should have a minimum of 100 registered members for the last 5 years. The library should have in possession a minimum of 2500 books, periodicals etc., in readable condition. The library should have a proper infrastructure with retrieval facilities. The library should be spacious, having a minimum area of 40 sq. mts. and with proper ventilation. The library should have conducted regular programmes etc. for the members/public to enhance their reading habits and knowledge. The library should have maintained all the library records properly and up to date. The award shall be conferred to only one well-stacked library from the State of Goa. ﻿ For Librarian The Librarian should be born in the State of Goa or should be a resident of the State of Goa for a minimum period of 15 years. The Librarian should have a minimum of 10 years of continuous service as a Librarian/Section-In-Charge of a reputed library from the State of Goa. The Librarian should have taken up initiatives for library development/inculcating reading culture in his/her area of work. The award shall not be conferred posthumously. However, in the event of death of the individual after recommendation of his/her name for the award by the Award Committee, the award shall be conferred posthumously. Further, any illustrious service of any individual in the field of library movement shall also be recognized and considered for the award not beyond one year of death or retirement of the individual. The award shall be conferred on one meritorious librarian i.e. serving in any Government, Government-aided Libraries in the State of Goa which include the Public/Academic/Special/Research Libraries etc. ﻿ NOTE: In the event of no suitable person of the desired standard being found, no award shall be conferred for that year.

required_documents.document_name: Collection details of Library (Library which is being recommended).
A Few Photographs of the Library with the Collection.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Goa State Central Library
Step 2: Take a print of the proforma of the application form, or request a hard copy from the concerned authority
Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Curator, Goa State Central Library, Patto, Panaji – Goa
0832-2437947, Email: lib-cent
in, Website: https://www
artandculture

schemes.scheme_name: Goa State Cultural Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Cultural Award" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa, has been designed to honour the eminent personalities in the field of Art and culture. The scheme intends to give recognition to the Goan artists par excellence for their lifetime achievements and
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Cultural Award" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa, has been designed to honour the eminent personalities in the field of Art and culture. The scheme intends to give recognition to the Goan artists par excellence for their lifetime achievements and for their extraordinary contribution to the field of Art and culture in Goa. ﻿ Objectives To honour the eminent personalities in the field of Art and culture. To felicitate the artists par excellence for their lifetime achievements. To recognize and appreciate the artists' par excellence as State Artist of Goa.

benefits.summary: The awardee shall be honoured with a shawl, a sriphal, a certificate of appreciation and a financial purse to the extent of ₹ 1,00,000/- per individual and monthly financial assistance as provided under the scheme of Kala Samman. ﻿ Number of Awards Every year maximum of 12 (twelve) persons are awarded in the following fields - 1. Music 2. Dance 3. Drama/Theatre including Tiatr 4. Performing Folk Art 5. Fine Art & Craft 6. Bhajan/Kirtan/Choir 7. Film & associated Audio Visual works of Art 8. Over
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The awardee shall be honoured with a shawl, a sriphal, a certificate of appreciation and a financial purse to the extent of ₹ 1,00,000/- per individual and monthly financial assistance as provided under the scheme of Kala Samman. ﻿ Number of Awards Every year maximum of 12 (twelve) persons are awarded in the following fields - 1. Music 2. Dance 3. Drama/Theatre including Tiatr 4. Performing Folk Art 5. Fine Art & Craft 6. Bhajan/Kirtan/Choir 7. Film & associated Audio Visual works of Art 8. Overall contribution to the field of art & culture 9. Literature 10. (Creative) Photography ﻿ Announcement of List of Awardees Within 6 months from the last date of submission of the application. ﻿ Presentation of Award On or before April 30.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artist. The applicant should have completed 60 years of age. The applicant should have given extraordinary contributions to the field of art & culture at large and in his/her respective field of art in particular. The applicant should have contributed in his/her respective field of art in Goa for a minimum of 10 years out of his/her entire career as a practising artist. No award will be presented posthumously. However, during the selection process if the death of any artist occurs after the recommendation of his name then Task Force The committee may consider his name for the award, in such circumstances award will be presented posthumously.

required_documents.document_name: Photograph of Performance/ Felicitations/ Contribution in the Particular Field.
If the Nominee is NRI/OCI, Documentary Proof is to Be Attached.
Copy of 1st Page of the Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque.

Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required)

schemes.scheme_name: Goa State Cultural Award for Institution
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Cultural Award for Institution" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa is designed to recognize, promote and appreciate the contribution of the institution in the field of Art and culture. This will give a tremendous boost to cultural institutions in G
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Cultural Award for Institution" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa is designed to recognize, promote and appreciate the contribution of the institution in the field of Art and culture. This will give a tremendous boost to cultural institutions in Goa, which in turn will give encouragement to new talents. ﻿ Objectives To recognize, promote and appreciate the institution par excellence as the best Cultural Institution of Goa. To give a boost to the cultural institutions, which in turn will also encourage the other institutions in the State to promote and encourage cultural talents towards an extraordinary creative output. To create and develop a cultural Environment in the state. To felicitate the institution par excellence for its achievements.

benefits.summary: A Memento and a Financial Purse to the extent of ₹ 3,00,000.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: A Memento and a Financial Purse to the extent of ₹ 3,00,000.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a Goan institution (or institution working for Goan artists) working in the field of Art and culture. The institution should have completed 15 years. The institution should have given extraordinary contributions to the field of Art and culture. The institution should have a properly constituted managing body with its powers and duties clearly defined in its constitution. The institution should have a good reputation in the local community. The cultural institutions that are financed by the Central Government Corporations, and Municipalities are also eligible. ﻿ Reservation / Preference / Priority Preference will be given to the institutions involved in Cultural Education i.e. imparting Training in Music, Dance, Drama, Fine Arts etc.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, 5th Floor, Shram Shakti Bhavan, Panaji, Patto, Panaji, Goa - 403001 Step 2: Take a print of the proforma ﻿ o ﻿ f ﻿ the application form of the respective scheme, or request a hard copy from the concerned authority
Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the ACO-III, Directorate of Art & Culture, Phone: 0832-2404606, E-mail: aco6-dac
﻿ Application Deadline Within 30 days* from the date of advertisement in the Newspaper

schemes.scheme_name: Gomant Vibhushan Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Gomant Vibhushan Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa in order to honour and recognize the Goan renowned personalities who have contributed to the distinguished and extraordinary achievements/ services in any field of activities/discip
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Gomant Vibhushan Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa in order to honour and recognize the Goan renowned personalities who have contributed to the distinguished and extraordinary achievements/ services in any field of activities/disciplines such as art & culture, literature & education, sports, medicine, social work, civil services, public affairs, trade, science & engineering, industry, economics, philosophy, politics, or any other field at national & international level. The Gomant Vibhushan Award shall be given once in two years. ﻿ Objectives To honour the Goan-origin personalities who have done admirable & exceptional work in their field. To felicitate the Goan Personalities who made Goa proud by their achievements & reputation and brought recognition to Goa nationally & internationally.

benefits.summary: A Memento, citation and financial purse to the extent of ₹ 5,00,000/- .
benefits.raw_benefits_text: A Memento, citation and financial purse to the extent of ₹ 5,00,000/- .

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should possess distinguished and exceptional achievements/services in fields of activities/disciplines such as art & culture, literature & education, sports, medicine, social work, civil services, public affairs, trade, science & engineering, industry, economics, philosophy, politics, or any other field at national & international level. The applicant should be of Goan origin. No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme. However, during the process of selection if the death of such an artist occurs after the recommendation of the name, then the Task Force Committee may consider his name for an “award”, in such circumstances award will be presented posthumously.

required_documents.document_name: Copy of ID Proof of Recommender (person who is recommending)
Recommendee Biodata (person who is being recommended)

Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Director or to the ACO-III, Directorate of Art & Culture, Phone: 0832-2404606, Email: aco6-dac

schemes.detailed_description: Details "Haryana Provision of Sports Equipment Scheme" by the Sports Department, Government of Haryana provides sports equipment to Gram Panchayats and Municipal bodies to encourage youngsters in the state towards sports such as Volleyball, Football, Basketball, Handball, Boxing, Wrestling, Judo, Cricket. To receive the benefits, proper Field of Play (FoP) for the requisite sport should be available in the town/ village.

benefits.summary: ﻿ Name of the Sport Eligible Equipment Volleyball Up to 06 Balls and Net (if poles are installed) Football Up to 06 Balls and Net (if poles are installed) Basketball Up to 06 Balls (if poles are installed) Handball Up to 06 Balls and Net (if poles are installed) Boxing Up to 06 Punching Bags and 12 pairs of gloves. Wrestling Mats size length 1 meter x width 2 meters & thickness 5 cm. (18-piece Mats) with cover. Judo Mats size length 1 meter x width 2 meters & thickness 5 cm. (18-piece Mats) with
benefits.raw_benefits_text: ﻿ Name of the Sport Eligible Equipment Volleyball Up to 06 Balls and Net (if poles are installed) Football Up to 06 Balls and Net (if poles are installed) Basketball Up to 06 Balls (if poles are installed) Handball Up to 06 Balls and Net (if poles are installed) Boxing Up to 06 Punching Bags and 12 pairs of gloves. Wrestling Mats size length 1 meter x width 2 meters & thickness 5 cm. (18-piece Mats) with cover. Judo Mats size length 1 meter x width 2 meters & thickness 5 cm. (18-piece Mats) with cover. eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a Municipal Body/Gram Panchayat of Haryana. Field of Play (FOP) should be available in the town/village for the expected play.

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sports Officer

NOTE 2: In the case of Gram Panchayat, the Sarpanch of the village may apply
In case of a vacancy for the post of Sarpanch, Gram Sachiv may apply

schemes.scheme_name: International Financial Assistance
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "International Financial Assistance" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and support sportspersons from Gujarat participating in international-level competitions by providing a one-time financial assistance of ₹75,000/-
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "International Financial Assistance" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and support sportspersons from Gujarat participating in international-level competitions by providing a one-time financial assistance of ₹75,000/- to cover costs related to boarding, lodging, air travel, kit, or miscellaneous expenses. This initiative ensures that deserving athletes are not hindered by financial constraints in their pursuit of excellence on global platforms. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: ₹75,000/- is provided to eligible sportspersons to cover expenses for boarding, lodging, travel (including air tickets), sports kits, and other related miscellaneous expenses. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: ₹75,000/- is provided to eligible sportspersons to cover expenses for boarding, lodging, travel (including air tickets), sports kits, and other related miscellaneous expenses. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a sportsperson representing Gujarat in any recognized international-level sports competition. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should be male. ﻿

application_process: Online Registration Process: Step 1: Visit the homepage of the Sports Authority of Gujarat
Step 2: Click on the “Registration” button on the upper-right side of the page
Step 3: Fill in all the required details as per the form and submit it
Application Process: Step 1: After registration, check your registered email for login credentials
Step 2: Select “Player” as the user type and log in using the credentials received
Step 3: Click on the concerned scheme name and proceed with the application

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Concession in Railway Travel" was launched by the Department of Art and Culture, Tamil Nadu. Under the scheme, individual artists and troupes consisting of more than three artists are allowed to travel in the train on concession by the Railways. A concession certificate will be i
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Concession in Railway Travel" was launched by the Department of Art and Culture, Tamil Nadu. Under the scheme, individual artists and troupes consisting of more than three artists are allowed to travel in the train on concession by the Railways. A concession certificate will be issued by the Mandram.

benefits.summary: 75% concession in Second Class Fare. 50% concession in First Class Fare.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: 75% concession in Second Class Fare. 50% concession in First Class Fare.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an individual artist or a troupe consisting of more than three artists. The applicant should undertake the journey by train. The purpose of the journey should be to deliver a cultural performance (public programme) in the outstation. The distance between the place from which the cultural troupe is to start and the place of performance should be beyond 300 km as fixed by the Indian Railways.

required_documents.document_name: Confirmation letter obtained from the programme organizer or advertisement details.
Any other document, required by the Department.

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

schemes.scheme_name: Internship Policy Of Indian Council For Cultural Relations (ICCR)
schemes.brief_description: Details Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) is an autonomous body under the Ministry of External Affairs ﻿ The Internship Policy of the Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) provides an excellent opportunity for budding scholars to familiarise themselves with the role of soft power i
schemes.detailed_description: Details Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) is an autonomous body under the Ministry of External Affairs ﻿ The Internship Policy of the Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) provides an excellent opportunity for budding scholars to familiarise themselves with the role of soft power in foreign policy formulation in the Government of India. These ‘Interns’ shall be given exposure to various Sections with ICCR and would be expected to supplement the process of analysis in various fields including creative writing, cultural mapping, technology upgradation in EGIT, creating a module for performing and visual art, historical cultural linkages of India with other countries and the use of Social Media in Cultural Diplomacy. It aims at active participation in the learning process through experimentation and putting into practice the knowledge acquired in the classrooms. ﻿ Intake A maximum of 15 interns will be engaged by ICCR during the course of a year. ﻿ Location The interns will be placed at ICCR, New Delhi and its Regional Offices in Mumbai, Pune, Kolkata, Guwahati, Ahmadabad and Hyderabad. ﻿ Duration Each intern will be engaged for a maximum period of four months. ﻿ Duties & Responsibilities Interns will be assigned specific topics of work by the concerned Sectional Head and may be required to conduct research, write reports, analyze evolving developments or carry out any other task entrusted to them by the Sectional Heads.

benefits.summary: Honorarium An honorarium of ₹ 10,000/- per month will be paid to each intern. ﻿ Air Fare The cost of one-time to and fro air travel is subject to a ceiling of the prevailing economy class airfare between the State capital and Delhi, from the domicile State or from the college/ university of the selected candidates will be provided. NOTE: The interns would be responsible for their board and lodging in Delhi, Mumbai, Pune, Kolkata, Guwahati, Ahmadabad and Hyderabad. ﻿ Logistics Support Necessary l
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Honorarium An honorarium of ₹ 10,000/- per month will be paid to each intern. ﻿ Air Fare The cost of one-time to and fro air travel is subject to a ceiling of the prevailing economy class airfare between the State capital and Delhi, from the domicile State or from the college/ university of the selected candidates will be provided. NOTE: The interns would be responsible for their board and lodging in Delhi, Mumbai, Pune, Kolkata, Guwahati, Ahmadabad and Hyderabad. ﻿ Logistics Support Necessary logistic support will be provided to the intern taking into account the functional requirements. ﻿ Certificate Certificates will be issued to the interns on satisfactory completion of their internships and on submission of their Report/ Paper and its evaluation by the Head of the concerned Division.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a citizen of India. The applicant should be a graduate in Humanities/ Mass Communication/ Journalism/ Designing/ Anthropology/ History/ Art/ Archaeology Science/ Languages/ Museology/ Fine Arts. The age of the applicant should be less than or equal to 25 years as of 31st December of the year of the Internship. Post Graduate / Research Students and Foreign Language Students are also eligible. The applicant should have an excellent academic track record. The applicant should preferably be from any recognized University in India. ﻿ Reservation / Preference / Priority Research scholars with formal backgrounds in International Relations and Soft Power Projection will be given preference depending upon the requirement of ICCR. The candidates with the highest marks are most likely to be called for Personal Interview.

required_documents.document_name: Permission letter from their Supervisor/ Head of Department (in case the applicant is interested to join an internship during their coursework).
At the end of the internship,
A detailed report on the work carried out.
A presentation on the work carried out (if required).

application_process: Online Interested students can email their applications in the prescribed format to: directoradmin
in with a copy to spdadmn
Director General, Administration, ICCR, Azad Bhavan, IP Estate, New Delhi)

schemes.scheme_name: Jharkhand Sports Excellence Cash Award Scheme to Coaches
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Jharkhand Sports Excellence Cash Award Scheme to Coaches” was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. The scheme aims to provide cash awards to coaches who train athletes and teams to achieve excellence in national and international competitions un
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Jharkhand Sports Excellence Cash Award Scheme to Coaches” was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. The scheme aims to provide cash awards to coaches who train athletes and teams to achieve excellence in national and international competitions under the Jharkhand Sports Policy, 2022. ﻿ Objective: Cash rewards to encourage and sustain their contribution to sports development. ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a coach who trains medal-winning athletes/teams participating in competitions recognized by the International or Indian Olympic Association. The applicant must have coached athletes/teams representing Jharkhand or India for at least four years. The medal-winning athletes must have competed in recognized competitions for the coach to qualify. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Proof of Medal Achievements by the Trainee Athlete (competition certificates, event records, etc.).
Identity Proof of the Applicant (Aadhaar, Voter ID, PAN Card, Driving License, Passport, etc.).
Proof of Residential Address (Aadhaar, Resident Certificate, Voter ID, Driving License, Passport, or Ration Card).

application_process: Offline Step-1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website
Step-2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step-3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sports Officer
Step-4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

schemes.scheme_name: Junior/Senior Fellowship in the Field of Fine Arts
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Junior/Senior Fellowship in the Field of Fine Arts" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to nurture artistic talent and provide financial support for experimental, research-based, or revival-focused projects in the fields of paintin
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Junior/Senior Fellowship in the Field of Fine Arts" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to nurture artistic talent and provide financial support for experimental, research-based, or revival-focused projects in the fields of painting, sculpture, and graphic arts. The scheme benefits both junior and senior artists of Gujarat by awarding them monthly stipends, thereby helping them undertake advanced training, revive endangered Indian or folk arts, and develop their careers in art. Under this scheme, 5 senior artists will be provided with a monthly stipend of ₹3,000/-, and 10 junior artists will be provided with a monthly stipend of ₹2,000/- for one year. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. ﻿

benefits.summary: Fellowship for Senior Artists: ₹3,000/-per month. Fellowship for Junior Artists: ₹2,000/- per month. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Fellowship for Senior Artists: ₹3,000/-per month. Fellowship for Junior Artists: ₹2,000/- per month. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident artist of Gujarat. The applicant should be actively engaged in the field of painting, sculpture, or graphic arts. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Educational Qualification Certificates in the Field of Art
Project Report (related to experimental, training, or research work)
Photograph or Color Slide (as proof of past work in the relevant art field)

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form for the "Publication Support Scheme for Fine Arts" scheme
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, including career details in the field of art, photographs, or color slides of work (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority at the Academy office to whom the application has been submitted
Note: Applications for book publication are invited every year through advertisement in daily newspapers
Contact Us: Gujarat State Academy of Fine Arts Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan, Opposite Bhaikaka Bhavan, Law Garden, Ellisbridge, Ahmedabad - 380006

schemes.scheme_name: Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme” was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. aims to provide financial support to retired athletes for their lifelong contribution to sports. Athletes, including Arjuna, Dronacharya, and Dhyan Chand awardees, O
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme” was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. aims to provide financial support to retired athletes for their lifelong contribution to sports. Athletes, including Arjuna, Dronacharya, and Dhyan Chand awardees, Olympic participants, and Commonwealth or Asian Games medalists, receive a monthly pension.

benefits.summary: Athletes receive a lifetime monthly pension of ₹10,000/-. Dependents of deceased athletes (spouse and minor children) receive ₹5,000/- monthly. ﻿ NOTE: Pension payments are directly transferred to the beneficiary's bank account.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Athletes receive a lifetime monthly pension of ₹10,000/-. Dependents of deceased athletes (spouse and minor children) receive ₹5,000/- monthly. ﻿ NOTE: Pension payments are directly transferred to the beneficiary's bank account.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of Jharkhand. The applicant should be a sportsperson or dependent on the deceased sportsperson. The applicant must receive the Arjuna, Dronacharya, or Dhyan Chand awards, an Olympic participant, or a medalist in Commonwealth or Asian Games. The applicant should be retired from active sports. The applicant must be at least 40 years old (age relaxation up to 10 years for medically retired athletes). The applicant must not be employed in any government, PSU, or pension scheme. The applicant should have no criminal convictions. The applicant should not be receiving any pension from the Government of India or any other state government. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: For literate applicants: Matriculation certificate issued by the school
For illiterate applicants: Aadhaar card, Voter ID, or similar document
Aadhaar card, Voter ID, etc., for illiterate applicants
Sports Achievements Certificates (Certificates or testimonials showcasing achievements in sports
Physical Disability Certificates (issued by the State Medical Board)
Proof of Current Occupation and Annual Income Certificate (issued by a competent authority)
List of Dependent Family Members (include their relationship, age, and occupation details on a signed sheet certificates issued by Government/Non-Government Organizations)
Proof of Previous Assistance or Pension (if applicable)
Relevant documents indicating assistance or pension from similar schemes by central or state government
Declaration Regarding Court Conviction (full details if the applicant has been convicted in a civil or criminal case)
Anti-Doping Declaration (document indicating no use of IOC-banned substances or a related certificate if applicable)

application_process: Offline Step-1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website
Step-2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step-3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sports Officer
Step-4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Sports Officer to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)
﻿ Processing of the Applications by the Concerned Authorities: The DSO verifies the application and forwards it with recommendations to the Directorate of Sports and Youth Affairs
Approval is granted by the committee formed under Jharkhand Sports Policy 2022
Upon approval, the pension amount is transferred to the beneficiary’s bank account

schemes.implementing_agency: Department of Sports & Youth Affairs

schemes.scheme_name: Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana" implemented by the Directorate of Art, Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand aims to financially support athletes and encourage them to focus on sports as a livelihood. Under this scheme, scholarships are provided to athletes bas
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana" implemented by the Directorate of Art, Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand aims to financially support athletes and encourage them to focus on sports as a livelihood. Under this scheme, scholarships are provided to athletes based on their performance in recognized national and state-level competitions.

benefits.summary: Monetary Assistance Based on Performance National championship winners: First, Second, and Third Place: ₹6,000 per month. Fourth to Eighth Place: ₹4,000 per month. ﻿ State-level winners qualifying for national championships: First to Third Place: ₹3,000 per month. ﻿ National record-equivalent performances: ₹4,000 per month. ﻿ Recognition for National Representation Athletes representing Jharkhand after obtaining a No Objection Certificate from other states or organizations may receive an allowan
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Monetary Assistance Based on Performance National championship winners: First, Second, and Third Place: ₹6,000 per month. Fourth to Eighth Place: ₹4,000 per month. ﻿ State-level winners qualifying for national championships: First to Third Place: ₹3,000 per month. ﻿ National record-equivalent performances: ₹4,000 per month. ﻿ Recognition for National Representation Athletes representing Jharkhand after obtaining a No Objection Certificate from other states or organizations may receive an allowance equal to their existing honorarium/salary. ﻿ Additional Support Financial aid can be used for training, nutrition, and purchasing sports equipment.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a permanent resident of Jharkhand. The applicant should be a sportsperson. Scholarships are awarded based on performance in the previous year's recognized national or state-level sports competitions. The applicant must not receive any other scholarship or benefits under any other sports scheme, such as free diet, accommodation, or stipend. ﻿ ﻿ NOTE: If the applicant is already receiving such benefits, they must forfeit them before applying for this scholarship.

required_documents.document_name: Certificates of Performance in Recognized Competitions (State/National level)
No Objection Certificate (if representing Jharkhand while employed/registered with another state/organization)
Proof of Age (e.g., Birth Certificate or School Leaving Certificate)
Bank Account Details (Copy of Passbook or Canceled Cheque)
Applicants must submit detailed results, including dates, distances, points, and scores, verified by the respective associations.

application_process: Offline Visit the Official Website Go to the official website Directorate of Art, Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs
﻿ Download Application Form Navigate to the "Notice" section, select "Khel Vritika (Sports Scholarship)," and download the application form
Fill Out the Form (details such as personal information, competition performance, and bank details)
﻿ Attach Documents Attach all required documents as listed above
Ensure proper attestation wherever needed
﻿ Submit the Application Submit the completed form and attached documents to the Directorate of Art, Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs or the Jharkhand State Sports Authority
