schemes.scheme_name: Kailash Darshan Yatra
schemes.brief_description: Details Launched in 2001, the scheme "Kailash Darshan Yatra" by the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Tourism Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the sacred Kailash Mansarovar pilgrimage. The scheme offers one-time fin
schemes.detailed_description: Details Launched in 2001, the scheme "Kailash Darshan Yatra" by the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Tourism Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the sacred Kailash Mansarovar pilgrimage. The scheme offers one-time financial assistance to selected applicants who complete the yatra. To be eligible, the applicant must be a selected pilgrim from Gujarat and submit proof of yatra completion within 90 days. Applications for this scheme are accepted offline.

benefits.summary: One-time financial assistance is provided to the pilgrim for undertaking the Kailash Darshan Yatra. Validity: Once in a lifetime per pilgrim. *The scheme guidelines do not specify the amount of the benefit; applicants should verify with the authorities.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: One-time financial assistance is provided to the pilgrim for undertaking the Kailash Darshan Yatra. Validity: Once in a lifetime per pilgrim. *The scheme guidelines do not specify the amount of the benefit; applicants should verify with the authorities.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a pilgrim from Gujarat. The applicant must have completed the Kailash Darshan Yatra. The applicant must apply within 90 days of yatra completion. The applicant must not have availed of the benefit before under this scheme.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields (details of the authorized travel agent/organizer, details of the pilgrims), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required)

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to "Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Old Secretariat, Gandhinagar" within 90 days of yatra completion
*Retain a copy of the submitted application for future reference
﻿ Verification & Disbursement The board processes applications, and financial assistance is credited to the beneficiary’s account
schemes.ministry_department: Ministry of External Affairs' process and who are residents of Gujarat may apply for this be
schemes.implementing_agency: Ministry of External Affairs' process and who are residents of Gujarat may apply for this be

schemes.scheme_name: Kala Gaurav Puraskar
schemes.brief_description: Details "Kala Gaurav Puraskar" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa, is presented to artists working in the field of Art and Culture who have given outstanding contributions in their respective fields of art. Such artists need to be felicitated and their substantial contribution
schemes.detailed_description: Details "Kala Gaurav Puraskar" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa, is presented to artists working in the field of Art and Culture who have given outstanding contributions in their respective fields of art. Such artists need to be felicitated and their substantial contribution needs to be recognized. ﻿ Objectives To give State recognition to those artists who have given substantial contributions in the field of Art and Culture. To felicitate the artists for their lifetime achievements in the field of Art and Culture. To recognize and appreciate the age-old talent of the artists.

benefits.summary: The awardee shall be felicitated with a shawl, shrifal, a certificate of appreciation and a financial purse to the extent of ₹ 25,000/- per individual. Every year maximum of 30 cases shall be considered as per the availability of funds.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The awardee shall be felicitated with a shawl, shrifal, a certificate of appreciation and a financial purse to the extent of ₹ 25,000/- per individual. Every year maximum of 30 cases shall be considered as per the availability of funds.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an individual artist. The applicant should be 60 years of age. The applicant should have given a substantial contribution in his/her respective field of art. The applicant should have contributed in his/her respective field of art in Goa for a minimum of 10 years out of his/her entire career as a practising artist.

required_documents.document_name: Aadhar Card Linked With Bank A/C*

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, 5th Floor, Shram Shakti Bhavan, Panaji, Patto, Panaji, Goa - 403001 Step 2: Take a print of the proforma of ﻿ the application form of the respective scheme, or request a hard copy from the concerned authority
Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the ACO-III, Directorate of Art & Culture, Phone: 0832-2404606, E-mail: aco6-dac
﻿ Application Deadline Within 30 days* from the date of advertisement in the Newspaper

The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance in the form of scholarships to undergraduate
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Sports Scholarship (UG)” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance in the form of scholarships to undergraduate students who excel in sports. ﻿

benefits.summary: Rate of Scholarship: ₹800/- per month. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Rate of Scholarship: ₹800/- per month. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a student. The applicant must be enrolled in the first year of an undergraduate course at Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar. The applicant must be one of the six selected students eligible to receive this benefit. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Documents are required in accordance with the university guidelines prescribed for this scheme.

application_process: Offline First, applications are invited from students using a prescribed form
Thereafter, a committee constituted by the Vice-Chancellor evaluates the received applications as per the established selection process

schemes.scheme_name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Compensation Towards Natural Calamities
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Compensation Towards Natural Calamities" component of the scheme aims to financially assist the Goan artists to meet expenses towards repair or construction of their houses damage
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Compensation Towards Natural Calamities" component of the scheme aims to financially assist the Goan artists to meet expenses towards repair or construction of their houses damaged due to natural calamities. The maximum financial assistance provided under this component is ₹25,000/- or the valuation done by the concerned Taluka Mamlatdar, whichever is less. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Art & Culture. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial assistance shall be provided to meet expenses towards the repair or construction of a house damaged due to natural calamities. The quantum of financial assistance shall be a maximum of ₹25,000/- or as per the valuation done by the concerned Taluka Mamlatdar, whichever is less. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial assistance shall be provided to meet expenses towards the repair or construction of a house damaged due to natural calamities. The quantum of financial assistance shall be a maximum of ₹25,000/- or as per the valuation done by the concerned Taluka Mamlatdar, whichever is less. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. The applicant must be recognized as an artist by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The income of the family of the applicant (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. The artist must not be less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) The applicant must be in need of funds to meet expenses towards repair or construction of their house damaged due to natural calamities. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Valuation Report (from the concerned Taluka Mamlatdar)
Proof of Recognition (by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Goa)

application_process: Offline Step 1: Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly
The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee
Step 2: The sub-committee shall consider the received applications and recommend the names of the artists which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme
The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist
Step 3: After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance

Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account

schemes.scheme_name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Financial Assistance For Funeral of the Artist
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Financial Assistance for Funeral of the Artist" component of the scheme aims to provide financial relief to the families of deceased Goan artists by assisting them in meeting fune
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Financial Assistance for Funeral of the Artist" component of the scheme aims to provide financial relief to the families of deceased Goan artists by assisting them in meeting funeral expenses, thereby acknowledging the contributions of artists and supporting their families during difficult times. The component provides financial assistance of up to ₹10,000/- to cover expenses related to the funeral of a recognized Goan artist. The applicant must be a family member of the deceased artist. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial assistance of up to a maximum of ₹10,000/- shall be sanctioned to meet expenses in connection with the funeral of the Goan artist. The benefit is provided as a one-time lump sum grant. The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible member of artist's family in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial assistance of up to a maximum of ₹10,000/- shall be sanctioned to meet expenses in connection with the funeral of the Goan artist. The benefit is provided as a one-time lump sum grant. The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible member of artist's family in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a family member of the deceased artist. The deceased artist must have been born and brought up in Goa. The deceased artist must have been recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The family income of the deceased artist (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. The applicant must not have claimed or received funeral assistance benefits from any other government source for the same purpose. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Document establishing the family relation of the applicant with the deceased artist.
Recognition Certificate of the Artist (by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa)
*All documents must be submitted in physical format as the application process is offline.
*Documents issued by competent authorities must be attested copies.
*Income certificate must be issued by the authorized revenue authority.

application_process: Offline Step 1: Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly
The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee
Step 2: The sub-committee shall consider the received applications and recommend the names which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme
The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released
Step 3: After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance

Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Incentive for Self-Employment" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance not exceeding ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, to needy Goan artists or
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Incentive for Self-Employment" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance not exceeding ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, to needy Goan artists or their families for setting up self-employment ventures, helping them establish sustainable income sources. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, shall be provided for setting up self employment venture. The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. The assistance is provided as a one-time grant. Conditions The details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers must be furnished to the department after utilizing the grant. The unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount, if any, s
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, shall be provided for setting up self employment venture. The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. The assistance is provided as a one-time grant. Conditions The details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers must be furnished to the department after utilizing the grant. The unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount, if any, shall be refunded to the Government within the stipulated timeframe. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. The artist must be an artist recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The income of the family of the applicant (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. The applicant must not be less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) The applicant must not be employed or self-employed at the time of application. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Certificate From Any Gazetted Officer (confirming that the applicant is not employed or self employed).
Estimate Indicating The Cost Of The Self Employment Venture (from competent authority).
Documentary Proof Of Recognition By The Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government Of Goa.
Declaration Or Affidavit (confirming that the applicant has not availed self employment benefits earlier under any Government scheme, Autonomous bodies, or Corporations).
Details Of The Expenditure Incurred Along With The Vouchers (to be furnished to the department after utilizing the grant).

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)

Step 3: After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance

Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account

schemes.scheme_name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Lumpsum Grant
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Lumpsum Grant" component of the scheme aims to provide a lumpsum grant (maximum ₹20,000/-) to the dependent family in case of death of the artist. The one-time financial assistanc
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Lumpsum Grant" component of the scheme aims to provide a lumpsum grant (maximum ₹20,000/-) to the dependent family in case of death of the artist. The one-time financial assistance amount is disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) mode. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance in the form of a lumpsum grant, maximum of ₹20,000/- shall be provided. The one-time financial assistance amount is disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) mode. Conditions The wife/husband of the late artist shall be considered first for the grant. In the event of the wife/husband predeceasing the late artist, the benefit shall be passed on to the unmarried/unemployed sons/daughters of the deceased artist as the case may be in eq
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance in the form of a lumpsum grant, maximum of ₹20,000/- shall be provided. The one-time financial assistance amount is disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) mode. Conditions The wife/husband of the late artist shall be considered first for the grant. In the event of the wife/husband predeceasing the late artist, the benefit shall be passed on to the unmarried/unemployed sons/daughters of the deceased artist as the case may be in equal ratio. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The deceased artist must have been Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. The deceased artist must have been recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The deceased artist must not have been less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) The applicant must be the dependent family member of the deceased artist. The wife/husband of the late artist shall be considered first for the grant. In the event of the wife/husband predeceasing the late artist, the benefit shall be passed on to the unmarried/unemployed sons/daughters of the deceased artist as the case may be in equal ratio. The annual income of the family of the deceased artist (from all the sources) must be less than ₹25,000/- per annum. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Documentary Proof of Recognition by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa.
Documents of the Dependent Family Member
Documentary Proof Establishing the Family Relation with the Artist

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly

The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist
Step 3: After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance
Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account

schemes.scheme_name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Marriage Component
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Marriage Component" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Marriage Component" of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists to address their daughter's marriage-related expenses. Th
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Marriage Component" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Marriage Component" of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists to address their daughter's marriage-related expenses. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted through prescribed proforma directly at the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance Financial assistance of ₹20,000/- shall be sanctioned for the first wholly dependent daughter's marriage. Financial assistance of ₹15,000/- shall be sanctioned for the second wholly dependent daughter's marriage. Maximum two wholly dependent unmarried daughters shall be eligible for this benefit. Disbursement The financial assistance shall be disbursed through Electronic Clearing System mode. The assistance is a one-time grant per eligible daughter's marriage. Conditions The
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance Financial assistance of ₹20,000/- shall be sanctioned for the first wholly dependent daughter's marriage. Financial assistance of ₹15,000/- shall be sanctioned for the second wholly dependent daughter's marriage. Maximum two wholly dependent unmarried daughters shall be eligible for this benefit. Disbursement The financial assistance shall be disbursed through Electronic Clearing System mode. The assistance is a one-time grant per eligible daughter's marriage. Conditions The details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers shall be furnished to the department. The unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount if any shall be refunded to the Government within 2 months from the date of marriage. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility For the Artist The applicant must be a Goan aged needy artist, born and brought up in the state of Goa. The applicant must be recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The applicant must be not less than 50 years of age. The applicant's annual family income from all the sources should not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. For Dependent Daughter(s) The daughters must be wholly dependent on the eligible Goan artist. The daughters must be unmarried at the time of application. Maximum two wholly dependent unmarried daughters shall be eligible. Relaxation The Government may relax the age criteria for the artist for deserving cases under special circumstances. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Dependency Certificate from the Authorized Authority.
Marriage Certificate or any other document indicating the relationship.
Income Certificate from the Competent Authority.
Recognition Certificate from the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa.
Vouchers for Expenses Incurred on the Marriage.

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly
The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee

The committee shall recommend the names of the artists which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme
The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist
Step 3: After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance

Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account

schemes.scheme_name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Medical Treatment
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Medical Treatment" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists and their dependent family members in indigent circumstances to meet
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Medical Treatment" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists and their dependent family members in indigent circumstances to meet expenses towards major or minor surgical treatment in local or outstation hospitals, including travelling and accommodation expenses outside the state for treatment. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Art & Culture. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance Financial assistance shall be sanctioned to meet the expenses towards major or minor surgical treatment in local or outstation hospitals. Financial assistance shall be provided to meet the expenses towards travelling and accommodation outside the state for treatment for self and or wholly dependent family members. The maximum financial assistance under this category shall not exceed ₹50,000/-. The Government may relax the ceiling in case of major chronic ailments. Disburseme
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance Financial assistance shall be sanctioned to meet the expenses towards major or minor surgical treatment in local or outstation hospitals. Financial assistance shall be provided to meet the expenses towards travelling and accommodation outside the state for treatment for self and or wholly dependent family members. The maximum financial assistance under this category shall not exceed ₹50,000/-. The Government may relax the ceiling in case of major chronic ailments. Disbursement The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. The disbursement shall be one-time financial assistance. Conditions The beneficiary shall not avail the benefit of medical reimbursement from any other Government department or under any schemes or policies for the medical treatment for which the financial assistance is granted under this scheme. The details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers shall be furnished to the department after availing the treatment. The unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount if any shall be refunded to the government within 3 months from completion of the treatment. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be any Goan aged needy artist, born and brought up in the state of Goa. The applicant must be recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The applicant must have an annual family income from all sources not exceeding ₹2,00,000/- per annum. The applicant must be not less than 50 years of age. Relaxation The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Marriage Certificate (if applicable for family members)
Medical Certificate (issued by the authorized doctor or hospital)
Estimate of Expenditure from the Authorized Doctor or Hospital. (However, in case of treatment availed or to be availed on emergency basis, the estimate shall be submitted subsequently)
Recognition Certificate (from the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa)
Details of the Expenditure Incurred along with the Vouchers.

application_process: Offline Step 1: Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly
The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee
Step 2: The sub-committee constituted by the Government shall meet as and when required and shall consider the applications received for this purpose
The committee shall recommend the names of the artists which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme
The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist
Step 3: After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance

Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account
Step 5: After availing the treatment, the beneficiary shall furnish the details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers to the department within 3 months from completion of the treatment
*If there is any unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount, the same shall be refunded to the government within 3 months from completion of the treatment

schemes.scheme_name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Pandemics
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Pandemics" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists who have lost the source of income due to the pandemic. The scheme provides
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Pandemics" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists who have lost the source of income due to the pandemic. The scheme provides relief in the form of financial assistance amounting to a minimum of ₹5,000/- (lumpsum) up to a maximum of ₹10,000/- (lumpsum) to eligible artists affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline at the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa. ﻿

benefits.summary: One-time financial assistance in the range of ₹5,000/- to ₹10,000/- (lumpsum) per eligible artist, as decided by the committee. Released in the Bank Account (Nationalized Bank) of the artist. The disbursement is done in the form of Electronic Clearing Service mode. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: One-time financial assistance in the range of ₹5,000/- to ₹10,000/- (lumpsum) per eligible artist, as decided by the committee. Released in the Bank Account (Nationalized Bank) of the artist. The disbursement is done in the form of Electronic Clearing Service mode. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The artist must be a resident of Goa. The artist must be above 18 years of age. The artist must have lost the source of income due to the pandemic of COVID-19. The individual income of the artist (from all the sources) must not exceed ₹1,50,000/- per annum. The artist should be working and contributing in the field of art and culture fields, i.e. Music/Dance/Drama/Tiatr/ Folk/Kir tan/Bhajan/Painting/Sculpture/Literature/Cantarists/Sahittik/Poets/Photographers/traditional Handicraft etc. Artists should be in need of such financial assistance as contemplated in the scheme. The artist should solely be dependent on the art related activities/programmes. The artist shall not be a Government employee or an employee of Autonomous bodies, Corporations nor pensioner of any organization. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Proof of Recent Contribution in the field of Art and Culture
Self-signed Affidavit/Declaration (on ₹50/- Stamp Paper) regarding the Individual Income (from all sources).
*Either a Proof or a Self-signed Affidavit/Declaration may be required from the applicant regarding the following -
Loss of the source of income due to the pandemic of COVID-19.
Solely dependence on the art related activities/programmes.

application_process: Offline Step 1: Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly
The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee

The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist
Step 3: After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance
Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account

schemes.scheme_name: Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Scholarships/Incentives
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Scholarships/Incentives" component of the scheme aims to provide financial support to the wards of recognized Goan artists who are pursuing higher education, thereby addressing th
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Scholarships/Incentives" component of the scheme aims to provide financial support to the wards of recognized Goan artists who are pursuing higher education, thereby addressing the economic challenges faced by artist families in supporting their children's educational aspirations and ensuring continuity of educational opportunities despite financial constraints. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: A monthly scholarship of ₹750/- is sanctioned to eligible wards during the currency of the academic year. The vacation period is excluded from the scholarship disbursement period. The scholarship is disbursed on a half-yearly basis. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: A monthly scholarship of ₹750/- is sanctioned to eligible wards during the currency of the academic year. The vacation period is excluded from the scholarship disbursement period. The scholarship is disbursed on a half-yearly basis. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility For the Artist The artist must be a Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. The artist must be recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The income of the family of the artist (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. The artist must not be less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) For the Ward of the Artist The ward must be enrolled in a recognized educational institution. The ward must be pursuing Postgraduate, Degree, or Professional courses. The ward may be enrolled in educational institutions within the state or outside the state. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Recognition Certificate, from the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa.
Income Certificate, from the Competent Authority.
For the Ward of the Artist
Dependency Certificate (or a document establishing the relation with the artist).

Step 3: Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa

Step 4: After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account

schemes.scheme_name: Khel Mahakumbh
schemes.brief_description: Details Launched in 2010, the scheme "Khel Mahakumbh" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to foster sportsmanship, encourage mass participation in sporting events, and recognize talent across all age groups through free sports services, structured com
schemes.detailed_description: Details Launched in 2010, the scheme "Khel Mahakumbh" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to foster sportsmanship, encourage mass participation in sporting events, and recognize talent across all age groups through free sports services, structured competitions, and significant monetary rewards. The scheme has witnessed continuous growth in participation since its inception and provides opportunities for outstanding performers to benefit from further sports training and development schemes under the Sports Authority of Gujarat. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: Winners of competitions receive cash prizes worth ₹45,00,00,000/- in total. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: Winners of competitions receive cash prizes worth ₹45,00,00,000/- in total. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a native of Gujarat or should have been studying, residing, working, or doing business in Gujarat for the past 2 years. Students must participate from the taluka/district where their school or college is located. Employees transferred from other states are eligible if their transfer to the district occurred at least 6 months before the date of registration. Note: The applicant can register for a maximum of 2 sports only. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Transfer Certificate or Proof of Employment Transfer (only for government employees transferred from other states).
School Code & Principal’s Certification (for team-based games at the school level).

application_process: Online Participation Flow: School/college students to register via their respective institutions
Non-students can register via the District Sports Training Center
After registration, players participate at various levels, starting from school/village level progressing up to state level
Website for Registration & Details: https://khelmahakumbh
in ﻿ Contact Us: Director General, Sports Authority of Gujarat Sports,Youth & Cultural Activities Department Block No 14, 3rd Floor Dr
Jivraj Mehta Bhavan, Sector-10, Gandhinagar 079-232 54791 Toll Free No

schemes.scheme_name: Organising Sports Competitions and Training Camps
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Organising Sports Competitions and Training Camps” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports at the grassroots and state levels by providing structured training, organizing competitions, and developing sporting talent.
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Organising Sports Competitions and Training Camps” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports at the grassroots and state levels by providing structured training, organizing competitions, and developing sporting talent. ﻿

benefits.summary: The department conducts local training camps in all districts for various sports, including football, athletics, boxing, volleyball, hockey, badminton, cricket, wrestling, kho-kho, karate, kabaddi, wushu, taekwondo, basketball, handball, ju-jitsu, table tennis, lawn tennis, baseball, and sepaktakraw, with training provided at minimal fees. The department operates Sports Colleges and Sports Hostels for sports such as football, athletics, boxing, volleyball, hockey, badminton, judo, and cricket, w
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The department conducts local training camps in all districts for various sports, including football, athletics, boxing, volleyball, hockey, badminton, cricket, wrestling, kho-kho, karate, kabaddi, wushu, taekwondo, basketball, handball, ju-jitsu, table tennis, lawn tennis, baseball, and sepaktakraw, with training provided at minimal fees. The department operates Sports Colleges and Sports Hostels for sports such as football, athletics, boxing, volleyball, hockey, badminton, judo, and cricket, with admission provided at minimal fees. A prize of ₹ 500/- is awarded for securing first position and ₹ 300/- for securing third position in state-level sports competitions. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant must be a player aged 8 to 16 years. In the case of amateur players, the applicant must be above 16 years of age. ﻿

application_process: Offline To conduct local training camps in all districts, the District Sports Officer’s office issues a notice in daily newspapers in March to publicize the district-level camps
Applications are received offline and must be submitted to the District Sports Officer’s office
Selection trials are conducted annually in April and May
For admission to Sports Colleges and Sports Hostels, preliminary selection trials are held at the district level
Successful candidates then undergo final trials at the state level, and admissions are granted against vacant seats based on the merit list
Direct paid admission is available for local training camps conducted at the district level and for amateur players

schemes.scheme_name: Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize
schemes.brief_description: Details The Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry launched the "Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize" scheme. The objective of this scheme is to provide prizes of ₹10,000/- and 10 awards to authors/writers in the field of novels, short stories, drama, poems & prose in Tamil. The applications are accepted
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry launched the "Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize" scheme. The objective of this scheme is to provide prizes of ₹10,000/- and 10 awards to authors/writers in the field of novels, short stories, drama, poems & prose in Tamil. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Director of Art and Culture Department.

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance of ₹10,000/-. No. of Awards: 10
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance of ₹10,000/-. No. of Awards: 10

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an author/writer. The applicant should be a native of Puducherry by virtue of birth or continuous residence of not less than five years. The applicant should publish the best novel, short story, drama, poetry and prose. First edition of the book should be published between 1st January and 31st December. The publication must be of creative literature of their own. The book should not be an abridged version of an imitation or translated version of another book or synopsis. The literary critics/ thesis research presented to university degrees or examinations are not eligible for award The author once awarded is not eligible to participate in the award for the next four consecutive years. The books sent for the prize should be those not awarded by other Government / Non-Government Organizations and Voluntary Literary Organizations.

required_documents.document_name: Published Book of the Last Year.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Director of Art and Culture Department, No
1, Roman Roland Road, Puducherry 605 001
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Director of Art and Culture Department to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)
NOTE: An advertisement will be made in the first week of January the eligible writers to submit their last year's book by January 31

schemes.scheme_name: Khel Pratibha Puraskar
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Khel Pratibha Puraskar” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to financially support and honour sportspersons from Gujarat who have earned medals at national and international levels by awarding them cash prizes between ₹10,000/- and
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Khel Pratibha Puraskar” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to financially support and honour sportspersons from Gujarat who have earned medals at national and international levels by awarding them cash prizes between ₹10,000/- and ₹5,00,00,000/- depending on the level and nature of their sporting achievement. The scheme intends to inspire athletic excellence and acknowledge the hard work and dedication of Gujarat’s athletes on prestigious platforms. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prize: An amount ranging from ₹10,000/- to ₹5,00,00,000/-. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize: An amount ranging from ₹10,000/- to ₹5,00,00,000/-. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a sportsperson. The applicant should have won a medal at a national or international level. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat or should be representing Gujarat officially in the sporting event. ﻿ ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Proof of Identity (e.g., Aadhaar Card, Voter ID Card).

application_process: Online Registration Process: Step 1: Visit the homepage of the Sports Authority of Gujarat
Step 2: Click on the “Registration” button on the upper-right side of the page
Step 3: Fill in all the required details as per the form and submit it
Application Process: Step 1: After registration, check your registered email for login credentials
Step 2: Select “Player” as the user type and log in using the credentials received
Step 3: Click on the concerned scheme name and proceed with the application

schemes.brief_description: Details The Khilaadee Protsaahan Yojana, a scheme of the Madhya Pradesh Building Department under the Labor Department, provides financial assistance to registered construction workers or their family members under the MP Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board who have excelled in spo
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Khilaadee Protsaahan Yojana, a scheme of the Madhya Pradesh Building Department under the Labor Department, provides financial assistance to registered construction workers or their family members under the MP Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board who have excelled in sports.

benefits.summary: On selection at various levels, incentive amount is payable as follows:- Levels (Category – A) Incentive amount on getting selected in district/divisional/state level sports. (Category – B) Incentive amount given by the Board for being winner in District/Divisional/State level game. At District Level ₹10,000/- ₹5,000/- At Division Level ₹25,000/- ₹15,000/- At State Level ₹25,000/- ₹30,000/- ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: On selection at various levels, incentive amount is payable as follows:- Levels (Category – A) Incentive amount on getting selected in district/divisional/state level sports. (Category – B) Incentive amount given by the Board for being winner in District/Divisional/State level game. At District Level ₹10,000/- ₹5,000/- At Division Level ₹25,000/- ₹15,000/- At State Level ₹25,000/- ₹30,000/- ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh. Family members registered under MP Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. The applicant should be a bank account.

required_documents.document_name: Application form in the prescribed format along with a copy of the registration card,
Certificate given by the District Superintendent of Police and District Sports Officer through the sports organization.
Construction workers and their family members holding valid identity cards.
The Aadhaar Card of the applicant.

application_process: Offline For Category-A awards Applications must be submitted in the prescribed format, along with a certificate issued by the District Superintendent of Police or the District Sports Officer through a recognized sports organization, to the designated officer as follows: For urban areas: Commissioner/Chief Municipal Officer, Urban Local Body ﻿ For Category-B awards The incentive amount for the winner of the sports competition organized by the division under Category-B will be provided by the organizing Labor Department officer
﻿ Where to apply Chief Executive Offcer, Janpad Panchayat and Commissioner/Chief Municipal Officer, Urban Local Body ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kantaram)
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kantaram)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage producers, lyricists, singers, and musicians who invest significant amounts of money to produce Konkani A
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kantaram)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage producers, lyricists, singers, and musicians who invest significant amounts of money to produce Konkani Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums of Konkani Tiatr songs, with the ultimate goal of encouraging qualitative album production to enrich Konkani 'kantar'. The scheme provides cash awards ranging from ₹5,000/- to ₹30,000/- across twelve different categories including solo singers, group performances, lyricists, music composers, and best album awards, with specific requirements for interactive lyrics in group categories and minimum composition requirements for album eligibility. ﻿

benefits.summary: Male singer of the year (Solo): ₹10,000/- Female singer of the year (Solo): ₹10,000/- Child Male Singer of the year (Solo): ₹5,000/- Child Female Singer of the year (Solo): ₹5,000/- Duet of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹10,000/- Duo of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹10,000/- Trio of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹15,000/- Quartet of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹20,000/- Choral Song of the year: ₹20,000/- Lyric
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Male singer of the year (Solo): ₹10,000/- Female singer of the year (Solo): ₹10,000/- Child Male Singer of the year (Solo): ₹5,000/- Child Female Singer of the year (Solo): ₹5,000/- Duet of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹10,000/- Duo of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹10,000/- Trio of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹15,000/- Quartet of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹20,000/- Choral Song of the year: ₹20,000/- Lyricist of the year: ₹10,000/- Music composer of the year: ₹10,000/- Best Konkani kantaram audio album of the year: ₹30,000/- *Awards are presented every year by Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must produce Konkani Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums between 1st January and 31st December of the year identified by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must ensure the music director is compulsorily a Goan or of Goan origin. The applicant must ensure singers in the Album are Goans whose mother tongue is Konkani. The applicant must ensure the Album contains songs only in Konkani language and not in other languages like English, Hindi, Portuguese etc. The applicant must ensure the songs in the Album are not old songs or remix of old songs. The applicant must ensure the Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums consists of minimum 8 Konkani kantaram. The applicant must ensure there are no adverse remarks in any form against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or against caste, creed and religion in the lyrics of songs/performances/speeches. Competition Requirements The applicant must ensure there are minimum three entries in each category to participate in that particular category competition. The applicant must ensure for Best Album award, the album has at least 5 kantaram from specified categories: one solo, one duet (interactive lyrics), one duo (interactive lyrics), one trio (interactive lyrics), one quartet/quintet (interactive lyrics), one choral song. Child Singer Category The applicant must ensure child singers have not completed 16 years of age on or before 31st December of the year identified by Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card.
Three Typed Copies of Lyrics of Songs (In Konkani in Roman Script) for Best Lyricist Award consideration.
Proof of Album Release Date (If date is not printed on the cover).
Self-Attested Copies of Birth Certificate or Baptism Certificate.
Certificate by Headmaster/Headmistress of Recognized School Certifying Birth Date (Original should be produced for verification).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Alternatively, visit the office of Tiatr Academy of Goa to collect the prescribed application form for the scheme
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment

Selection Process & Award Announcement Step 1: The submitted Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums will be judged by a Panel of Judges comprising eminent personalities experienced in song and music selected by Tiatr Academy of Goa
Step 2: Tiatr Academy of Goa will announce the winners and present cash awards in the respective categories annually, with the judges' decision being final and binding on all participants

schemes.scheme_name: Kala Samman Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Kala Samman Scheme" is implemented by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Goa, to grant financial assistance to eminent artists who are in indigent circumstances as a token of respect for their contribution to the field of Art and culture. ﻿ Objectives To give financial
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Kala Samman Scheme" is implemented by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Goa, to grant financial assistance to eminent artists who are in indigent circumstances as a token of respect for their contribution to the field of Art and culture. ﻿ Objectives To give financial support to the artists in indigent circumstances. To grant monthly financial assistance to the artists who are in indigent conditions to meet their daily needs. To recognize the contribution of artists in the field of Art and culture.

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance to the extent of ₹ 2,500/- per month every year. However, the recipient of State Cultural Award shall be entitled for Financial Assistance to the extent of ₹ 3,200/- per month every year.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance to the extent of ₹ 2,500/- per month every year. However, the recipient of State Cultural Award shall be entitled for Financial Assistance to the extent of ₹ 3,200/- per month every year.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artist who is in indigent condition. The applicant should have attained the age of 60 years. The applicant should have given a contribution to the field of Art and culture or should have worked in the field of Art and culture. The income of the applicant should not exceed ₹ 48,000/- per annum. (However, this clause shall not be applicable, where the applicant is the recipient of the ‘State Cultural Award'). NOTE: The number of cases to be sanctioned shall depend upon the availability of funds for every financial year.

required_documents.document_name: Proof of Age (Birth Certificate or School Leaving Certificate) (Self-Attested). In absence of both these documents, copy of Aadhar card or baptism certificate certifying his birth date.
Resume, giving details of work done in the field of Art & Culture.
References of two known persons or institutions working in respective field of Art & Culture.

application_process: Offline The Director of Art & Culture shall release an advertisement in local daily newspapers thereby inviting applications from eligible applicants

Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, 5th Floor, Shram Shakti Bhavan, Panaji, Patto, Panaji, Goa - 403001 Step 2: Take a print of the proforma of the application form, or request a hard copy from the concerned authority
Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority

The scheme aims to promote and encourage artistic talent among school students of Classes 9 to 12. In 2023-24, the state-level competition
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Kala Utsav Pratiyogita” scheme is implemented under the Samagra Shiksha Programme by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote and encourage artistic talent among school students of Classes 9 to 12. In 2023-24, the state-level competition was organized by the Haridwar district. Effective cooperation and coordination were ensured in organizing this competition from the district level to the state level. ﻿

benefits.summary: A total of 20 students, who secured first place in 10 categories across boys’ and girls’ groups, participated in the National Level Kala Utsav Pratiyogita held at Bal Bhavan, New Delhi, representing the state. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: A total of 20 students, who secured first place in 10 categories across boys’ and girls’ groups, participated in the National Level Kala Utsav Pratiyogita held at Bal Bhavan, New Delhi, representing the state. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a student of Classes 9 to 12. The applicant must be studying in a school in Uttarakhand. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: No Documents required for this Scheme

application_process: Offline The student (awardee) will be selected through competitions conducted at the district, state, and national levels

schemes.scheme_name: Laxman Award / Rani Laxmi Bai Award Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Laxman Award/Rani Laxmi Bai Award” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh the sportspersons will be honoured by the state government with the Lakshman award for male sportsperson and Rani Lakshmi Bai award for a female sportsperson in 31 sports disc
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Laxman Award/Rani Laxmi Bai Award” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh the sportspersons will be honoured by the state government with the Lakshman award for male sportsperson and Rani Lakshmi Bai award for a female sportsperson in 31 sports disciplines.

benefits.summary: This award recognizes sports personalities with a Citation, a Bronze statue of either Laxman or Rani Laxmi Bai, a Scroll, and a cash prize of ₹3,11,000/-.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: This award recognizes sports personalities with a Citation, a Bronze statue of either Laxman or Rani Laxmi Bai, a Scroll, and a cash prize of ₹3,11,000/-.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The player must be a bonafide native of Uttar Pradesh. The sportspersons for at least three consecutive times for the year 2020-21 (year 2018-19, 2019-20 & 2020-21) must have been a member of the state senior team for the year 2021-22 (2019-20, 2020-21 & 2021-22) participated in the National Games/National Senior Championship and also the medal earned by him in the year for which the award is recommended. If a player has participated in the National Senior Championship and he/she will participate in the international competitions mentioned in the government order such as the Olympic Games, World Championship/World Cup (held at an interval of 04 years) Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, Asian Championship and Commonwealth Championship (held 01 time in 04 years), SAF Games If he participates, will also be considered eligible. The player will have to give an affidavit along with his application that he has never been a participant in the consumption of drugs in any competition/championship or sports event nor has he been found guilty in this case. The applicant shall also submit an oath that he has not been found guilty in any suit by the Hon'ble Court nor has he been found guilty in connection with sexual harassment The players who have the above eligibility will be given the Laxman Award to the male player and Rani Laxmi Bai Award to women players included in 31 sports (Swimming, Archery, Athletics, Badminton, Basketball, Boxing, Canoeing & Kayaking, Cycling, Horse Riding, Fencing, Football, Gymnastics, Handball, Hockey, Judo, Kabaddi, Kho - Kho, Rowing, Shooting, Table Tennis, Lan Tennis, Volleyball, Weightlifting/Best physics, Wrestling, Taekwondo, Yachting, Golf, Cricket, Soft Tennis, Karate and Wushu) by conferring Lakshman/Rani Lakshmi Bai Award to male/female sportsperson who bring laurels to the state and the country by achieving significant achievements in the respective sports. One person will be rewarded only once. The Government may cancel the name of any person from the list of awardee sportspersons and in that direction, such person shall be required to return the statue and inscription given to him. The cancellation will thus be final and no appeal can be made against it. Any form of conveying (pleading) about a recommendation will disqualify that entry. The players only participating in National Senior Championships/National Games will not be considered eligible for the award. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Proof of age i.e. Birth certificate
Details of Sports competition/Championships of State, National & International importance covered by the applicant including profiles of Sports persons (Supporting documents)
Any other relevant documents, as required

application_process: Offline Step1: The interested applicant should take the prescribed format ﻿ of the application form

Step2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the respective sports officer of the concerned district
Step4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The player must be a bonafide native of Uttar Pradesh. The sportspersons for at least three consecutive times for the year 2020-21 (year 2018-19, 2019-20 & 2020-21) must have been a member of the state senior team for the year 2021-22 (2019-20, 2020-21 & 2021-22) participated in the National Games/National Senior Championship and also the medal earned by him in the year for which the award is recommended. If a player has participated in the National Senior Championship and he/she will participate in the international competitions mentioned in the government order such as the Olympic Games, World Championship/World Cup (held at an interval of 04 years) Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, Asian Championship and Commonwealth Championship (held 01 time in 04 years), SAF Games If he participates, will also be considered eligible. The player will have to give an affidavit along with his application that he has never been a participant in the consumption of drugs in any competition/championship or sports event nor has he been found guilty in this case. The applicant shall also submit an oath that he has not been found guilty in any suit by the Hon'ble Court nor has he been found guilty in connection with sexual harassment. The players who have the above eligibility will be given the Laxman Award to the male player and Rani Laxmi Bai Award to women players included in 31 sports (Swimming, Archery, Athletics, Badminton, Basketball, Boxing, Canoeing & Kayaking, Cycling, Horse Riding, Fencing, Football, Gymnastics, Handball, Hockey, Judo, Kabaddi, Kho - Kho, Rowing, Shooting, Table Tennis, Lan Tennis, Volleyball, Weightlifting/Best physics, Wrestling, Taekwondo, Yachting, Golf, Cricket, Soft Tennis, Karate and Wushu) by conferring Lakshman/Rani Lakshmi Bai Award to male/female sportsperson who bring laurels to the state and the country by achieving significant achievements in the respective sports. The Government may cancel the name of any person from the list of awardee sportspersons and in that direction such person shall be required to return the statue and inscription given to him. The cancellation will thus be final and no appeal can be made against it. Any form of conveying ( pleading ) in relation to a recommendation will disqualify that entry. The players only participating in National Senior Championships/National Games will not be considered eligible for the award. The Laxman/Rani Lakshmi Bai Award for Veteran category sportsperson age should be 40 years and above. The eligibility will be valid if the player is 40 years of age or above on April 1 of the year for which the application is being made in the veteran category. In the Veteran category, such veteran female / male player of any two of the above-designated sports can be awarded the Lakshman / Rani Laxmibai Award for bringing glory to the state and the country by achieving significant achievements in the National Championship / International Competitions (National Championship / International Competitions for points) in the respective sport. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Proof of age i.e. Birth certificate

Certificate of Sports competition/Championships of State, National & International importance covered by the applicant including profiles of Sports persons (issued by the respective sports association)
Affidavit (If not found guilty of substance abuse in a competition/championship)
Affidavit (If not found guilty by the court in a suit/sexual harassment)

application_process: Offline Step1: The interested applicant should take the prescribed format ﻿ of the application form

Step2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the respective sports officer of the concerned district
Step4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

schemes.scheme_name: Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema Award" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor artistes including tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of Konkan
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema Award" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor artistes including tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of Konkani Cinema in the past, addressing the need to acknowledge their significant contributions to this cultural art form. The scheme provides a prestigious annual award consisting of a shawl, memento, citation, and cash purse of ₹50,000/-, with recognition given at a special function held on 24th April every year on the anniversary of the release of the first Konkani film 'Mogacho Anvddo' by late Al-Jerry Braganza, 'The Father of Konkani Cinema'. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Award: ₹50,000/- as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Honorary Items: Shawl, memento, and citation presented to the awardee. Recognition Ceremony: Special function held on 24th April every year on the anniversary of the first Konkani film. *The awardee must be present in person to receive the award at the ceremony. *The award ceremony attendance is mandatory - no proxy or representative acceptance is allowed. *Once received, the award cannot be conferred again in the recipient's lifetime acros
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Award: ₹50,000/- as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Honorary Items: Shawl, memento, and citation presented to the awardee. Recognition Ceremony: Special function held on 24th April every year on the anniversary of the first Konkani film. *The awardee must be present in person to receive the award at the ceremony. *The award ceremony attendance is mandatory - no proxy or representative acceptance is allowed. *Once received, the award cannot be conferred again in the recipient's lifetime across any category. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age. The applicant must have contributed to Konkani Cinema development. Relaxation The age limit of 60 years may be relaxed if the health of the artiste is not well. Selection Considerations The applicant should demonstrate excellence as an actor, script writer, director, playback singer, lyricist, producer, or composer. The applicant may have received awards in their respective field. The applicant should have done innovation on the Konkani Cinema front. The applicant, if a singer/musician, should have songs recorded on vinyl records, Compact Discs, Digital Versatile Discs, online platforms, or brought out in video format. The applicant may have worked in films of other languages in various capacities including acting, directing, singing, composing music, composing lyrics, designing sets, providing background music, or designing light effects. The applicant, if a script writer or lyricist, may have published books of their scripts or lyrics. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Proof of contribution to the Konkani Cinema.

application_process: Offline Step 1: Recommendations are invited from individuals and institutions for deserving candidates
Step 2: Advertisements are published in local newspapers seeking nominations
Step 3: The Executive Board of Tiatr Academy of Goa reviews all recommendations and may also select deserving artistes from outside the recommended list
Step 4: Selection is made based on the specified criteria including years of service, excellence in their field, awards received, innovations made, and published works
Step 5: The selected artiste is informed and must confirm their availability to attend the award ceremony in person
