schemes.scheme_name: Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tiatr Awards
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tiatr Awards" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize the immense contribution of Khell and Khell-Tiatr artistes who have significantly contributed to the
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tiatr Awards" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize the immense contribution of Khell and Khell-Tiatr artistes who have significantly contributed to the development of this traditional art form, addressing the need to honor veteran performers who have dedicated their lives to preserving and promoting this cultural heritage. The scheme provides a prestigious lifetime achievement award consisting of a shawl, memento, citation, and cash burse of ₹50,000/- to deserving artistes, with a comprehensive selection process that evaluates excellence in acting, script writing, directing, singing, lyrics writing, set designing, and other theatrical contributions. The applications are accepted through recommendations from individuals/institutions and advertisements in local newspapers. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash burse of ₹50,000/- awarded to selected artistes. Prestigious recognition through shawl, memento, and citation. Special honor ceremony held annually on 24th October on the Birth Anniversary of Rosario Rodrigues, 'Promoter of Khell-Tiatr'. Maximum 3 artistes are honored each year. *The selected artistes must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash burse of ₹50,000/- awarded to selected artistes. Prestigious recognition through shawl, memento, and citation. Special honor ceremony held annually on 24th October on the Birth Anniversary of Rosario Rodrigues, 'Promoter of Khell-Tiatr'. Maximum 3 artistes are honored each year. *The selected artistes must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age. The applicant must have at least 10 years of contribution in the field of Khell-Tiatr. The applicant must demonstrate excellence as an actor, script writer, director, singer, lyricist, set designer, or other theatrical role in Khell/Khell-Tiatr. The applicant who is an actor/singer/stage manager/lights effects provider/make-up artist/costume designer/live music/background music provider must have performed in at least 10 khell-tiatrs. The applicant who is a writer/director must have written/directed at least 10 khell-tiatrs. *Award can only be received once in a lifetime across all related categories. Evaluation Considerations The applicant's innovative contributions to the presentation of Khell/Khell-Tiatr will be evaluated. The applicant's work in other languages or films beyond Khell/Khell-Tiatr will be considered. The applicant's published books of scripts/lyrics will be taken into account. The applicant's previous awards in the field will be considered. Relaxation Age limit may be relaxed if the health of the artiste is not well. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: *All documents should be submitted as copies.
*Recent photograph must be attached to the application form.
*Additional evidence may include records, certificates, programs, reviews, or other supporting materials.

application_process: Offline The application is through recommendations from individuals or institutions, or through response to advertisements in local newspapers
Step 1: The applicant must take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Alternatively, the interested applicant should visit the Tiatr Academy of Goa, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the designated staff

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields: Recommender Information: Fill in the complete details of the recommender including name, full address, contact numbers (landline and mobile), Aadhaar Card number, and provide a brief description of the recommender (limited to 100 characters)
Nominee Details: Complete the nominee section with full personal information including name with title (Mr

/Miss), stage name, father's name, mother's name, date of birth, age, educational qualification, correspondence address, phone numbers (landline and mobile), Aadhaar Card number, and email identification

Contribution Details: Select the applicable contribution categories by ticking the appropriate boxes (Actor, Singer, Musician, Director, Producer, Writer, Lights, Setting, Sound, Promoter/Organizer, or Other with specification)
Provide detailed information for each selected category including the number of Khell-Tiatrs involved and names of at least 10 productions

Additional Achievements: Fill in information about gramophone records, Compact Discs, Digital Versatile Discs produced, film appearances, published books of Khell-Tiatrs, and awards won for contributions to the Khell-Tiatrs stage
Step 3: Paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required)
Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)

Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment

Selection Process The Executive Board evaluates applications based on the stated criteria through recommendations and also reserves the right to select deserving artistes from outside the recommended list

schemes.scheme_name: Living Craft Treasure Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Living Craft Treasure Award" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This is the highest award for handicrafts at the state level was introduced in the year 2013-2014 to craftsperson’s of eminence who are above the age
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Living Craft Treasure Award" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This is the highest award for handicrafts at the state level was introduced in the year 2013-2014 to craftsperson’s of eminence who are above the age of 65 years. This award consists of a cash prize of Rs.1.00 lakh, a thamirapattiram, an 8-gram gold medal, and a certificate. The award is granted yearly. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prize of ₹1,00,000/-. Thamirapattiram. 8-gram Gold Medal. Certificate.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize of ₹1,00,000/-. Thamirapattiram. 8-gram Gold Medal. Certificate.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artisan. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu. The applicant should be working in the handicraft industry in Tamil Nadu. The applicant should be 65 years of age or above. The experience of the craftsman and the service he has rendered in his profession's special features will be taken into consideration during selection. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Artisan's Affidavit on ₹20/- Stamp Paper, attested by a First Class Criminal Judge or Notary Public.

Recommendation Certificate, attested by any of the Managers of Poombucar Outlets and Manufacturing Plants / the respective Area Assistant Directors (Handicrafts / Craft Council (Tamil Nadu/India/World) under the Office of the Development Commissioner, New Delhi.

application_process: Offline Advertisements are released in June every year
Step 1: The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents (during office hours-Monday-Friday) to the Head Office only through Poompucar Sales and Manufacturing Plant Managers
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)
NOTE: Artisans participating in the examination should send the handicrafts
Application and all documents attached with applications should be on A4 size paper
All documents should be done
Page Numbered and Spiral Binding
All the above should be sent details and recording on CD

schemes.scheme_name: Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Commercial)
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Commercial)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of tiatr, its song and
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Commercial)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of tiatr, its song and music in the past, addressing the need to acknowledge their lifetime dedication to this traditional art form. The scheme provides a comprehensive recognition package including a shawl, memento, citation, and cash award as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa, along with the prestige of being honored at a special function held annually on 14th December on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Joao Agostinho Fernandes, 'The Father of Tiatr'. The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age (with health-based relaxation provision) and must have at least 20 years of contribution in the field of tiatr with specific performance requirements based on their role. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted through recommendations from individuals/institutions and advertisements in local newspapers. ﻿

benefits.summary: Award Components: Shawl, memento, citation, and cash award as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa Special Recognition Ceremony: Honored at a special function organized on 14th December every year on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Joao Agostinho Fernandes, 'The Father of Tiatr' Annual Limit: Not more than 5 artistes from the field will be conferred with awards every year Exclusivity: Award conferred only once in a lifetime across all categories (Commercial/Non-Commercial Tiatr, Khell, Khell-T
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Award Components: Shawl, memento, citation, and cash award as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa Special Recognition Ceremony: Honored at a special function organized on 14th December every year on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Joao Agostinho Fernandes, 'The Father of Tiatr' Annual Limit: Not more than 5 artistes from the field will be conferred with awards every year Exclusivity: Award conferred only once in a lifetime across all categories (Commercial/Non-Commercial Tiatr, Khell, Khell-Tiatr, or Konkani Cinema) *The selected artiste must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age. The applicant must have at least 20 years of contribution in the field of tiatr. The applicant, if an actor/singer/Stage Manager/Lights provider/Make-up artist/Costume designer/Live Music/Background music provider/organizer/contractor, must have performed in at least 30 tiatrs. The applicant, if a writer/director, must have written/directed at least 20 tiatrs. *The age limit of 60 years may be relaxed if the health of the artist is not well. Assessment Criteria The applicant's excellence as an actor, script writer, director, singer, lyricist, set designer will be considered. The applicant's receipt of any awards in their field will be evaluated. The applicant's innovations on the tiatr stage will be assessed. The applicant's songs (kantaram) recorded on records, cassettes, CDs/DVDs or online will be considered (if singer/musician). The applicant's work in dramas in other languages or films besides tiatr will be evaluated. The applicant's published books of scripts/lyrics will be considered (if script writer or lyricist). Post-Selection Conditions The applicant must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Details of Recommender (Name, Address, Contact Number, Brief Details).
List of Tiatrs Written (At Least 20 For Writers)
List of Tiatrs Directed (At Least 20 For Directors)
List of Tiatrs In Which Acted (At Least 30 For Actors)
List of Tiatrs Participated As Singer (At Least 30 For Singers)
List of Tiatrs Played As Musician (At Least 30 For Musicians)
List of Tiatrs Provided Light Effects (At Least 30 For Light Providers)
List of Tiatrs Designed/Operated Background Music (At Least 30 For Music Designers)
List of Tiatrs Designed Stage Setting (At Least 30 For Set Designers)
List of Tiatrs Organized/Contracted (At Least 30 For Organizers)
Details of Gramophone Records, CDs, DVDs Produced (If Applicable)
List Of Films Acted In (If Applicable)

application_process: Offline Applications are accepted through recommendations from individuals/institutions and through advertisements in local newspapers
The Executive Board also has the right to nominate deserving artistes from outside the recommended list
Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
Selection Process: Selection is done based on the stated criteria through evaluation of recommendations and nominations by the Executive Board of Tiatr Academy of Goa
Award Ceremony: Selected awardees are honored at a special function organized on 14th December every year on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Joao Agostinho Fernandes, 'The Father of Tiatr'

schemes.scheme_name: Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Non-Commercial)
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Non-Commercial)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor non-commercial artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of tiatr,
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Non-Commercial)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor non-commercial artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of tiatr, its song and music through yearly Tiatr Festivals/Competitions organized by Kala Academy and by organizing tiatrs in villages, as well as artistes who have enriched Konkani Tiatr and Konkani Song through All India Radio, Doordarshan and other media platforms. The scheme provides lifetime recognition awards consisting of a shawl, a memento, a citation, and a cash burse as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa, with special consideration given to excellence in acting, script writing, directing, singing, lyric writing, set designing, and innovative contributions to the tiatr stage. ﻿

benefits.summary: The Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Award (Non-Commercial) consists of a shawl, a memento, a citation, and a Cash Burse as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa Recognition and honor at a special function on 2nd January on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Lucasinho Ribeiro the 'Pioneer of Tiatr' Lifetime achievement recognition for contribution to tiatr field Awards are conferred annually with not more than 5 artistes receiving the award each year. Awards are presented at a special function on 2n
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Award (Non-Commercial) consists of a shawl, a memento, a citation, and a Cash Burse as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa Recognition and honor at a special function on 2nd January on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Lucasinho Ribeiro the 'Pioneer of Tiatr' Lifetime achievement recognition for contribution to tiatr field Awards are conferred annually with not more than 5 artistes receiving the award each year. Awards are presented at a special function on 2nd January. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be not less than 60 years of age. The applicant should have at least 10 years contribution in the field of tiatr. The applicant should demonstrate excellence as an actor, script writer, director, singer, lyricist, set designer, or other relevant role. The applicant should have performed in at least 10 tiatrs if working as actor/singer/stage manager/lights provider/make-up artist/costume designer/live music/background music. The applicant should have written/directed at least 10 tiatrs if working as a writer/director. Relaxation The age limit of 60 years may be relaxed if the health of the artiste is not well. Post-Selection Conditions *The selected artistes will have to be compulsorily present in person to receive the award. *Tiatr Academy of Goa will confer Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards only once in a lifetime be it in Tiatr (Commercial/Non-Commercial) or Khell or Khell-Tiatr or Konkani Cinema. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Additional Documents/Evidence supporting contribution to tiatr
List of tiatrs with specific contribution details as per role
Documentation of published books (if applicable for script writers/lyricists)
Evidence of recordings on vinyl records, Cassettes, CDs, DVDs, digital media or broadcast on All India Radio/Doordarshan/TV Channels (if applicable for singers/musicians)

application_process: Offline (This scheme operates through a recommendation system rather than direct individual applications) Step 1: Individuals or institutions can recommend deserving artistes by submitting the recommendation form along with complete nominee details
In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)

Step 2: Submit the duly filled and signed recommendation form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 Alternative Method The Executive Board of Tiatr Academy of Goa may also select deserving artistes from outside the recommended list through their own assessment and advertisements in local newspapers

Selection Process Step 1: Selection is done based on established criteria considering years of service, excellence in specific roles, awards received, innovations on tiatr stage, recorded works, contributions to other language dramas or films, published materials, minimum 10 years contribution, and specific performance requirements based on role

Step 2: The Tiatr Academy of Goa Executive Board reviews all recommendations and makes final selections based on the established criteria, with successful candidates being notified for the award ceremony attendance

schemes.scheme_name: Late Jaswantsinhji Thakor and Late Rasiklal Andhariya Classical Music Scholarship
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Late Jaswantsinhji Thakor and Late Rasiklal Andhariya Classical Music Scholarship" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to preserve and promote classical music in Gujarat by offering financial support to eligible Gurus for imparting
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Late Jaswantsinhji Thakor and Late Rasiklal Andhariya Classical Music Scholarship" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to preserve and promote classical music in Gujarat by offering financial support to eligible Gurus for imparting training and to their disciples for receiving it. The scheme facilitates a 10-month classical music training period where selected Gurus can train up to 2 disciples, and both Gurus and disciples receive monetary assistance. The scheme is implemented by Gujarat Rajya Sangeet Natak Akademi, Gandhinagar, which releases a public advertisement annually inviting applications. ﻿ ﻿

benefits.summary: For Gurus: Financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month for a duration of 10 months (i.e., ₹10,000/- per disciple) for training up to 2 disciples. For Disciples: A scholarship of ₹10,000/- per annum, calculated at ₹1,000/- per month for 10 months, for receiving classical music training from the selected Guru. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: For Gurus: Financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month for a duration of 10 months (i.e., ₹10,000/- per disciple) for training up to 2 disciples. For Disciples: A scholarship of ₹10,000/- per annum, calculated at ₹1,000/- per month for 10 months, for receiving classical music training from the selected Guru. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility For Gurus: The applicant should be a classical music artist. The applicant should have completed formal education in classical music or must possess at least 7 years of experience in teaching classical music. The applicant should be capable of training a maximum of 2 disciples during the 10-month training period. For Disciples: The applicant should be a student of classical music residing in Gujarat. The applicant should be undergoing training under an eligible Guru selected under this scheme. The applicant should submit a certificate of training provided by the Guru. ﻿

application_process: Online Step 1: Applications are invited once every year through a public advertisement by Gujarat Rajya Sangeet Natak Akademi
Step 2: Applicants must submit the prescribed application form along with required documents to the designated address
Step 3: The selection committee evaluates the applications and selects eligible Gurus and disciples
Step 4: Both Guru and disciple must submit a report of training conducted and received over 10 months
Step 5: Upon successful verification, scholarship amounts are disbursed directly to the beneficiary accounts

schemes.scheme_name: Lokprasar Prakalpo Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Lokprasar Prakalpo Scheme” was launched by the Department of Information & Cultural Affairs, Government of West Bengal in 2014 to revive the Folk and Tribal Culture in their respective genre across various zones and districts in the State. The scheme is primarily for the financia
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Lokprasar Prakalpo Scheme” was launched by the Department of Information & Cultural Affairs, Government of West Bengal in 2014 to revive the Folk and Tribal Culture in their respective genre across various zones and districts in the State. The scheme is primarily for the financially distressed rural Folk Artists as identified under the laid out procedure to enlist and ensure them with alternative economic support along with scope to further their domain folk culture hence preserving the cultural heritage of different parts of Bengal. The main objectives of the scheme are – 1. To bestow dignity on folk artists by issuing them identity cards 2. To uphold the traditional folk forms of Bengal 3. To revive nearly extinct folk forms of art and culture 4. To uplift the socio-economic conditions of artists associated with folk culture

benefits.summary: 1. Issuing identity cards to each folk artiste. 2. Under the scheme, the veteran and distressed folk-artistes who are above 60 years of age will get a monthly pension of ₹1000/-. 3. The enlisted folk artists under the age of 60 years, who are engaged in publicity campaigns in different departments, have been receiving ₹1000/- per month as a retainer fee. 4. The state government will arrange the minimum income for folk artists by engaging them in the public campaign programme on development proje
benefits.raw_benefits_text: 1. Issuing identity cards to each folk artiste. 2. Under the scheme, the veteran and distressed folk-artistes who are above 60 years of age will get a monthly pension of ₹1000/-. 3. The enlisted folk artists under the age of 60 years, who are engaged in publicity campaigns in different departments, have been receiving ₹1000/- per month as a retainer fee. 4. The state government will arrange the minimum income for folk artists by engaging them in the public campaign programme on development projects such as Kannyasree, Yubasree, Sikshasree, etc. and programmes like Nirmal Bangla, Sarbo Sikhsa Avijan, etc. 5. Performance Fees: Performance-based fees @₹1000/- per head per day as and when engaged to perform their own genre mostly at any Government programme like fair/festival/Krishi Mela/Sabala Mela, etc.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant may have a lineage or belong to a family practicing a given folk form or may belong to a tribal cultural/dance team or a folk-based instrumentalist as recognized by the Folk & Tribal Cultural Centre. The applicant must be between 18 to 60 years. The applicants above 60 years will be eligible for pension. The applicant must be a resident of West Bengal.

required_documents.document_name: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID card, etc.
Bank Account number/ front page of the passbook
Any other documents, as asked by the concerned Department

application_process: Offline Step 01: For taking benefit of this scheme, the applicant needs to contact their district Information & Cultural Affairs Department

Step 02: The Department of Information & Cultural Affairs publishes notifications in various vernacular newspapers from time to time in order to impanel the Folk artists through auditions in different phases held at the district
Step 03: Interested and eligible Folk artists may apply in the prescribed format for the necessary selection procedure
Step 04: After successful verification, the applicant can avail the benefit of the scheme

schemes.scheme_name: Marriage Assistance - Folk Artist
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Marriage Assistance" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This scheme provides financial assistance of ₹2,000/- for the marriage of registered folk artists, or their son or daughter. The assistance aims to support the cultural community by hel
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Marriage Assistance" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This scheme provides financial assistance of ₹2,000/- for the marriage of registered folk artists, or their son or daughter. The assistance aims to support the cultural community by helping with marriage expenses.

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance of ₹2,000/-.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance of ₹2,000/-.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a registered folk artist. The registered folk artist must have no dues payable to the Board. The registered folk artist can apply for financial assistance for their marriage or adult children (son or daughter). The registered folk artist and the person getting married must attain the age prescribed by law for marriage. If both husband and wife are registered folk artists, only one of them is eligible for this assistance per marriage. The family of a registered folk artiste can avail of this assistance only twice.

required_documents.document_name: Registration Card of the Folk Artist.
Certificate from the Village Administrative Officer or Revenue Officer (stating that the applicant has not obtained this assistance from any other schemes)
Witness Photo (from anyone who attained the marriage).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the regional office and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form XIII from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director/Deputy Director in the regional offices
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Assistant Director/Deputy Director to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Marathi Drama Competition 'A' & 'B' Group" is a state-level cultural initiative by the Kala Academy, under the Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of this scheme is to provide a platform and exposure to theatre groups from both urban and rural areas of
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Marathi Drama Competition 'A' & 'B' Group" is a state-level cultural initiative by the Kala Academy, under the Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of this scheme is to provide a platform and exposure to theatre groups from both urban and rural areas of Goa. Entries are invited through press notes published in local dailies. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to participating institutions in the form of to-and-fro transport charges for two vehicles used for transporting artistes and stage materials, as per government-approved rates and Kala Academy norms.

benefits.summary: Free auditorium with necessary infrastructure as per Kala Academy rules. Transport assistance: Hire charges for two vehicles reimbursed for transporting artists and stage material. 80% of gate collection from ticket sales is given to the participating institution. ﻿ Amount of Prizes (Group ‘A’ / Group ‘B’) 1st Prize: ₹ 1,00,000/- / ₹ 75,000/- 2nd Prize: ₹ 50,000/- / ₹ 40,000/- 3rd Prize: ₹ 50,000/- / ₹ 30,000/- Consolation: ₹ 25,000/- each (2 prizes, if >10 performances) / ₹ 20,000/- ﻿ Direction
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Free auditorium with necessary infrastructure as per Kala Academy rules. Transport assistance: Hire charges for two vehicles reimbursed for transporting artists and stage material. 80% of gate collection from ticket sales is given to the participating institution. ﻿ Amount of Prizes (Group ‘A’ / Group ‘B’) 1st Prize: ₹ 1,00,000/- / ₹ 75,000/- 2nd Prize: ₹ 50,000/- / ₹ 40,000/- 3rd Prize: ₹ 50,000/- / ₹ 30,000/- Consolation: ₹ 25,000/- each (2 prizes, if >10 performances) / ₹ 20,000/- ﻿ Direction 1st Prize: ₹ 10,000/- / ₹ 7,000/- 2nd Prize: ₹ 8,000/- / ₹ 6,000/- 3rd Prize: ₹ 5,000/- / ₹ 4,000/- ﻿ Individual – Acting (Male/Female) 1st Prize: ₹ 7,000/- / ₹ 5,000/- 2nd Prize: ₹ 5,000/- / ₹ 3,000/- ﻿ Stage Design/Setting: ₹ 5,000/- / ₹ 4,000/- Lighting: ₹ 5,000/- / ₹ 4,000/- Costume: ₹ 5,000/- / ₹ 4,000/- Background Music: ₹ 5,000/- / ₹ 4,000/- Make-up: ₹ 5,000/- / ₹ 4,000/- ﻿ Script Writing 1st Prize: ₹ 10,000/- / ₹ 7,000/- 2nd Prize: ₹ 7,000/- / ₹ 5,000/- ﻿ Translated/Adapted Script: ₹ 10,000/- / ₹ 7,000/-

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The institution should be registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860. The registration of the institution should be valid and renewed from time to time.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Kala Academy, Panaji, Goa, and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the Member Secretary

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Member Secretary, Kala Academy, Panaji, Goa
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

schemes.scheme_name: Maintenance Grant to Institutions and Organizations Engaged in Cultural Activities
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Maintenance Grant to Institutions and Organizations Engaged in Cultural Activities" scheme was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance grant to the organizations engaged in cultural activities. The applications are accepted offli
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Maintenance Grant to Institutions and Organizations Engaged in Cultural Activities" scheme was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide a maintenance grant to the organizations engaged in cultural activities. The applications are accepted offline.

benefits.summary: Financial assistance gives for maintenance ₹3,000/- and cultural activities ₹5,000/-.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial assistance gives for maintenance ₹3,000/- and cultural activities ₹5,000/-.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility A cultural organization should be engaged in cultural activities for a minimum period of two years. The institution's accounts should be duly audited and approved by a competent person or body, as per the rules outlined in the Memorandum of Association. A cultural organization should not be run for profit to any individual or a body of individuals. Institutions should have submitted utilization certificates for all previously received grants to be eligible for new grants.

required_documents.document_name: Utilization Certificates (for all previously received grants).
List of assets and liabilities of the Institution/Organisation.

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the superintendent, Department of Art and Culture,1, Romain Rolland Street, Puducherry
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the superintendent to whom the application has been submitted

schemes.scheme_name: Mukhyamantri Kalakar Sahayata Yojana
schemes.brief_description: Details Mukhyamantri Kalakar Sahayata Yojana is a scheme under the Odia Language, Literature & Culture Department, Government of Odisha aims to offer sustenance and assistance to elderly artists who, despite facing financial hardship, have consistently devoted themselves to enriching, displaying, an
schemes.detailed_description: Details Mukhyamantri Kalakar Sahayata Yojana is a scheme under the Odia Language, Literature & Culture Department, Government of Odisha aims to offer sustenance and assistance to elderly artists who, despite facing financial hardship, have consistently devoted themselves to enriching, displaying, and preserving the arts and culture of Odisha. Under this scheme, pension is provided to indigent artists who are in distress condition despite his/her lifelong commitment/dedication to our art and culture with their noteworthy contributions. This scheme has been designed to be implemented with specific stipulations with regard to age, income, his/her contribution as an artist and the physical and financial condition of his/her family.

benefits.summary: The financial assistance for an artist shall be ₹1200/- per month. Note: After the first payment is given in cash and the beneficiary is properly identified by the authority, the financial assistance will be deposited every month into the beneficiary's Savings Bank account in any Nationalized Bank.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The financial assistance for an artist shall be ₹1200/- per month. Note: After the first payment is given in cash and the beneficiary is properly identified by the authority, the financial assistance will be deposited every month into the beneficiary's Savings Bank account in any Nationalized Bank.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility An artist in order to be eligible for the assistance shall be of a minimum of 50 years of age in the case of males and 40 years and above in the case of female artists. The annual income of the artist shall not exceed ₹50,000/- only for the artists belonging to the Rural Area and ₹60,000/- only for the artists belonging to the Urban Area or as may further be determined by the Government from time to time. An artist covered under this scheme will not be eligible for similar benefits under any other scheme of the Government. Note: Each year in the month of April, the beneficiary shall furnish his/her Life Certificate in the prescribed Form signed by any Member of Parliament/Member of the Legislative Assembly/any Gazetted Government Officer /Chairman of ULBs/Chairman of any Panchayat Samiti. Cancellation of Pension: On his/her death On the satisfaction of the Government that information furnished to the District Level Selection Committee in pursuance was either erroneous, false or inconclusive (or) On the determination by the Government that the beneficiary has indulged in activities prejudicial to the public interest or public order (or) On his/her ceasing to have the eligibility Non-submission of Life Certificate within the prescribed date line during each year.

required_documents.document_name: 1. Identity proof i.e. Copy of Aadhaar Card, Voter ID
5. Income certificate (Issued by a Competent Authority)

application_process: Online Step 01: To avail of the benefits under the scheme, the applicant need to visit the official login website: http://www
in/ ﻿ Step 02: The applicants need to register, in case not registered, click on “Apply for Registration’’ and fill in all the mandatory details i
Personal details, Address details, Family and Income information, Artist's Skilled Detail, and Bank Details
Step 03: After successful registration, the applicant can login through the user name and password to fill out the application form
Step 04: Fill all the mandatory details in the application form and upload all the required documents
Step 05: Submit the application form after verifying all the filled details

Note: The Department shall publish an advertisement in the print, and electronic media and on the Department’s website seeking applications from eligible artists within a period of 2 months from the date of such publication
Procedure of Selection: Step 01: There shall be a Selection Committee in each District with the Collector & District Magistrate as the Chairman
The concerned District Culture Officer shall place the applications before the Selection Committee for consideration
Step 02: The Selection Committee shall scrutinize each application with respect to the genuineness of the artists as per eligible criteria
The selection of artists shall be finalized by the Committee and approved by the Collector of the District
Step 03: The approved list shall be forwarded to the Director, Odia Bhasa, Sahitya & Sanskruti Department for release of financial assistance
Step 04: The approval of artists shall be individually communicated by the District Level Selection Committee
Step 05: In case the total numbers of beneficiaries are not selected in the first year, fresh advertisements may be made during the next year to fill up the target allotted to the District

schemes.scheme_name: Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Disability Assistance
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Disability Assistance” scheme has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. Under this scheme, one-time monetary support is provided to eligible disabled artists and litterateurs for disability-rel
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Disability Assistance” scheme has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. Under this scheme, one-time monetary support is provided to eligible disabled artists and litterateurs for disability-related medical treatment. The assistance helps beneficiaries manage treatment expenses arising from permanent or severe physical disability. ﻿

benefits.summary: One-time financial assistance of up to ₹1,00,000/-. Assistance is provided exclusively for the treatment of physical disability. NOTE: Direct transfer to the beneficiary’s bank account. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: One-time financial assistance of up to ₹1,00,000/-. Assistance is provided exclusively for the treatment of physical disability. NOTE: Direct transfer to the beneficiary’s bank account. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh. The applicant should be a physically disabled artist or litterateur. The applicant should be 21 years of age or above. The applicant’s monthly income from all sources, including spouse income, should not exceed ₹10,000. The total monthly family income, including dependents, should not exceed ₹20,000. NOTE: Income limits are revised annually with a 6 percent increase for eligibility calculation. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Bank Account Details with IFSC Code

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant downloads the application form ( Page No
8 ) from the official website
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Director, Directorate of Culture, Madhya Pradesh

schemes.scheme_name: Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Death Assistance
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Death Assistance” scheme has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the legal dependents of deceased artists and litterateurs. Under this schem
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Death Assistance” scheme has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the legal dependents of deceased artists and litterateurs. Under this scheme, one-time ex-gratia financial support is provided to the lawful heir to help the family cope with financial hardship after the death of the artist or litterateur. ﻿

benefits.summary: One-time ex-gratia financial assistance of up to ₹1,00,000 paid to the legal heir of the deceased artist or litterateur. NOTE: Preference is given to the spouse of the deceased. Assistance may continue to other dependents until marriage, employment, or attainment of 21 years of age, whichever is earlier. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: One-time ex-gratia financial assistance of up to ₹1,00,000 paid to the legal heir of the deceased artist or litterateur. NOTE: Preference is given to the spouse of the deceased. Assistance may continue to other dependents until marriage, employment, or attainment of 21 years of age, whichever is earlier. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be the legal heir or dependent of the deceased artist or litterateur. The deceased should have been an artist or litterateur of Madhya Pradesh. The applicant should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh. The applicant’s (husband/wife) monthly income should not exceed ₹10,000/-. The family’s monthly income should not exceed ₹20,000/-. Families of government employees are not eligible. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Bank Account Details with IFSC Code

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Director, Directorate of Culture, Madhya Pradesh

schemes.brief_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Serious Illness / Accident / Calamity Assistance” scheme has beenn launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to artists and litterateurs suffering from se
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Kalakar Evam Sahityakar Kalyan Kosh Niyam- Serious Illness / Accident / Calamity Assistance” scheme has beenn launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to artists and litterateurs suffering from serious or long-term illnesses, accidents, or calamities. Under this scheme, one-time financial support is provided to meet medical treatment expenses that the beneficiary cannot afford. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance One-time financial assistance of up to ₹50,000. Provided for serious or long-term illness, accident, or calamity-related treatment. Mode of Disbursement Direct bank transfer to the beneficiary account. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance One-time financial assistance of up to ₹50,000. Provided for serious or long-term illness, accident, or calamity-related treatment. Mode of Disbursement Direct bank transfer to the beneficiary account. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artist or a litterateur. The applicant should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh. The applicant should be suffering from a serious or long-term illness, accident, or calamity. The applicant’s (husband/wife) monthly income should not exceed ₹10,000. The total family income should not exceed ₹20,000 per month. The writer/artist's fully dependent spouse, fully dependent parents, dependent minor brothers and sisters, dependent minor children, dependent widowed daughter, and dependent differently-abled brothers and sisters are eligible to get assistance. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Bank Account Details with IFSC Code

schemes.scheme_name: Madhya Pradesh Non-Government Institution Grant Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Non-Government Institution Grant Scheme” has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to non-government cultural institutions for the preservation, promotion, and development of art, culture,
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Madhya Pradesh Non-Government Institution Grant Scheme” has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to non-government cultural institutions for the preservation, promotion, and development of art, culture, and literature by offering maintenance, equipment, and camp or event grants to eligible institutions actively engaged in artistic and literary fields. ﻿

benefits.summary: Types of Financial Assistance Maintenance Grant Provided for training activities and art performances. Annual recurring grant. Maximum assistance up to 90% of the approved project or activity cost. Equipment Grant Provided for the purchase of books, musical instruments, audio-visual equipment, electrical equipment, furniture, cameras, record players, and workshop tools. Non-recurring grant. Maximum assistance up to 90% of the actual expenditure. Camp and Event Grant Provided for training camps,
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Types of Financial Assistance Maintenance Grant Provided for training activities and art performances. Annual recurring grant. Maximum assistance up to 90% of the approved project or activity cost. Equipment Grant Provided for the purchase of books, musical instruments, audio-visual equipment, electrical equipment, furniture, cameras, record players, and workshop tools. Non-recurring grant. Maximum assistance up to 90% of the actual expenditure. Camp and Event Grant Provided for training camps, cultural camps, and special cultural or literary events. Maximum assistance up to 90% of the proposed total expenditure. ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a non-governmental cultural institution. The institution should be registered under the Madhya Pradesh Society Registration Act, 1973, or other applicable law. The institution should be continuously active for at least 3 years prior to the application year. The institution should be engaged in art, culture, literature, training, research, or performances. The institution should have cultural and literary objectives clearly mentioned in its registered constitution. The institution should be operating within Madhya Pradesh. ﻿ ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Society Registration Certificate (Valid at the Time of Application)
Activity Report for the Last 3 Years
Chartered Accountant-Certified Utilization Certificate (If Grant Received in Last 3 Years)
Authorization Letter from the Managing Committee
Bank Account Details of the Institution
Affidavit Regarding Non-Political and Non-Religious Activities

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the respective Director, Directorate of Culture, Bhopal
NOTE: The applicant should submit a Chartered Accountant-certified Utilization Certificate if grants were received during the last 3 financial years
The applicant should invite public representatives and district administration officials to support programs

schemes.scheme_name: Mukhyamantri Udeeyman Khiladi Unnayan Chhatravriti Yojana
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Mukhyamantri Udeeyman Khiladi Unnayan Chhatravriti Yojana” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports among talented children aged 8 to 14 years in Uttarakhand by providing monthly scholarships. ﻿
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Mukhyamantri Udeeyman Khiladi Unnayan Chhatravriti Yojana” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports among talented children aged 8 to 14 years in Uttarakhand by providing monthly scholarships. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, players aged 8 to 14 years are selected every year on the basis of the Physical and Sports Aptitude Test (P-SAT). From each district, 150 boys and 150 girls are selected (25 boys and 25 girls from each age group: 8–9 years, 9–10 years, 10–11 years, 11–12 years, 12–13 years, and 13–14 years). Each selected player is awarded a scholarship of ₹1,500/- per month for one year. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under this scheme, players aged 8 to 14 years are selected every year on the basis of the Physical and Sports Aptitude Test (P-SAT). From each district, 150 boys and 150 girls are selected (25 boys and 25 girls from each age group: 8–9 years, 9–10 years, 10–11 years, 11–12 years, 12–13 years, and 13–14 years). Each selected player is awarded a scholarship of ₹1,500/- per month for one year. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant must be a boy or girl between 8 and 14 years of age. The boy or girl who obtain the highest marks based on merit in the final district-level competition, conducted through various stages of the Physical and Sports Aptitude Test (P-SAT) assessing physical abilities such as strength, flexibility, endurance, speed, and coordination, will be eligible for the sports scholarship. ﻿

application_process: Offline The Sports Directorate will publish the selection schedule through an advertisement in April
The selection process is typically completed between May 15 and June 15 each year, and information regarding the venue and dates will be provided by the respective District Sports Officer
A maximum of two boys and two girls from each school (government, non-government, or private) will be eligible to participate in each age group
The selection of these students will be carried out by the respective schools themselves

There will be no compulsion to conduct the Physical and Sports Aptitude Test (P-SAT) at the school level; however, schools will be informed about this method through wide publicity so that players are aware of the process at the initial stage
Further process – The subsequent selection is conducted by the districts at the Nyaya Panchayat, Municipality, Municipal Corporation, Block Development, and district levels: Sl

Level Participant Source Number Selected for Next Step 1 Nyaya Panchayat / Nagar Panchayat 2 boys and girls participants from each school For Block Level – 2 boys and 2 girls per age group 2 (a) Municipal Corporation / Municipality Level Selection Committee 2 boys and 2 girls participants from each school For district level - (a) From Municipality - 3 boys and 3 girls per age group (for Rudraprayag, Bageshwar, and Champawat districts – 5 boys and 5 girls per age group per Municipality) (b) From Municipal Corporation - 6 boys and 6 girls per age group 3 (b) From each Block Development From Nyaya Panchayat / Nagar Panchayat – 2 boys and 2 girls per age group For district level- from Block Development - 6 boys and 6 girls per age group (for Rudraprayag, Bageshwar, and Champawat districts – 10 boys and 10 girls per age group per Block Development) Six competitions will be organized to test physical efficiency (1
30-meter flying run, 2
Standing broad jump, 3
Forward bend and reach, 4
6×10 shuttle run, 5
Medicine ball put, 6
600-meter run) The district-level selection committee will prepare a final list of 25 boys and 25 girls in each age group who secure the highest marks based on merit
These selected players will be eligible for the sports scholarship, which will be directly transferred to their bank accounts through DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer)
Documents Required: It is mandatory to register candidates at the Nyaya Panchayat or ward level
The application form is available on the Sports Department’s website
Along with the application form, candidates must submit their Aadhaar card, birth certificate, permanent residence certificate, bank account details, and a passport-size photograph

schemes.scheme_name: National Handicrafts Development Programme: Direct Benefit to Artisans - Supports to Artisans in Indigent Circumstances
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Direct Benefit to Artisans - Supports to Artisans in Indigent Circumstances" is a component of the Umbrella Scheme "National Handicrafts Development Programme (NHDP)" by the Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The scheme is introduced to support the artisans during their old ag
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Direct Benefit to Artisans - Supports to Artisans in Indigent Circumstances" is a component of the Umbrella Scheme "National Handicrafts Development Programme (NHDP)" by the Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The scheme is introduced to support the artisans during their old age. The scheme is designed to give a boost to the handicraft sector in India. Assistance of upto ₹8,000/- per month is granted to the Artisans in Indigent Circumstances in the form of monthly allowance or lump sum grant or both, through PFMS/DBT.

benefits.summary: Assistance of upto ₹8,000/- per month is granted in the form of a monthly allowance or lump sum grant or both, disbursed via the Public Financial Management System (PFMS)/ Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Assistance of upto ₹8,000/- per month is granted in the form of a monthly allowance or lump sum grant or both, disbursed via the Public Financial Management System (PFMS)/ Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a master craftsperson who is the recipient of the Shilp Guru Award/ National Award/ Merit Certificate/ State Award/ any other bigger award. The annual income of the artisan should not exceed ₹1,00,000/- in the preceding financial year. The applicant should not be a recipient of similar financial assistance from any other source. The artisan should not be less than 60 years of age on the date of application. Age may be relaxed in the case of artisans with disabilities, subject to submission of the Certificate issued by the appropriate authority.

required_documents.document_name: 2. Self-Attested Copy of the Certificate of Handicrafts Award bestowed by the Central/State Government.
5. Disability Certificate, in case of Physically Handicapped Artisan.
6. Affidavit Duly Attested by the First-Class Magistrate in the Prescribed Format.

*Upon selection, every financial year, the master craftsperson has to submit an income certificate and an affidavit in the prescribed format duly countersigned by the 1st Class Magistrate for seeking financial support.

application_process: Offline The applications from the eligible master craftsperson would be invited every year by making wide publicity through advertisement
Step 1: The eligible artisan should take print of the prescribed format of the application form

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: The interested applicant should submit the duly filled and signed application form and the documents to the Handicrafts Service Centre/Regional Office

Step 4: On receipt of the application, necessary entries will be made in the application receipt register and a unique number is assigned to the applicant for identifying each applicant which shall be used for all further references and also as acknowledgement for the receipt of the application
Post-Application Processes Step 1: On receipts of applications inspections will be done by the field officer
Step 2: The applications completed in all respects shall be processed within 30 days

On the recommendation of the Regional Director, the Core Committee under the Chairmanship of the Development Commissioner (Handicrafts) would finalize the selection of the master craftsperson for financial assistance
Step 3: The financial assistance will be disbursed through the in-charge in the respective field formation of the Office of the Development Commissioner (Handicrafts)

*If there is any gap in extending the financial support due to non-submission of income certificate/enhancement of income criteria, the applicant has to apply as a fresh application according to the financial support

schemes.scheme_name: National Handicrafts Development Programme: Research & Development Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Research & Development Scheme" is a component of the Umbrella Scheme "National Handicrafts Development Programme (NHDP)" by the Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The scheme is introduced to generate feedback on the economic, social, aesthetic, and promotional aspects of various craf
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Research & Development Scheme" is a component of the Umbrella Scheme "National Handicrafts Development Programme (NHDP)" by the Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The scheme is introduced to generate feedback on the economic, social, aesthetic, and promotional aspects of various crafts and artisans in the handicraft sector. Under this scheme, the surveys and studies are sponsored/conducted to generate suitable inputs for planning purposes. Also, workshops, seminars, conferences, radio programs, etc. are organized in online as well as offline mode to sensitize the artisans on the latest development in the Handicrafts sector. ﻿ Key Highlights: 1. Surveys & Studies a) Surveys/ Studies of specific crafts and mapping and documentation of a database on craft clusters and specific craft pockets, present market trend and status, existing export and future export openings, etc. b) Problem relating to the availability of raw materials, technology, design, common facilities, etc. c) Socioeconomic condition of the artisan. d) Market evaluation studies of specific crafts for either domestic or overseas markets. e) Techno-economic feasibility studies and post-evaluation of the various promotional projects programs undertaken in the handicrafts sector. 2. Financial Assistance for registration of GI crafts (including registration of authorized users), preparation of legal para, standards, audits, and other documentation leading to labeling/certification. 3. Financial Assistance to organizations for evolving, and developing a mechanism for protecting crafts including Endangered crafts, design, heritage, and traditional knowledge. 4. Conducting a Census of Handicraft artisans of the country and publishing the same in handbook/e-book format for future reference. 5. Assisting handicrafts exporters in the adoption of global standards, including handicrafts marks, branding, bar coding, and other similar standards 6. Conducting workshops/seminars on issues of specific issues relating to the handicrafts sector. 7. Evaluation / Impact Assessment Studies of Handicrafts Schemes. 8. Need-based financial assistance to Government departments/ministries, institutes of national importance and export promotional councils, etc.

benefits.summary: The financial assistance shall be extended to eligible organizations as 100% grants in aid. The payments to all beneficiaries/concerned must be made through PFMS only. The disbursement of the assistance will be in two installments: a) 1st Installment: 75% of the sanctioned amount will be released as an advance. b) 2nd Installment: 25% of the sanctioned amount will be in the form of reimbursement. ﻿ a) Financial Assistance for Conducting Studies/Surveys: Head: Project Leader (1); Max. Permissible

The disbursement of the assistance will be in two installments: a) 1st Installment: 75% of the sanctioned amount will be released as an advance. b) 2nd Installment: 25% of the sanctioned amount will be in the form of reimbursement. ﻿ a) Financial Assistance for Conducting Studies/Surveys: Head: Project Leader (1); Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 60,000/- Head: Boarding & Lodging for Resource Persons (Max. 4); Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 9,000/- per head Head: T.A. to Resource Persons; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 12,000/- per person or AC-I/Air-Fare economy class whichever is less. Head: For International Experts; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 70,000 /- per person or economy class airfare, whichever is less. Head: Honorarium to Resource Persons; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 4,000/- per person Head: T.A. to participants including journey period; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 2,000/- per participant/artisan or AC-III tier fare whichever is less. Head: DA to the participants; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 300/- per participant/artisan Head: Documentation & Videography; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 40,000/- Head: Hiring of Conveyance; Maximum Permissible Amount (in ₹): 50,000/- Head: Refreshments & Tea, Lunch, etc; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 400/- per participant/artisan Head: Publicity including banners, backdrops, pamphlets, booklet, etc; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 65,000/- Head: Miscellaneous; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 5% of the total cost, i.e., from (1) to (10). Head: Administrative Cost; Max. Permissible Amount (in ₹): 3% of total project cost, i.e., from (1) to (11). ﻿ Note 1: The project duration of the Survey/Study can vary from 3 months to 12 months and the duration of the Seminar/Workshop is one day. Note 2: In special cases, the number of days and financial limit can be increased with special approval of the Competent Authority.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Grants-in-aid can be given to a public body or an institution having a distinct legal entity viz. Institutions or Organizations setup as Autonomous Organisations, under a specific statute or as a society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, or Indian Trusts Act, 1882. Producer Companies and Section-8 Companies (Company Act, 2013). Non-Government Organizations. Educational and Other Institutions. Urban and Rural Local Self-government Institutions. Export Promotion Councils. Central Cottage Industries Emporium (CCIC). National Crafts Museum & Hastkala Academy, New Delhi. State/Central Govt. Agencies etc. ﻿ The applicant should certify the following in the application form: No financial assistance has been received from any other source for the same purpose. The provision of the scheme has been fully understood and we take responsibility for the successful completion of the project within the sanctioned project duration. All infrastructure is available with the organization to conduct the programs as per the scheme. There is no duplication of efforts taking Place with existing schemes of the Ministries. No UC is pending in any scheme of the O/o DC (Handicrafts). The organization is registered with Public Finance Management System and will adhere to the Provisions/guidelines of the Department of Expenditure from time to time, in this regard.

schemes.scheme_name: Nirman Shramik Antrashtriya Khel Pratiyogiyo Hetu Protsahan Yojana
schemes.brief_description: Details The purpose of this scheme is to encourage registered beneficiaries employed in building and other construction works and their children to participate in international sports. This scheme will be effective on those employed in the Labour Department building and other construction workers wh
schemes.detailed_description: Details The purpose of this scheme is to encourage registered beneficiaries employed in building and other construction works and their children to participate in international sports. This scheme will be effective on those employed in the Labour Department building and other construction workers who are registered as beneficiaries in the board under Section-12 of the The Building and Other Construction Workers (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act, 1996, and are depositing their contributions regularly. This scheme will be effective in the entire state of Rajasthan.

benefits.summary: The incentive amount under this scheme for International level sports competition to the eligible beneficiary or his children will be given as follows: - Participating in the competition- ₹ 2,00,000/- On receiving the Bronze medal- ₹5,00,000/- On receiving the Silver medal- ₹8,00,000/- On receiving the Gold medal- ₹11,00,000/-
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The incentive amount under this scheme for International level sports competition to the eligible beneficiary or his children will be given as follows: - Participating in the competition- ₹ 2,00,000/- On receiving the Bronze medal- ₹5,00,000/- On receiving the Silver medal- ₹8,00,000/- On receiving the Gold medal- ₹11,00,000/-

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan State. For this scheme, those construction workers will be eligible, who are registered as labour under labour law. Those building and other construction workers will be eligible who are registered as beneficiaries in the board under Section-12 of The Building and Other Construction Workers (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act, 1996 and are depositing their contribution regularly. In addition to the above, unmarried sons and daughters of construction workers will also be eligible for assistance under the scheme. Other Terms & Conditions: The provisions of the scheme will not be applicable to any online gaming / betting-related competition. Declaration of invalidity of Sportsperson or withdrawal of medals won by the participant due to doping or any valid reason stipulated by the organising committee no incentives will be payable under the scheme. During scrutiny of the application and documents, if any facts are found to be false resulting in the cancellation of eligibility, it will be the responsibility of the concerned beneficiary to deposit all the assistance amount sanctioned under the scheme along with interest.

required_documents.document_name: 1. Copy of the beneficiary registration identity card.
2. Copy of the beneficiary's Aadhaar and Jan Aadhaar card.
3. First page of the beneficiary savings bank account passbook (in which the beneficiary name, bank account number and IFS code are mentioned).
4. Copy of the certificate issued by the International Sports Organizing Committee / Federation / Association / Council.

application_process: Online Step 1: The application has to be submitted by the beneficiary on Board's Online Portal in the form prescribed

Step 2: Approval and selection of the candidate will be done by the senior-most officer of the labour office or the competent authority appointed by the secretary after the application has been examined
Step 3: Time period for submission of application - Application can be submitted within a period of 6 months from the date of completion of International Sports Competition/Tournament
Step 4: The incentive amount will be transferred through electronic means (RTGS / NEFT) to the candidate's bank account under the central banking system

schemes.scheme_name: Orientation Courses in Dramatics
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Orientation Courses in Dramatics" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to improve the quality of tiatr performances. The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops covering script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, lig
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Orientation Courses in Dramatics" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to improve the quality of tiatr performances. The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops covering script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, light effects, costumes, make-up, and the history of tiatr. These workshops are conducted as per the syllabus formulated by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, led by graduates of the National School of Drama or Kala Academy School of Drama, with tiatr-specific aspects handled by personnel involved in the field. The training is preliminary, intended to help tiatr artistes enhance performance standards. The applicant must be an individual interested in training in tiatr's various aspects, including song and music performances, and must submit a self-attested copy of their Aadhaar Card with the application. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Applications for this scheme are accepted through the local press or by invitation to Konkani Dramatic Troupes. ﻿

benefits.summary: • Training and Skill Enhancement: The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops in various aspects of dramatics, including script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, light effects, costumes, make-up, and the history of tiatr. These courses and workshops are intended to help tiatr artistes improve the standard and quality of tiatr performances. • Expert Instruction: Workshops are conducted by graduates of the National School of Dra
benefits.raw_benefits_text: • Training and Skill Enhancement: The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops in various aspects of dramatics, including script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, light effects, costumes, make-up, and the history of tiatr. These courses and workshops are intended to help tiatr artistes improve the standard and quality of tiatr performances. • Expert Instruction: Workshops are conducted by graduates of the National School of Drama or Kala Academy School of Drama, with tiatr-specific aspects handled by personnel involved in the field of tiatr, to ensure high-quality and relevant training for participants. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an individual. The applicant must be interested in getting trained in various aspects of tiatr, including its song and music performances. ﻿ ﻿

*The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds

schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Organisation of Cultural Programs” was introduced by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to cultural groups and artists registered with the Department of Culture for performing in cultural programs o
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Organisation of Cultural Programs” was introduced by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to cultural groups and artists registered with the Department of Culture for performing in cultural programs organized during traditional fairs, festivals, regional celebrations within and outside the state, as well as on the occasion of national festivals. ﻿

benefits.summary: After the presentation of cultural programmes by groups/folk singers enlisted with the Culture Department on the occasion of traditional fairs, festivals, celebrations, and national festivals organized within or outside the state, the following honorarium and allowances are payable: Group Leader: Honorarium of ₹1,000/- and travelling allowance of ₹500/-. Other Artists: Honorarium of ₹800/- each and travelling allowance of ₹400/- each. Folk Singers: Category A: ₹7,500/- as honorarium. Category B:
benefits.raw_benefits_text: After the presentation of cultural programmes by groups/folk singers enlisted with the Culture Department on the occasion of traditional fairs, festivals, celebrations, and national festivals organized within or outside the state, the following honorarium and allowances are payable: Group Leader: Honorarium of ₹1,000/- and travelling allowance of ₹500/-. Other Artists: Honorarium of ₹800/- each and travelling allowance of ₹400/- each. Folk Singers: Category A: ₹7,500/- as honorarium. Category B: ₹4,250/- as honorarium. Travelling allowance: ₹300/- along with ordinary bus fare or second-class rail fare for the journey. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a cultural group or an artist registered with the Department of Culture, Uttarakhand. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Details and total number of artists in the group
Certificate of being a native or permanent resident of Uttarakhand (for the artists)

application_process: Offline The Directorate of Culture conducts auditions periodically to shortlist cultural groups and artists

For the selection of a cultural group, the following documents are required: the organization’s registration certificate, a copy of its bylaws, details and number of the group’s artists, and a certificate confirming that the members are natives or permanent residents of Uttarakhand
At present, the department has a total of 267 cultural groups and 226 solo artists on its list

schemes.scheme_name: Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the rich experiences of veteran tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely to the development of Tiatr, as th
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the rich experiences of veteran tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely to the development of Tiatr, as their experiences form a part and parcel of the history of Tiatr for future generations. The scheme provides video recording of artistes' experiences on High Definition or higher format camera with preservation on Digital Versatile Disc at Tiatr Academy of Goa's Library and a onetime remuneration as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must have made at least 20 years contribution to the Konkani stage and must be a script writer, director, actor, singer, musician, backstage artiste or organizer involved in tiatrs. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Benefits Onetime remuneration as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa to the artiste to be documented. Additional amount as decided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for artistes living outside Goa. Remuneration to the interviewer as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Non-Financial Benefits Video recording of artiste's experiences on High Definition or higher format camera. Preservation of documentation on Digital Versatile Disc at Tiatr Academy of Goa's Library. One copy of the Digital Versati
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Benefits Onetime remuneration as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa to the artiste to be documented. Additional amount as decided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for artistes living outside Goa. Remuneration to the interviewer as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Non-Financial Benefits Video recording of artiste's experiences on High Definition or higher format camera. Preservation of documentation on Digital Versatile Disc at Tiatr Academy of Goa's Library. One copy of the Digital Versatile Disc provided to the artiste concerned. Potential upload of recording on Tiatr Academy of Goa's website, other internet sites, or other media channels. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a veteran artist who has contributed to the development of Tiatr. The applicant must be a script writer, director, actor, singer, musician, backstage artiste involved in stage setting, light effects, background music, costumes, make-up, or those involved in organizing tiatrs. The applicant must have made at least 20 years of contribution to the Konkani stage. The applicant who is a writer or director must have scripted at least 15 tiatrs. The applicant who is other than writer or director must have participated in at least 20 tiatrs. Preference, Selection and Implementation At least five artistes will be considered for documentation in a financial year. Artistes will be selected by the Managing Committee of Tiatr Academy of Goa. Preference will be given to old and sick artistes. ﻿

Application Form (Oral Documentation Of History Of Tiatr Data Form)
Video Clippings Of The Artiste (If Available)
