Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Provide detailed information about your contribution to the tiatr stage on a separate sheet as indicated in the form

*The Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules of the scheme

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The child should be under 18 years of age. The child should be in conflict with the law. The child should have been admitted to the Juvenile Welfare Board.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Office/ Sub-Office of the Department of Social Welfare, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the authority given below - Puducherry: The Deputy Director, Differently Abled Section, Directorate of Social Welfare
Karaikal: The Assistant Director, Social Welfare Department (Sub Office)
Mahe / Yanam: The Welfare Officer (i\c), Social Welfare Department (Sub Office)
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

The scheme aims to promote sports and identify grassroots-level talent among youth through structured competitions
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Organization of Sports Competitions and Training Programs" was launched by the Department of Youth Welfare and prantiy rakshak dal (PRD), Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports and identify grassroots-level talent among youth through structured competitions and training. ﻿

benefits.summary: Organizing Khel Mahakumbh Competitions – Various sports competitions are organized for the age groups Under-14, Under-17, and Under-21. Prizes are awarded for first, second, and third places as follows: Sl. No. Level 1 st Rank (Cash Prize ₹) 2 nd Rank (Cash Prize ₹) 3 rd Rank (Cash Prize ₹) 1 Gram Panchayat ₹300/- ₹200/- ₹150/- 2 Block Development ₹500/- ₹400/- ₹300/- 3 District Level ₹800/- ₹600/- ₹400/- 4 State Level ₹1,500/- ₹1,000/- ₹700/- During the competitions, talented players who perfor
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Organizing Khel Mahakumbh Competitions – Various sports competitions are organized for the age groups Under-14, Under-17, and Under-21. Prizes are awarded for first, second, and third places as follows: Sl. No. Level 1 st Rank (Cash Prize ₹) 2 nd Rank (Cash Prize ₹) 3 rd Rank (Cash Prize ₹) 1 Gram Panchayat ₹300/- ₹200/- ₹150/- 2 Block Development ₹500/- ₹400/- ₹300/- 3 District Level ₹800/- ₹600/- ₹400/- 4 State Level ₹1,500/- ₹1,000/- ₹700/- During the competitions, talented players who perform best at the Block Development levels and District levels are identified by the department and provided free training prior to state-level participation. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant must be a youth (boy or girl). ﻿

application_process: Offline The Khel Mahakumbh is usually held between October and December

Newspapers provide information about the competitions at the Gram Panchayat/Nyaya Panchayat level, and interested participants are invited to take part through forms distributed by government schools, the Youth Welfare Department, and the Sports Department
To participate, players must possess a photo identity card or birth certificate, a bank account, a permanent residence certificate, and a passport-size photograph
With these documents, players can compete in the Khel Mahakumbh at the village or Nyaya Panchayat level
Players securing first, second, and third positions at this level advance to the Block Development level
Similarly, the top three players at the Block Development level proceed to the District level, and the top three at the District level qualify for the State level competition

schemes.scheme_name: Operation of Sports Hostels
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Operation of Sports Hostels" was introduced by the Tribal Area Development Department, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to encourage tribal students in Scheduled Areas to participate in sports and prepare them for national and international competitions. Under this scheme, tribal
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Operation of Sports Hostels" was introduced by the Tribal Area Development Department, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to encourage tribal students in Scheduled Areas to participate in sports and prepare them for national and international competitions. Under this scheme, tribal students from Class 6 to 12 are provided with free residential facilities, training in archery and athletics by skilled coaches, nutritious meals, uniforms, and modern sports equipment. The scheme is implemented in the following District: Banswara, Dungarpur, Sirohi, Udaipur & Pratapgarh.

benefits.summary: The following facilities are provided in the sports hostel: Free residential accommodation in sports hostels. Nutritious meals, snacks, and special dietary arrangements as per approved pattern. Sports training with modern equipment by expert coaches (especially in archery and athletics). Free school uniforms and educational materials.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The following facilities are provided in the sports hostel: Free residential accommodation in sports hostels. Nutritious meals, snacks, and special dietary arrangements as per approved pattern. Sports training with modern equipment by expert coaches (especially in archery and athletics). Free school uniforms and educational materials.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe community. The applicant should be studying in class 6 th to 12 th . The applicant should not have any disability or suffering from any serious illness. The applicant’s parents/guardians should not be income tax payers. The applicant should not be a failed student in the last examination. Note: Only those students who pass the selection test will be admitted to the sports hostel.

required_documents.document_name: Education Qualification Marksheet/Certificate Copy (Last Class Marksheet)

application_process: Online - via CSCs Step 1: The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme
Step 2: The applicant should visit the nearest E-Mitra Center and complete the Biometric Verification Process
Step 3: The applicant should ensure that the E-Mitra Center agent completes all mandatory fields in the application form and uploads copies of all required documents
Step 4: Keep the acknowledgment receipt for future reference

schemes.scheme_name: Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons in State Services
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons in State Services” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide job opportunities to medal-winning sportspersons of Uttarakhand, who have represented the state in international and national
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons in State Services” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide job opportunities to medal-winning sportspersons of Uttarakhand, who have represented the state in international and national games, by offering them out-of-turn employment in various state services. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, medal-winning players from Uttarakhand who have represented the state in International or National Games are provided out-of-turn employment on Gazetted and Non-Gazetted posts (from Level-3 to Level-10) across various government departments. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under this scheme, medal-winning players from Uttarakhand who have represented the state in International or National Games are provided out-of-turn employment on Gazetted and Non-Gazetted posts (from Level-3 to Level-10) across various government departments. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility State players/sportspersons who have won gold, silver, or bronze medals in international or national games, such as the Olympic/Paralympic Games, World Cup/World Championship, Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, Asian Championship, Commonwealth Championship, SAF Games, and National Games, are eligible under the scheme. Players/sportspersons participating in any of the following sports will be considered eligible: Athletics, Archery, Badminton, Basketball, Boxing, Canoeing & Kayaking, Cycling, Diving, Equestrian, Fencing, Football, Golf, Handball, Hockey, Judo, Lawn Tennis, Shooting, Rowing, Sailing, Swimming, Table Tennis, Taekwondo, Volleyball, Weightlifting, Wrestling, Baseball, Chess, Cricket, Kabaddi, Karate, Kho-Kho, and Mallakhamb. The player/sportsperson must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The player/sportsperson must have represented the state of Uttarakhand in the National Games in the year and competition for which they are applying for employment. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: All the certificates should be self-attested.

application_process: Offline As outlined in Government Order No
2023, the Sports Directorate will receive vacancy details from the relevant departments and publish advertisements in newspapers to recruit eligible athletes
Upon receiving applications directly from the Director, Sports Directorate, the committee will review the applications and submit its recommendations within two months
The Sports Department will forward the committee’s recommendations to the respective departments
Selected medal-winning athletes will be appointed to supernumerary positions by the relevant department within four months
For employment, athletes must possess the minimum educational qualifications required for the position
However, the committee may consider granting exemptions or relaxations for medal-winning athletes regarding mandatory or preferred qualifications
If a medal winner does not possess the required educational qualifications at the time of appointment, the department will allow the athlete up to four years to acquire the necessary qualifications
Medal-winning athletes must submit their applications to the sports offices within two years (for seniors) and three years (for juniors) after achieving their success
Applications must include the completed form along with the medal-winning certificates, Aadhaar card, and permanent residence certificate
Medal-winning athletes from 10 years ago and 5 years ago will be eligible to apply within 12 months from the date of issuance of this Government Order
schemes.ministry_department: Department of Sports
schemes.implementing_agency: Department of Sports

schemes.scheme_name: Production of Audio Albums of songs on Patriotism & National Integration
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Production of Audio Albums of songs on Patriotism & National Integration" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to strengthen the values of Patriotism & National Integration among members of Tiat
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Production of Audio Albums of songs on Patriotism & National Integration" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to strengthen the values of Patriotism & National Integration among members of Tiatr fraternity, addressing the problem that audio albums of Konkani songs of Patriotism & National Integration are rarely produced in Goa despite numerous audio albums of songs (Kantaram) in Konkani being produced. The scheme provides financial support as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa for the production of audio albums containing at least 10 songs of Patriotism & National Integration and distribution of 300 copies to schools and groups participating in various competitions. The applicant must be a tiatr artiste (commercial or non-commercial). The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Support Tiatr Academy of Goa will give financial support as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa for the production of the Album. Distribution Channel Tiatr Academy of Goa will distribute 300 copies to schools & groups which participate in its various competitions and may also offer them to other schools, groups, individuals, etc. who are interested in promoting Patriotism & National Integration. Commercial Rights The applicant is free to sell the remaining Compact Discs. Sponsorship Permis
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Support Tiatr Academy of Goa will give financial support as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa for the production of the Album. Distribution Channel Tiatr Academy of Goa will distribute 300 copies to schools & groups which participate in its various competitions and may also offer them to other schools, groups, individuals, etc. who are interested in promoting Patriotism & National Integration. Commercial Rights The applicant is free to sell the remaining Compact Discs. Sponsorship Permission The applicant may take sponsorship to meet the cost of production of Album. Quality Assurance Lyrics will be scrutinized by the Recommendation Committee appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa with advisory support to improve quality. ﻿ Conditions *The applicant must produce the Audio album strictly following the specified norms. *Melody and musical arrangement must be appropriate to the content of the song. *Lyrics must be approved by the Recommendation Committee. *Official letter of acceptance must be obtained from Tiatr Academy of Goa before production. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a tiatr artiste (commercial as well as non-commercial). The applicant must submit a typed copy of lyrics of songs to Tiatr Academy of Goa along with the application form. The applicant must obtain approval of lyrics from the Recommendation Committee appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must receive official letter of acceptance from Tiatr Academy of Goa before production. The applicant must not make any adverse remark in any form either written or verbal against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the lyrics of songs which may hurt the sentiments of anybody. Album Content Requirements The audio album must include at least 10 songs of Patriotism & National Integration. The album should not have solo songs only. 50% of the songs must be group songs and children's songs. Melody and musical arrangement must be appropriate to the content of the song. The applicant will have to give 300 copies of Audio albums to Tiatr Academy of Goa. Quality Control Process Lyrics will be scrutinized by the Recommendation Committee. Committee will be free to advise the lyricists to improve the quality of lyrics. Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to disapprove the lyrics as per the opinion given by Recommendation Committee. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card.
Typed Copy of Lyrics of Songs.
Official Letter of Acceptance from Tiatr Academy of Goa (To Be Obtained Before Production).
300 Copies of Produced Audio Albums (To Be Submitted to Tiatr Academy of Goa).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The application must be submitted to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days in advance of the proposed programme date
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Lyrics Scrutiny & Committee Feedback The applicant must wait for the Recommendation Committee appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa to scrutinize the submitted lyrics, during which the committee may advise improvements to enhance the quality of lyrics and ensure alignment with patriotism and national integration themes

The applicant must incorporate any suggestions or improvements recommended by the Recommendation Committee to enhance the quality of lyrics, ensuring the content meets the required standards for patriotism and national integration themes

Step 2: Official Approval & Acceptance Letter The applicant must wait for the final decision from Tiatr Academy of Goa, as the academy reserves the right to disapprove the lyrics based on the opinion given by the Recommendation Committee, and will issue an official letter of acceptance if the lyrics are approved

The applicant must obtain the official letter of acceptance from Tiatr Academy of Goa confirming approval of the lyrics before proceeding with the production of the audio album, as this letter is mandatory for proceeding to the production phase

Step 3: Album Production & Financial Support The applicant must plan the production of the audio album strictly following the approved norms including minimum 10 songs, ensuring 50% are group and children's songs, and that melody and musical arrangement are appropriate to the content of each song

The applicant must coordinate with Tiatr Academy of Goa to receive the financial support as decided by the academy for the production of the album, and may also arrange additional sponsorship to meet the complete cost of production if needed

Step 4: Produce Audio Album & Submit Required Copies The applicant must produce the audio album following all specified norms and quality standards, ensuring professional recording quality and appropriate musical arrangements that complement the patriotic and national integration themes of the songs

The applicant must provide 300 copies of the completed audio albums to Tiatr Academy of Goa as per the scheme requirements, which will be used by the academy for distribution to schools and groups participating in various competitions

Step 5: Complete Documentation The applicant must ensure all production documentation is complete and maintain records of the album production process, quality standards met, and compliance with all scheme norms for future reference and verification

The scheme aims to provide state-level players with training and practice opportunities at the Mega Sports Complex, Hotwar, Ranchi. The scheme includes 11 sports disciplines: athletics,
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Pay & Play Scheme” was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. The scheme aims to provide state-level players with training and practice opportunities at the Mega Sports Complex, Hotwar, Ranchi. The scheme includes 11 sports disciplines: athletics, badminton, lawn tennis, table tennis, shooting, gymnastics, basketball, taekwondo, volleyball, wrestling, and swimming.

Athletics players enjoy 15 days of free access (non-repetitive). ﻿ ﻿

The applicant should actively participate in state-level sports. The students up to class 10 th with a recommendation from the school principal and National/international participants or medalists are eligible to apply.

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Acting in Tiatr for School Children
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Acting in Tiatr for School Children" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to encourage interested artistes to improve their acting abilities through organized competitions related to Goan tiatr dramatic activity, addressing the need to develop theatrical skills among sch
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Acting in Tiatr for School Children" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to encourage interested artistes to improve their acting abilities through organized competitions related to Goan tiatr dramatic activity, addressing the need to develop theatrical skills among school students at primary and secondary levels. The scheme provides acting competitions in comedy and non-comedy categories with both monologue and dialogue formats, along with cash prizes ranging from ₹2,000/- to ₹5,000/- and participation certificates for winners and best script writers. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prizes and Recognition Monologue (Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹3,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹2,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Dialogue (Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹5,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹3,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Monologue (Non-Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹3,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹2,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Dialogue (Non-Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹5,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹3,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Additional Benefits Pa
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prizes and Recognition Monologue (Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹3,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹2,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Dialogue (Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹5,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹3,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Monologue (Non-Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹3,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹2,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Dialogue (Non-Comedy Acting): 1st Performance - ₹5,000/-; 2nd Performance - ₹3,000/- Best Script Writer: ₹2,000/- Additional Benefits Participation certificates awarded to all winners. Transport charges remuneration paid to each participating school as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Development of acting abilities through structured competition and professional judging. Conditions *Minimum four entries required in each category for competition to be conducted in that particular category. *Performance duration must be between 4 to 7 minutes. *Scripts must not contain adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed and religion. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a school student at primary school level or secondary school level. The applicant must participate through their respective school. Participation Rules The applicant (one student of a school) can participate in each category. The applicant must submit separate applications if participating in more than one category. The applicant must ensure their performance is between 4 to 7 minutes duration. The applicant must submit a typed copy of the script along with the application form. Content Requirements The applicant must ensure their script/performance does not contain any adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed and religion. The applicant must ensure their performance does not hurt the sentiments of anybody. Competition Categories Available The applicant can participate in Monologue (Comedy Acting) category. The applicant can participate in Dialogue (Comedy Acting) category. The applicant can participate in Monologue (Non-Comedy Acting) category. The applicant can participate in Dialogue (Non-Comedy Acting) category. Judging Criteria Acting abilities are evaluated based on six specific criteria: Delivery of dialogues Facial expression Reaction to others on the stage Movement on the stage Costumes Overall impact Performance Guidelines Light effects and background music are not considered during judging. Performances are limited to acting ability assessment only. Professional judges with expertise in acting and direction conduct the evaluation. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Contact Details (Land Line and Cell Phone Numbers)
*Script must be submitted in typed format.
*Separate application forms must be submitted for each category of participation.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields
Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment ﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Await Competition Schedule Wait for Tiatr Academy of Goa to organize the competition once minimum four entries are received in each category, as competitions will only be conducted when this minimum requirement is met

Step 2: Performance Evaluation Participate in the competition where your acting abilities will be judged on six criteria: delivery of dialogues, facial expression, reaction to others on the stage, movement on the stage, costumes, and overall impact by a panel of judges well versed in acting and direction

Step 3: Receive Results and Benefits Accept the final and binding decision of the judges, and if selected as a winner, receive cash prizes and participation certificates as per the category and position achieved in the competition

schemes.brief_description: Details The "Poompuhar District Craft Award" scheme was launched in the year 2011-2012 by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The award was introduced to recognize and honor the artisans district-wise. The awards are conferred every year and consist of a
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Poompuhar District Craft Award" scheme was launched in the year 2011-2012 by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The award was introduced to recognize and honor the artisans district-wise. The awards are conferred every year and consist of a cash prize of ₹10,000/-, a silver medal, and a certificate. The award is granted annually.

benefits.summary: Cash Prize of ₹10,000/-. Silver Medal. Certificate.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize of ₹10,000/-. Silver Medal. Certificate.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artisan. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu. Handicraft competitions will be conducted in the following 16 types of handicrafts: Panchaloka Idols, Brass Lamps and Brass Artifacts, Thanjavur Paintings, Thanjavur Plates, Wood Sculptures, Stone Sculptures, Fire Clay, Kalamkari Pathik and Applique Work, Pulp Toys, Mat Weaving, Bamboo and Palm Leaf Products, Neti Work, Textiles, Temple Jewellery, Pictorial Embroidery Work and Other Handicrafts. The experience of the artisans and the service rendered by them in their profession and other special features will also be taken into consideration during the passing.

Artisan's Affidavit on ₹20/- Stamp Paper, attested by a First Class Criminal Judge or Notary Public.

Recommendation Certificate, attested by any of the Managers of Poombucar Outlets and Manufacturing Plants / the respective Area Assistant Directors (Handicrafts / Craft Council (Tamil Nadu/India/World) under the Office of the Development Commissioner, New Delhi.
Photographs of the Item to be offered for selection.

Step 1: The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents (during office hours-Monday-Friday) to the Poombukar Head Office
﻿ Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Quintets/Choral Songs
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Quintets/Choral Songs" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the traditional concept of singing of duets/duos/trios/quartets/quintets/choral songs, which has been on the decline, and to ensure that the correct
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Quintets/Choral Songs" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the traditional concept of singing of duets/duos/trios/quartets/quintets/choral songs, which has been on the decline, and to ensure that the correct concept as done traditionally by the tiatr stage artistes of yesteryears is followed. The scheme provides cash prizes ranging from ₹1,000/- to ₹6,000/- for various categories and certificates to winners and participants. The applicant must be aged either above 16 years to 25 years or up to 16 years on the day fixed for submission of application and must present original compositions with interactive lyrics. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Best Duet: 1st Prize - ₹3,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,500/-. Best Duo: 1st Prize - ₹3,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,500/-. Best Trio: 1st Prize - ₹4,500/-, 2nd Prize - ₹2,250/-. Best Quartet/Quintet: 1st Prize - ₹6,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹3,000/-. Best Choral Song: 1st Prize - ₹2,000/- to ₹4,000/- (maximum 4 participants), 2nd Prize - ₹1,000/- to ₹2,000/- (maximum 4 participants). Best Lyrics: 1st Prize - ₹2,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,000/-. *Travelling allowance provided to every participant. *Certificates awarded to
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Best Duet: 1st Prize - ₹3,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,500/-. Best Duo: 1st Prize - ₹3,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,500/-. Best Trio: 1st Prize - ₹4,500/-, 2nd Prize - ₹2,250/-. Best Quartet/Quintet: 1st Prize - ₹6,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹3,000/-. Best Choral Song: 1st Prize - ₹2,000/- to ₹4,000/- (maximum 4 participants), 2nd Prize - ₹1,000/- to ₹2,000/- (maximum 4 participants). Best Lyrics: 1st Prize - ₹2,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,000/-. *Travelling allowance provided to every participant. *Certificates awarded to winners and participants in both categories. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be aged either above 16 years to 25 years or up to 16 years on the day fixed for submission of application. The applicant must present original compositions that have not been recorded on any audio albums. The applicant must ensure that songs which have won 1st, 2nd and 3rd prizes in any competitions organized by Kala Academy/Art & Culture Department/Tiatr Academy of Goa are not considered for first three prizes in this competition. The applicant must not have participated in popular tiatr performances. The applicant must participate in any one of the three sections: Section 1 (Duet or Duo), Section 2 (Trio or Quartet), or Section 3 (Quintet or Choral). The applicant must ensure that duets are sung by a male and female singer with interactive lyrics depicting two different characters. The applicant must ensure that duos are sung by two male singers or two female singers with interactive lyrics depicting two different characters. The applicant must ensure that trios are sung by three singers with interactive lyrics depicting three different characters. The applicant must ensure that quartets/quintets are sung by four/five singers with interactive lyrics depicting four/five different characters. The applicant must ensure that choral songs are sung by two, three or four singers in different voices. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copies of Birth/Baptism Certificates or a Certificate by the Headmaster/Headmistress of a Recognized School Certifying the Birth Date (original should be produced for verification).
Typed Copy of Lyrics of the Song in Roman Script (handwritten lyrics will not be accepted).
No Objection Certificate from the Composer (if permission is required to sing the song in the competition).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The application must be submitted to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days in advance of the proposed programme date
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds

schemes.scheme_name: Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund For Sportspersons
schemes.brief_description: Details A scheme named " Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund For Sportspersons " (PDUNWFS) was launched by the Ministry Of Youth Affairs & Sports with the aim to provide suitable assistance to the meritorious and outstanding sportspersons of yesteryear who had brought glory to the countr
schemes.detailed_description: Details A scheme named " Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund For Sportspersons " (PDUNWFS) was launched by the Ministry Of Youth Affairs & Sports with the aim to provide suitable assistance to the meritorious and outstanding sportspersons of yesteryear who had brought glory to the country in international field who are now living in indigent circumstances. The key objectives of the scheme are as follows:- To provide suitable assistance to sportspersons injured during the period of their training for competitions and also during the competitions, depending on the nature of the injury. To provide suitable assistance to sportspersons for medical treatment. To provide suitable assistance to promote welfare of sportspersons generally in order to alleviate distress among them and their dependents in indigent circumstances. To provide assistance to sportspersons living in indigent circumstances for training, procurement for sports equipment, participation in national and international sports events etc. To any other purpose deemed fit by the General Committee.

benefits.summary: 1. Assistance to sportspersons living in indigent circumstances: A lumpsum ex-gratia financial assistance may be granted to an outstanding sportsperson now living in indigent circumstances, subject to a maximum of Rs. 5 lakh. In addition to this, a provision of monthly pension of Rs. 5000/- (Rupees five thousand) may be provided to those yesteryears meritorious sportspersons now living in indigent circumstances. 2. Assistance for injuries sustained during training for and participation in Sports
benefits.raw_benefits_text: 1. Assistance to sportspersons living in indigent circumstances: A lumpsum ex-gratia financial assistance may be granted to an outstanding sportsperson now living in indigent circumstances, subject to a maximum of Rs. 5 lakh. In addition to this, a provision of monthly pension of Rs. 5000/- (Rupees five thousand) may be provided to those yesteryears meritorious sportspersons now living in indigent circumstances. 2. Assistance for injuries sustained during training for and participation in Sports competitions: A lumpsum ex-gratia financial assistance subject to a maximum of Rs. 10 lakh may be granted to an outstanding sportsperson for injuries sustained during training for and participation in sports competitions. 3. Assistance to Families of deceased Outstanding Sportspersons: A lumpsum exgratia financial assistance, not exceeding Rs. 5.00 lakh in each case, may be provided to the families of deceased outstanding sportspersons living in indigent circumstances. 4. Assistance for Medical Treatment: Financial assistance not exceeding Rs. 10 lakh may be provided for medical treatment of an outstanding sportsperson or of any of his/her family members living in indigent circumstances. 5. Assistance to coaches, support personnel, umpires, referees and match officials: Lumpsum financial assistance, not exceeding Rs. 2 lakh may be provided to coaches and support personnel such as sports doctors, sports psychologists, sports mentor, physiotherapists, masseurs who have been attached with national coaching camps for senior category players and national teams (senior category), and umpires, referees and match officials, who have been associated with recognized national championships (senior category) and international tournaments(senior category) in the sports disciplines included in Olympic Games, Asian Games and Commonwealth Games who are living in indigent circumstances or to family members of such deceased support personnel living in indigent circumstances. 6. Discretionary powers to the Chairperson of the General Committee: The Chairperson of the General Committee may sanction the assistance, in deserving cases, even to those, who technically are non-eligible, taking into account full facts and circumstances for each case and for reasons to be recorded in writing. The Chairperson will have the discretion to decide the quantum of assistance. 7. Disclosure of information about assistance received from other resources: Sportspersons or family member of sportspersons applying for assistance from the Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund for Sportspersons (PDUNWFS) will furnish information about assistance received in kind or cash from any other source for the same purpose.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility 1. Assistance to sportspersons living in indigent circumstances/Assistance to Families of deceased Sportspersons/Assistance for Medical Treatment to sportspersons or family members: Sportsperson of yesteryears who has retired from active sports. He/She has won medals in individual events or team events in National Games and National Championships (Senior category) conducted by National Sports Federations (NSFs), recognized by Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports. Or, One who has participated in an International sports events such as Olympic Games, Para-Olympics, Deaflympics, Asian Games, Para Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, World Cup/Championship, Asian Championship, Commonwealth Championship in senior category in the sports disciplines included in Olympic. 2. Assistance for injuries sustained during training for and participation in Sports competitions: Sportsperson for injuries sustained during training for and participation in sports competitions listed above but will also include Sub Junior and Junior category competitions. 3. Assistance for training, procurement of equipment and participation in national and international sports events: Sportspersons, whose parents are living indigent circumstances. Whether support from any other Scheme of the Ministry is being availed by the applicant or the applicant can be assisted under other Schemes of the Ministry are also eligible. Sportspersons belonging to those sports disciplines whose Federations are either de-recognized or whose recognition has been suspended by the Government or the Federations who has so far not got the recognition of the Government, will also be eligible for assistance for this purpose. 4. Assistance to coaches and support personnel/Assistance for medical treatment to coaches and support personnel: Coaches and support personnel such as sports doctors, sports psychologists, sports mentor, physiotherapists, masseurs who have been attached with national coaching camps for senior category players and national teams (senior category), and umpires, referees and match officials, who have been associated with recognized national championships (senior category) and international tournaments(senior category) in the sports disciplines included in Olympic Games, Asian Games and Commonwealth Games who are living in indigent circumstances or to family members of such deceased support personnel living in indigent circumstances.

required_documents.document_name: Following are the mandatory documents required to apply for the scheme:-
Applicant’s Passport Size Photo and Signature*
Proof of Achievements / Participation in National or International Level sports events.*
Annual Income of the applicant (from all sources)*
Declaration (signed by the applicant and two witness*
Mobile number and Email ID (for online application)*
All documents must be in PDF.
For any technical assistance please call 18002025155/18002585155 (Monday to Friday, except holidays) or Email at section.sp4.moyas@gov.in.

application_process: Offline Online Step 1: An application for financial assistance from the Fund shall be addressed to the Member-Secretary of the Executive Committee in the prescribed Performa given in the scheme guidelines

The filled signed-in application is required to be sent to the following address: Member - Secretary, Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund for Sportspersons (PDUNWFS), Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Shastri Bhawan, New Delhi - 110001

schemes.scheme_name: Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Schedule Caste
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Schedule Caste Youth" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to foster the overall development—physical, mental, and spiritual—of youth 14–35 years)belonging to the Scheduled Caste
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Schedule Caste Youth" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to foster the overall development—physical, mental, and spiritual—of youth 14–35 years)belonging to the Scheduled Castes through structured yogasana and personality development programs. Each camp runs for 7 days and selects 50 beneficiaries per district from across Gujarat. The initiative serves to empower socially disadvantaged youth and enhance their self-esteem, discipline, and holistic well-being. The scheme is implemented by the District Youth Development Officers across all districts of Gujarat. ﻿

benefits.summary: Training: The selected Scheduled Caste youth will receive 7 days of training focused on personality development and yogasana. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Training: The selected Scheduled Caste youth will receive 7 days of training focused on personality development and yogasana. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should be between the age of 14 to 35 years. ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The applicant should download the application form or applicants may visit the Sports Directorate and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: All required fields in the form should be completed carefully, and copies of the necessary documents must be enclosed (self-attestation may be required)
Step 3: Submit the properly filled and signed application form, along with all attached documents, to the District Youth Development Office
Step 4: Ensure to obtain a submission receipt or acknowledgment slip from the official receiving the application for future reference

This c
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "TASP Personality Development and Yogasana Training Camp (TASP)" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to empower Scheduled Tribe (ST) youth across 17 districts of the state by providing a structured seven-day training program. This camp focuses on personality development and yogasana training, helping the participants to develop their physical, mental, and spiritual health. The scheme seeks to uplift tribal youth through skill-building and self-improvement techniques in a culturally inclusive and health-oriented environment. ﻿

benefits.summary: Training and Development: The scheme offers a seven-day residential training camp focused on personality development and yogasana. The training covers aspects of physical fitness, mental well-being, and spiritual awareness. Note: A total of 50 tribal youths (both male and female) are selected from each of the 17 targeted districts. ﻿

The training covers aspects of physical fitness, mental well-being, and spiritual awareness. Note: A total of 50 tribal youths (both male and female) are selected from each of the 17 targeted districts. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. ﻿ ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Pension to Indigent Sportspersons of Odisha
schemes.brief_description: Details The Scheme relating to "Pension to Indigent Sportspersons of Odisha" was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to provide financial support to sportspersons of yesteryears who are living in indigent conditions.
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Scheme relating to "Pension to Indigent Sportspersons of Odisha" was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to provide financial support to sportspersons of yesteryears who are living in indigent conditions.

benefits.summary: 1. The eligible sportsperson will get ₹3,000/- per month as a pension. Pension to Surviving Spouse of a Deceased Pensioner: Pension in favour of the surviving spouse of a deceased pensioner shall be sanctioned on a priority on receipt of application duly supported by death certificate, legal heir certificate, etc. The process of applying will be the same. Mode of payment: The pension will be drawn from the Treasury & credited to the beneficiary's bank account every month (or upon such interval a
benefits.raw_benefits_text: 1. The eligible sportsperson will get ₹3,000/- per month as a pension. Pension to Surviving Spouse of a Deceased Pensioner: Pension in favour of the surviving spouse of a deceased pensioner shall be sanctioned on a priority on receipt of application duly supported by death certificate, legal heir certificate, etc. The process of applying will be the same. Mode of payment: The pension will be drawn from the Treasury & credited to the beneficiary's bank account every month (or upon such interval as decided by the Sports & Youth Services Department from time to time) through e-Transfer.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Applicant should be a permanent resident of the State of Odisha. Applicant should be at least 50 years of age if a male and at least 40 years of age if a female, provided that the age limit, in either case, may be relaxed by a maximum period of 10 years if the sportsperson has been suddenly incapacitated by an injury or a physical handicap or a serious ailment resulting in premature withdrawal from active sports (Medical Board Certificate is mandatory for this case). Applicant should have represented the State of Odisha in the sporting disciplines recognized by Sports & Youth Services Department as in Annexure-I . Applicant should not be having income from all sources exceeding ₹50,000/- (Rupees fifty thousand) only per annum (Income Certificate from the Revenue authority shall be treated as an authentic source). Applicant should be free from conviction in any criminal offence. Note: The age will be counted as on the date of application. Cessation of Pension: Pension shall be ceased on the death of the pensioner. (However, if the spouse of the deceased pensioner is alive, he/she may apply for the same). A pensioner may also voluntarily give up availing of the pension at any time. Pension can also be ceased by this Department if, on inquiry, it is found that the pensioner is leading a comfortable life, i.e. he/she is not in any indigent condition. In such a case, the Department also reserves the right to take appropriate legal/administrative action for recovery of the total amount already availed by the beneficiary in the name of pension along with 18% annual interest. Pension can also be ceased by this Department if, on inquiry, it is established that the pensioner is getting a pension by resorting to unfair or fraudulent means.

required_documents.document_name: In the month of January each year, the pensioners shall personally appear before the District Sports Officer of the concerned district and furnish a Life Certificate in the form as in
The DSO will forward/upload the same to the Sports & Youth Services Department by 10th February of each year for renewal of pension, failing which pension shall not be renewed.

application_process: Online Step 01: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, applicants need to apply through the online portal
( https://portal
sportsodisha
in/Citizen/Landing ) Step 02: In case, the applicant is not registered yet, then click the Register link in the login screen
Applicants can register by filling in their details
Step 03: After the account is created, click the 'Sign In' option to get redirected to the Login screen
Step 04: After login, the applicant can view the services as displayed on the screen
Applicants need to choose the Sports Services option and click the ‘OK’ button
Step 05 : Doing so, the dashboard is displayed, wherein the Profile Details of the registered applicant need to be filled in step-by-step along with checking the ‘Application Status’
On saving the personal details, the profile status for the same is updated
Step 06: To apply for the pension scheme for the indigent sportsperson, click the ‘Apply Pension’ option in the dashboard
Step 07: Enter all the required details in the application form
On verifying the data under the respective fields, click the 'Save' button
Accordingly, the status of the application gets updated in the dashboard
﻿ Sports User Manual ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Khiladi Protsahan Chhatravriti Yojana
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme 'Khiladi Protsahan Chhatravriti Yojana' was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports among talented youth aged 14 to 23 years from Uttarakhand by providing scholarships and financial assistance for sports equipment. ﻿
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme 'Khiladi Protsahan Chhatravriti Yojana' was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports among talented youth aged 14 to 23 years from Uttarakhand by providing scholarships and financial assistance for sports equipment. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, players/sportspersons aged 14 to 23 years are selected annually based on the P-SAT (Physical and Sports Aptitude Test). A total of 100 boys and 100 girls are selected per district, and they are provided a scholarship of ₹2,000/- per month along with ₹10,000/- once a year for sports equipment. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under this scheme, players/sportspersons aged 14 to 23 years are selected annually based on the P-SAT (Physical and Sports Aptitude Test). A total of 100 boys and 100 girls are selected per district, and they are provided a scholarship of ₹2,000/- per month along with ₹10,000/- once a year for sports equipment. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant must be a boy or girl between 14 and 23 years of age. The boy or girl who obtain the highest marks based on merit in the final district-level competition, conducted through various stages of the Physical and Sports Aptitude Test (P-SAT) assessing physical abilities such as strength, flexibility, endurance, speed, and coordination, will be eligible for the sports scholarship. Scholarships are awarded on a priority basis in the following sports: (1) Athletics, (2) Badminton, (3) Boxing, (4) Taekwondo, (5) Kabaddi, (6) Football, (7) Volleyball, (8) Basketball, (9) Hockey, (10) Table Tennis, (11) Karate, and (12) Judo. ﻿

application_process: Offline There is no selection at the school or Nyaya Panchayat level
Players independently participate in competitions held directly at the municipality, municipal corporation, or district level, and selections are made based on merit

Six competitions will be organized to test physical efficiency: (1) 30-meter flying run (2) Standing broad jump (3) Forward bend and reach (4) 6 × 10 shuttle run (5) Medicine ball throw (6) 600-meter run The district-level selection committee will issue a final list in each age group who secure the highest marks based on merit
These players will be eligible for the sports scholarship, which will be directly transferred to their accounts through DBT

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreography & Dancing
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreography & Dancing" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to promote Konkani songs by presenting them with choreography and dancing, attracting youth towards Konkani 'kantar' and improving the presentation
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreography & Dancing" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to promote Konkani songs by presenting them with choreography and dancing, attracting youth towards Konkani 'kantar' and improving the presentation quality of Konkani cultural performances. The scheme provides cash prizes ranging from ₹2,000/- to ₹7,000/- for winners along with mementos and certificates, and traveling allowances between ₹1,000/- to ₹2,000/- based on distance traveled by participating groups. The applicant must form a group of 6 to 10 participants and submit a recording of one selected Konkani song at the time of application. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prizes for Performance First Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. Second Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. Third Prize: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. Special Prize for Best Choreographer: ₹2,000/- plus memento and certificate. Traveling Allowance Groups traveling up to 10 kilometers radius: ₹1,000/-. Groups traveling within 10-20 kilometers radius: ₹1,500/-. Groups traveling 20 kilometers or more: ₹2,000/-. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prizes for Performance First Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. Second Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. Third Prize: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. Special Prize for Best Choreographer: ₹2,000/- plus memento and certificate. Traveling Allowance Groups traveling up to 10 kilometers radius: ₹1,000/-. Groups traveling within 10-20 kilometers radius: ₹1,500/-. Groups traveling 20 kilometers or more: ₹2,000/-. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must form a group consisting of 6 to 10 participants. The applicant must submit a recording of one selected Konkani song at the time of application. The applicant must not perform fusion of songs as it will result in automatic disqualification. The applicant must abide by all rules and regulations of the competition organized by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must accept that the decision of the judges will be final and binding. ﻿ ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Copy of The Recorded Konkani Song on Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc.
Contact Details Including Phone Number and Email Address.
Names of All Participants (6 to 10 members).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The application must be submitted to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days in advance of the proposed programme date
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds
Post-Application Process Step 1: Competition Details Wait for Tiatr Academy of Goa will communicate the venue, date, and other competition details to participating groups
Step 2: Participate in Competition Attend the competition at the designated venue and perform the registered Konkani song with choreography and dancing

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Literature on Art & Culture of Local Authors/ Organization
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa to encourage Goan writers to publish their literature on Art and Culture. The entire expenditure on printing and publishing the book is borne by Govt. by ke
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa to encourage Goan writers to publish their literature on Art and Culture. The entire expenditure on printing and publishing the book is borne by Govt. by keeping the copyright of the publication. Every year two or more books are published depending upon the availability of funds. About 1000 copies are printed and supplied to Educational institutions, libraries, Cultural Institutions etc. ﻿ Objectives To encourage Goan writers to publish their literature on Art & culture. To bear the entire expenditure on printing and publishing of the book by keeping the copyright of the publication.

benefits.summary: Nature and Quantum of Assistance The entire expenditure on printing and publishing the book is borne by the Government by keeping the copyright of the publication. Every year two year or more books are published depending upon the availability of funds. About 1,000 copies are printed and supplied to Educational institutions, libraries, Cultural Institutions etc. The authors are paid an honorarium.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Nature and Quantum of Assistance The entire expenditure on printing and publishing the book is borne by the Government by keeping the copyright of the publication. Every year two year or more books are published depending upon the availability of funds. About 1,000 copies are printed and supplied to Educational institutions, libraries, Cultural Institutions etc. The authors are paid an honorarium.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an author from Goa. Only the literature concerned with the cultural traditions of the state of Goa shall be published. ﻿ NOTE: Authors who have already availed the benefit shall not be considered for a second time.

required_documents.document_name: A copy of the Residence Certificate of 15 years or more in Goa.

schemes.scheme_name: Pandit Omkarnath Classical Music Festival and Awards
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Pandit Omkarnath Classical Music Festival and Awards" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to preserve, promote, and celebrate the Indian classical music heritage by recognizing and awarding distinguished male artists who have signi
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Pandit Omkarnath Classical Music Festival and Awards" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to preserve, promote, and celebrate the Indian classical music heritage by recognizing and awarding distinguished male artists who have significantly contributed to this field. The award is conferred annually during the Pt. Omkarnath Shastri Sangeet Mohotsav, where artists are selected by an expert committee based on their lifelong service, adherence to the guru-shishya tradition, and national or international recognition in classical music. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance and Recognition: Eligible male artists receive a prestigious award that acknowledges their lifelong dedication to Indian classical music. ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance and Recognition: Eligible male artists receive a prestigious award that acknowledges their lifelong dedication to Indian classical music. ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a male. The applicant should be an artist. The applicant should have significantly contributed to the field of Indian classical music. The applicant should have rendered at least 40 years of service in classical music at the state or national level. The applicant should have received formal training under the traditional guru-shishya parampara (teacher-disciple tradition). The applicant should have worked for the promotion, protection, and nurturing of classical music. The applicant should have received recognized awards at the national or international level. The applicant should have conducted noteworthy research in the development and conservation of classical music. ﻿

application_process: Online Step 1: The interested applicant should request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form Sangeet Natak Academy
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Sangeet Natak Academy
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted

schemes.scheme_name: Pandit Omkarnath Music Competition
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Pandit Omkarnath Music Competition" was launched by the Department of Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to honour the memory of Pandit Omkarnath and promote classical music among young artists by organizing competitive platforms for sin
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Pandit Omkarnath Music Competition" was launched by the Department of Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to honour the memory of Pandit Omkarnath and promote classical music among young artists by organizing competitive platforms for singing, vocal, and percussion performances, addressing the need to nurture and recognize classical music talent in the state. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities, Gujarat. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Classical music artists are provided with the opportunity to participate in organized competitions for singing, vocal, and percussion performances. Competitions are organized separately for two age categories: 12 to 19 years and 20 to 35 years, ensuring age-appropriate competition levels. The scheme provides a platform for recognition and promotion of classical music talent in the state of Gujarat. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Classical music artists are provided with the opportunity to participate in organized competitions for singing, vocal, and percussion performances. Competitions are organized separately for two age categories: 12 to 19 years and 20 to 35 years, ensuring age-appropriate competition levels. The scheme provides a platform for recognition and promotion of classical music talent in the state of Gujarat. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant must be between 12 to 19 years of age or between 20 to 35 years of age. The applicant must be a classical music artist. The applicant must specialize in singing, vocal performance, or percussion instruments. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Age Proof Document (Birth Certificate, School Leaving Certificate, Aadhaar Card, or Any Government-Issued Identity Document).
Identity Proof (Aadhaar Card or Any Government-Issued Photo Identity Document).
Proof of Residence in Gujarat (Domicile Certificate, Ration Card, or Utility Bills).
Proof of Classical Music Training or Performance Experience (Certificates from Music Institutions, Performance Records, or Teacher Recommendations).

application_process: Offline Step 1: Visit the official website of 'Mari Yojana' at https://mariyojana
In the search bar provided at the top of the page, type 'Competition'
All the schemes of the Government of Gujarat having the word 'Competition' will be listed
Step 2: From the list, click on the scheme 'Solo Drama Competition'
You will be taken to the schemes page
Navigate and download the application form of the scheme
The application form is available in both Gujarati and English languages, and the applicant should take print of the form in their preferred language

Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the designated authority at the Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy
Step 5: After successful submission, the applicant will receive an acknowledgement or reference number
The applicant should save this reference number for future correspondence and tracking of the application status

schemes.scheme_name: Preservation of Tiatr Literature
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Preservation of Tiatr Literature" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the literature related to Tiatr/Khell Tiatr/Khell, their scripts, lyrics of songs (kantaram), music, scripts of one-ac
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Preservation of Tiatr Literature" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the literature related to Tiatr/Khell Tiatr/Khell, their scripts, lyrics of songs (kantaram), music, scripts of one-act plays, and encourage script writers and lyricists to publish their works in book form. The scheme addresses the issue that, although thousands of tiatrs have been produced and staged and songs (kantaram) composed and sung over the decades, not many books of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays scripts and lyrics of songs (Kantaram) have been published. The scheme provides printing of scripts of tiatrs/khell tiatrs/khells, one-act plays, lyrics of kantaram with or without music in book form in Konkani in Roman Script, and payment of honorarium along with free copies to eligible writers. ﻿

benefits.summary: Printing Services Tiatr Academy of Goa will print scripts of tiatrs/khell tiatrs/khells, one-act plays, lyrics of kantaram with or without music in book form in Konkani in Roman Script. Minimum of 500 copies of each book will be printed. ﻿ Category-wise Benefits Category I (Deceased or Inactive Tiatr Artistes) One-time honorarium as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for each tiatr script/anthology of songs. 25 copies of books will be given to the writer or legal heir. Books will be published by Tiat
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Printing Services Tiatr Academy of Goa will print scripts of tiatrs/khell tiatrs/khells, one-act plays, lyrics of kantaram with or without music in book form in Konkani in Roman Script. Minimum of 500 copies of each book will be printed. ﻿ Category-wise Benefits Category I (Deceased or Inactive Tiatr Artistes) One-time honorarium as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for each tiatr script/anthology of songs. 25 copies of books will be given to the writer or legal heir. Books will be published by Tiatr Academy of Goa from its funds allotted to the scheme. Category II (Active Tiatr Artistes) 200 books will be given to the artiste. One-time honorarium as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for each tiatr script/anthology of songs. Books will be published by Tiatr Academy of Goa from its funds allotted to the scheme. Category III (Individual Artiste/Publisher Self-Publishing) 100% of the cost of printing will be paid by Tiatr Academy of Goa on proper verification of rates. Must give 100 books to Tiatr Academy of Goa free of cost. Not entitled for any honorarium from Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿ Conditions *The manuscript must adhere to traditional formats as approved by Tiatr Academy of Goa. *There should not be any adverse remark made in any form either written or verbal against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the scripts/lyrics of songs which may hurt the sentiments of anybody. *If proved to contain adverse remarks, Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right not to print the book and refrain from making payment or recall the payment made to the concerned. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility General Eligibility The applicant must be a tiatr artiste or the legal heir of a deceased tiatr artiste. Category-wise Eligibility Category I: The applicant must be a tiatr artiste who has expired or is living but not active on the tiatr stage. The applicant must submit scripts of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays. The applicant must have a minimum collection of 50 songs with or without musical scores if submitting only songs (kantaram). Category II: The applicant must be a tiatr artist who is active on the tiatr stage. The applicant must submit scripts of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays. The applicant must have a minimum collection of 100 songs with or without musical scores if submitting only songs (kantaram). Category III: The applicant must be an individual artist/publisher who wishes to publish Scripts of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays on his/her own. The applicant must ensure the book conforms to all norms of the scheme. Preference Scripts/lyrics/music written by tiatr artistes of yesteryears will be given first preference. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self Attested Copy of Aadhaar Card.
Self Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card.
Prescribed Application Form Available In The Office of Tiatr Academy of Goa.
Written No Objection Certificate From The Author (If The Applicant Is The Publisher).
Soft Copy of the Manuscript on a Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Pen Drive.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields: name of the applicant
Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Recommendation Board Review The submitted manuscript will be reviewed by the Recommendation Board consisting of 2 members appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa who will recommend whether the books can be published or not
Step 2: Approval and Soft Copy Submission If approved by the Recommendation Board, submit a soft copy of the manuscript on a Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/pen drive to Tiatr Academy of Goa
Step 3: Editorial Review The approved manuscript will be edited by a member of Editorial Board for spelling and orthography checking
Step 4: Publication Process Upon successful completion of all review processes, Tiatr Academy of Goa will proceed with printing minimum 500 copies of the book in Konkani in Roman Script
Step 5: Benefit Distribution Receive the designated benefits as per the applicable category including honorarium payment and free book copies as specified in the scheme guidelines
﻿ Application Processing *Applications will be processed on 'First Come First Serve' basis
*Applications will be considered as per the availability of funds
*Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules
