schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Tiatr Music
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Music" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage youth and others to learn to play blowing instruments, particularly Trumpet and Saxophone, by providing them with financial a
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Music" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage youth and others to learn to play blowing instruments, particularly Trumpet and Saxophone, by providing them with financial assistance. The scheme provides financial support for tuition fees, a 50% subsidy on the cost of medium-priced blowing instruments such as Saxophone, Trumpet, or Clarinet, and opportunities for advanced certification from institutions like Trinity College or Royal School of Music. It also offers music classes at the Tiatr Academy of Goa's Conference Hall and awards certificates upon successful course completion. The applicant must identify a suitable tutor, purchase a blowing instrument, submit an undertaking to serve the tiatr stage, and undergo periodical tests. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted by submitting the prescribed application form available at the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿

benefits.summary: Reimbursement of tuition fees paid to the tutor, with the exact amount to be decided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. A 50% subsidy (refund) on the cost of a blowing instrument (Saxophone, Trumpet, or Clarinet), based on the value of a medium-priced instrument. Appropriate financial support for students to register and get themselves certified by institutions such as Trinity College or Royal School of Music. To cover tuition costs incurred for learning blowing instruments vital for Tiatr music. To r
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Reimbursement of tuition fees paid to the tutor, with the exact amount to be decided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. A 50% subsidy (refund) on the cost of a blowing instrument (Saxophone, Trumpet, or Clarinet), based on the value of a medium-priced instrument. Appropriate financial support for students to register and get themselves certified by institutions such as Trinity College or Royal School of Music. To cover tuition costs incurred for learning blowing instruments vital for Tiatr music. To reduce the financial burden of purchasing an essential blowing instrument, making learning more accessible. To support the pursuit of advanced musical qualifications and professional certification. Conditions: *The student must complete the full course. *The refund is subject to the availability of funds. *The chosen tutor should maintain a record of attendance for the students and submit it to the Tiatr Academy of Goa. *Students must undergo periodical tests to verify their performance, and those unable to cope with the syllabus or found not serious may be terminated after evaluation. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be any interested person, young or adult, free to avail the benefit of this scheme. The applicant must identify a tutor having the credentials to teach him/her the blowing instrument, which will be verified and accepted by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must serve the tiatr stage by playing in any tiatr band or musical group for at least one year after completion of the course. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: ◦ Self Attested Copy Of Aadhaar Card
◦ Self Attested Copy Of PAN Card
◦ Self Attested Xerox Copy Of The Bill Of The Instrument Purchased (To Be Submitted Immediately After Purchase Of The Instrument)
At Benefit Disbursal Stage (for instrument subsidy)
◦ Original Bill Of The Instrument Purchased (To Be Preserved By The Student And Submitted Upon Completion Of The Course)
◦ Undertaking (To Serve The Tiatr Stage By Playing In Any Tiatr Band Or Musical Group For At Least One Year After Completion Of The Course)
Tutor Related (submitted by tutor, not applicant)
◦ Record Of Attendance Of The Students (To Be Maintained And Submitted To The Tiatr Academy Of Goa)

application_process: Offline Pre-Application Process The interested person must identify a tutor who possesses the necessary credentials to teach the chosen blowing instrument
The Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) will then verify and accept the tutor's credentials
It is advisable to consult with the music teacher regarding the brand or make of the instrument to be purchased
﻿ Application Process Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds

﻿ Post-Application Process Step 1: Purchase the Instrument and Submit the Bill Copy Upon acceptance into the scheme, the student is required to purchase a blowing instrument, such as a Saxophone, Trumpet, or Clarinet
While the student has the flexibility to purchase an instrument of higher cost, the Tiatr Academy of Goa will consider only the value of a medium-priced instrument for subsidy calculations
Immediately after purchasing the instrument, a self-attested Xerox copy of the bill must be submitted to the Tiatr Academy of Goa, and the original bill must be carefully preserved by the student

﻿ Step 2: Undergo Course Training and Periodical Assessments The student will commence and undergo the music course, which will follow a syllabus framed by a panel of expert musicians appointed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa
The course duration is structured into two levels and is spread over a period of two years, or as otherwise determined by the expert panel
Students are required to undergo periodical tests to verify their progress and performance
The tutor is responsible for maintaining and submitting attendance records to the Tiatr Academy of Goa
Students who cannot cope with the syllabus or are deemed not serious in their learning may be terminated from the scheme after an evaluation report from the expert panel
The Tiatr Academy of Goa also encourages students to register and get certified by institutions such as Trinity College or Royal School of Music through appropriate financial support

﻿ Step 3: Submit Undertaking and Original Bill for Reimbursement Upon the successful completion of the full course, the student must submit the original bill of the purchased instrument to the Tiatr Academy of Goa in order to claim the 50% subsidy on its cost

Concurrently, the student must provide a formal undertaking to the Tiatr Academy of Goa, committing to serve the tiatr stage by actively playing in any tiatr band or musical group for a minimum period of one year following the completion of the course

﻿ Step 4: Receive Financial Subsidy and Course Completion Certificate After successful verification of all submitted documents and subject to the availability of funds, the Tiatr Academy of Goa will process and refund 50% of the cost of the instrument (calculated based on a medium-priced instrument) to the eligible student
Additionally, upon the successful completion of the course, students will be awarded official certificates by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, acknowledging their achievement and new skills

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Interschool Choreographic Dance Competition
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Interschool Choreographic Dance Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to inculcate values of patriotism, national integration
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Interschool Choreographic Dance Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to inculcate values of patriotism, national integration, and communal harmony in children through an inter-school competition of choreographic dancing on Konkani songs focused on these themes. The scheme provides monetary prizes ranging from ₹3,000/- to ₹10,000/- along with mementos and certificates for winners, and traveling allowances ranging from ₹2,000/- to ₹4,000/- based on distance traveled by participating groups. The applicant must be an educational institution with a dance group consisting of not less than 6 or more than 10 dancers and must perform on only one patriotic song in Konkani. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline with the submission of a physical application form along with a recorded copy of the song on Compact Disc. ﻿

benefits.summary: Monetary Benefits Prize Money for Standard 1st-4th Category 1st Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. 2nd Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. 3rd Prize: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. Best Choreographer: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. Prize Money for Standard 5th-10th Category 1st Prize: ₹10,000/- plus memento and certificate. 2nd Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. Best Choreographer: ₹3,000/- plus mem
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Monetary Benefits Prize Money for Standard 1st-4th Category 1st Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. 2nd Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. 3rd Prize: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. Best Choreographer: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. Prize Money for Standard 5th-10th Category 1st Prize: ₹10,000/- plus memento and certificate. 2nd Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. Best Choreographer: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. Traveling Allowance Groups from within 10 kilometers radius: ₹2,000/-. Groups from more than 10 kilometers and less than 20 kilometers: ₹3,000/-. Groups from 20 kilometers or more distance: ₹4,000/-. Non-Monetary Benefits Mementos and certificates for all prize winners. Refreshments provided for participants and their in-charge. Recognition and exposure through inter-school competition platform. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an educational institution. The applicant must form a dance group consisting of not less than 6 dancers. The applicant must form a dance group consisting of not more than 10 dancers. The applicant must choose to participate in either Standard 1st-4th category or Standard 5th-10th category. The applicant must perform on only one patriotic song in Konkani language. The applicant must not use fusion of different songs in their performance. The applicant must provide a recorded copy of the song on Compact Disc along with the application form. Compliance Requirements The applicant must read and understand all rules and regulations of the organization. The applicant must abide by all competition rules and regulations. The applicant must accept that the decision of the panel of judges will be final and binding. The applicant must accept that Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules. ﻿

Details of the Singer/Singers of the Recorded Song
Details of the Music Composer of the Recorded Song

*The application must be submitted to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days in advance of the proposed programme date
*The competition permits only 25 participants on first come first serve basis

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Production of Musical Programme or Tiatr
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Production of Musical Programme or Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to project patriotism, nationalism, and communal harmony t
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Production of Musical Programme or Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to project patriotism, nationalism, and communal harmony through tiatrs, songs and music, addressing the need to promote these values through cultural performances and artistic expression. The scheme provides remuneration as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa to successful applicants and covers actual charges of hall/auditorium or pays a lump sum amount for performances held in makeshift pandals, along with video recording of the activity with one Digital Video Disc copy provided to the applicant. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Remuneration as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be provided to the applicant. Reimbursement of actual charges of the hall/auditorium or payment of lump sum amount as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa if performance is held in makeshift pandal. Video recording of the activity/programme will be done by Tiatr Academy of Goa. One copy of the Digital Video Disc will be provided to the applicant. Maximum of 4 shows of the programme will be staged by Tiatr Academy of Goa at various places. One banner wi
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Remuneration as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be provided to the applicant. Reimbursement of actual charges of the hall/auditorium or payment of lump sum amount as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa if performance is held in makeshift pandal. Video recording of the activity/programme will be done by Tiatr Academy of Goa. One copy of the Digital Video Disc will be provided to the applicant. Maximum of 4 shows of the programme will be staged by Tiatr Academy of Goa at various places. One banner will be provided by Tiatr Academy of Goa for compulsory display. ﻿ Conditions All shows must be shown to public free of charge. Duration of the musical programme or tiatr should be not less than two hours. In all advertisements, oral, print or electronic media, banners, the following must be inserted/published/announced: 'This programme is promoted by Tiatr Academy of Goa'. A few seats should be reserved by the organizer(s) for the representatives of Tiatr Academy of Goa. The Tiatr Academy of Goa banner should be compulsorily displayed at one of the two front side wings of the stage and returned after all shows. The organizing institution/individual will have to discuss with Tiatr Academy of Goa and decide about the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour well in advance. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an individual/organization/educational institution/club. The applicant must propose an activity that is a tiatr/musical programme on the theme of patriotism/national integration/communal harmony. The applicant must ensure the duration of the musical programme or tiatr is not less than two hours. The applicant must submit the application along with typed script/lyrics at least 30 days before the date of staging the programme. The applicant must attach No Objection Certificate from the lyricist/writer/director concerned if they are not the lyricist/writer/director of the proposed activity. The applicant must ensure scripts/lyrics do not contain any adverse remarks against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self Attested Copy of Aadhaar Card
Self Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card
Three Typed Copies of Lyrics of Songs and Script of Tiatr/Script of Skits
List of Participants (as per prescribed format in Annexure)
No Objection Certificate from Lyricist/Writer/Director (if applicant is not the lyricist/writer/director of the proposed activity)

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The scheme will be implemented on 'First Come First Serve' basis
*Applications will be considered as per the availability of funds

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Programme Coordination Upon approval, the organizing institution/individual will coordinate with Tiatr Academy of Goa to discuss and decide about the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour well in advance, with the President or Vice President of Tiatr Academy of Goa or nominee serving in this capacity

Step 2: Banner Collection and Display The applicant must collect the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner from their office and ensure compulsory display at one of the two front side wings of the stage during performances

Step 3: Performance Implementation The applicant must stage the approved programme ensuring all conditions are met including free public access, reservation of seats for Tiatr Academy of Goa representatives, and proper acknowledgment in all promotional materials

Step 4: Post-Performance Requirements After completion of all shows, the applicant must return the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner to their office, and the payment cheque will be issued in the name of the applicant as appearing at Serial Number 1 of the application form

schemes.scheme_name: Poompuhar State Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Poompuhar State Award" scheme was launched by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Government of Tamil Nadu. The best artisans who have contributed to the development of the crafts of Tamil Nadu are selected and given a cash prize of ₹50,000/, a 4-gram gold medal,
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Poompuhar State Award" scheme was launched by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Government of Tamil Nadu. The best artisans who have contributed to the development of the crafts of Tamil Nadu are selected and given a cash prize of ₹50,000/, a 4-gram gold medal, tamirapathiram and a certificate. The economically backward awardees are also eligible for a monthly pension of ₹3,500/- after completion of 60 years of age.

benefits.summary: Cash Prize of ₹50,000/-. 4-gram Gold Medal. Thamirapathiram. Certificate. Monthly Pension of ₹3,500/- to the economically backward awardee.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize of ₹50,000/-. 4-gram Gold Medal. Thamirapathiram. Certificate. Monthly Pension of ₹3,500/- to the economically backward awardee.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an artisan. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu. The applicant should be above 30 years of age. For monthly pension, the applicant should be 60 years or above in age. The experience of the artisans and the service rendered by them in their profession will be taken into consideration during the passing (The artisans participating in the Award will be invited for process explanation and interview if required by the headquarters to test their skills).

required_documents.document_name: Artisan's Affidavit on ₹20/- Stamp Paper, attested by a First Class Criminal Judge or Notary Public.

Recommendation Certificate, attested by any of the Managers of Poombucar Outlets and Manufacturing Plants / the respective Area Assistant Directors (Handicrafts / Craft Council (Tamil Nadu/India/World) under the Office of the Development Commissioner, New Delhi.
Photograph of the applicant at each stage of production of the product for the award/Video.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents (during office hours, Monday-Friday) to the Poombukar Head Office Tamil Nadu Handicrafts Development Corporation, 759, Anna Road, Chennai - 600 002
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)
NOTE 1: Advertisements are released during June month every year
NOTE 2: No need to send award material with the application

schemes.scheme_name: Pension Scheme for Elderly, Destitute Artists, Litterateurs and Writers of Uttarakhand State
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme “Pension Scheme for Elderly, Destitute Artists, Litterateurs, and Writers of Uttarakhand” was introduced by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to elderly and impoverished artists, litterateurs and wr
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme “Pension Scheme for Elderly, Destitute Artists, Litterateurs, and Writers of Uttarakhand” was introduced by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to elderly and impoverished artists, litterateurs and writers who have dedicated their lives to the development of art, culture, and literature and have made significant and distinguished contributions. ﻿

benefits.summary: The department provides a monthly pension of ₹3,000/- to the beneficiaries under this scheme. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The department provides a monthly pension of ₹3,000/- to the beneficiaries under this scheme. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an elderly, destitute artist, litterateur, or writer from Uttarakhand. The applicant must have dedicated their life to the development of art, culture, and literature. The applicant must have made significant and distinguished contributions in their field. The applicant must be at least 60 years of age. The applicant must be a native or permanent resident of Uttarakhand. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Birth certificate or age certificate issued by a medical officer
Certificate related to artist/litterateur/writer issued by government/semi-government/non-government/other institutions

application_process: Online To avail the benefits under the pension scheme, applicants can register and apply through the “Apuni Sarkar Uttarakhand” portal available at https://eservices

Along with the application form, the eligible applicant must submit complete details of themselves and their family, along with necessary documents such as Aadhaar card, permanent residence certificate of Uttarakhand, PAN card, bank account details, educational qualification certificate, caste certificate, birth certificate or age certificate issued by a medical officer, a certificate related to artist/litterateur/writer issued by a government, semi-government, non-government or other recognized institution, a certificate of being an artist, and a recommendation from the district administration
The process is considered complete only after these documents are uploaded on the portal by signing up at the "Apuni Sarkar Uttarakhand” Portal, https://eservices
After the submission, the applications are scrutinized by the Director General/Director and then presented before a committee constituted under the chairmanship of the Secretary/Principal Secretary
The committee verifies the submitted documents and calls the concerned artist for an interview
If found eligible during the interview and document verification, the pension is recommended
Subsequently, the Directorate of Culture disburses the approved pension amount to the artist every month
In the event of the death of an artist or litterateur, the monthly pension is transferred to their spouse as a dependent
At present, the Directorate of Culture is providing monthly pension benefits to a total of 123 elderly and indigent artists

The Tamil Nadu Folk Artist Pension Scheme aims to provide financial support to aged and disabled folk artists who have dedicated significant periods of their lives to the promotion and preservation
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Pension Scheme" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The Tamil Nadu Folk Artist Pension Scheme aims to provide financial support to aged and disabled folk artists who have dedicated significant periods of their lives to the promotion and preservation of folk arts. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Regional Office.

benefits.summary: Details The "Pension Scheme" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The Tamil Nadu Folk Artist Pension Scheme aims to provide financial support to aged and disabled folk artists who have dedicated significant periods of their lives to the promotion and preservation of folk arts. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Regional Office.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Details The "Pension Scheme" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The Tamil Nadu Folk Artist Pension Scheme aims to provide financial support to aged and disabled folk artists who have dedicated significant periods of their lives to the promotion and preservation of folk arts. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Regional Office.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a registered folk artist. The applicant's age should be 60 years or above. The artist must have worked continuously in their profession for at least five years. Disabled folk artists (sick and unable to work) who are under 60 but have been registered with the board for five continuous years are eligible for a pension.

required_documents.document_name: Original Registration Card of the Folk Artist.
Original Receipt for Registration and Last Renewal.
Disability Certificate (issued by a Medical Officer, not below the rank of Civil Surgeon under his name and seal should be enclosed in original) (If disabled).

application_process: Offline Application Process: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the regional office and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form VIII & VIIIA from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director/Deputy Director in the regional offices
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Assistant Director/Deputy Director to whom the application has been submitted
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable)
﻿ Selection Procedure: The Board shall examine every application for pension and may accept or reject the claim
The decision of the Board is final
Before rejecting a claim, the Board will give the applicant a reasonable opportunity to make a representation

The scheme aims to support athletes representing the state in various sports disciplines at the national level by providing them with sports kits. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, sports kits are provided through sports associations to players and team members participating in various sports disciplines at the national level across different age groups. Approximately 1,000 players benefit from the scheme annually. ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Tribal Culture
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tribal Culture" by the Directorate of Welfare of Plains Tribes and Backward Classes, Government of Assam, aims to provide financial grants to NGOs, Trusts, and Voluntary Organizations working for the advancement of tribal culture among Scheduled Tribes (Plains) in As
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tribal Culture" by the Directorate of Welfare of Plains Tribes and Backward Classes, Government of Assam, aims to provide financial grants to NGOs, Trusts, and Voluntary Organizations working for the advancement of tribal culture among Scheduled Tribes (Plains) in Assam's plain districts (excluding BTC area). The scheme supports initiatives like heritage preservation, literature promotion, cultural activities, and local brews. Eligible organizations must be registered and have prior experience in tribal culture promotion. Applications are invited through advertisements, and grants are disbursed subject to Selection Committee approval.

benefits.summary: Financial Grant: Maximum of ₹3,00,000/- per organization for tribal culture promotion initiatives (e.g., heritage, literature, local brews). Disbursement: Subject to Selection Committee approval and fund availability. *Financial assistance is not a right; approval depends on eligibility and fund availability.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Grant: Maximum of ₹3,00,000/- per organization for tribal culture promotion initiatives (e.g., heritage, literature, local brews). Disbursement: Subject to Selection Committee approval and fund availability. *Financial assistance is not a right; approval depends on eligibility and fund availability.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a Registered NGO/Trust/Voluntary Organization under the Societies Registration Act, 1980, or equivalent. The applicant must have a demonstrated background in promoting tribal culture. *Priority is given to organizations with ST(P) members.

required_documents.document_name: Registration document of NGO/Trust/Voluntary Organization (valid till 2017–18).
Detailed project report, including plan, estimate, and budget.
Background certification of the organization from the concerned District Deputy Commissioner.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The Directorate of Welfare of Plains Tribes and Backward Classes, Assam, will advertise the scheme in print and electronic media, along with the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Director, WPT & BC, Assam
Applicants are advised to retain a copy of the submitted application and acknowledgment for future reference
﻿ Scrutiny & Approval The Selection Committee evaluates applications and approves beneficiaries
Disbursement Approved funds are allocated to selected organizations
﻿ * The Selection Committee may reject applications without justification
* Organizations must ensure submitted information is accurate; false details may lead to disqualification

schemes.scheme_name: Popular Tiatr Competition
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Popular Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to bring about all round development of Popular Tiatr by organizing annual competitions in different parts of Goa, preserving and promoti
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Popular Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to bring about all round development of Popular Tiatr by organizing annual competitions in different parts of Goa, preserving and promoting the traditional format of tiatr performances. The scheme provides cash prizes ranging from ₹2,000/- to ₹2,00,000/- for various categories including performance, direction, acting, singing, and technical aspects, along with mementos and certificates for winners. The applicant must have completed at least 5 performances including Kantaram during the period from 1st April 2018 to 31st December 2018 and must perform in specified auditoriums across Goa. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline through submission of application forms along with required documents. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prizes for Performance Categories 1st Prize: ₹2,00,000/- and Memento; 2nd Prize: ₹1,50,000/- and Memento; 3rd Prize: ₹1,00,000/- and Memento Individual Artist Awards (Acting) 1st Prize (Male): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Male): ₹5,000/- 1st Prize (Female): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Female): ₹5,000/- Best Comedian (Male): ₹10,000/-; Best Comedian (Female): ₹10,000/- Best Supporting Artist (Male): ₹5,000/-; Best Supporting Artist (Female): ₹5,000/- Best Actor in Negative Role (Male): ₹5,000/-; Best Act
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prizes for Performance Categories 1st Prize: ₹2,00,000/- and Memento; 2nd Prize: ₹1,50,000/- and Memento; 3rd Prize: ₹1,00,000/- and Memento Individual Artist Awards (Acting) 1st Prize (Male): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Male): ₹5,000/- 1st Prize (Female): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Female): ₹5,000/- Best Comedian (Male): ₹10,000/-; Best Comedian (Female): ₹10,000/- Best Supporting Artist (Male): ₹5,000/-; Best Supporting Artist (Female): ₹5,000/- Best Actor in Negative Role (Male): ₹5,000/-; Best Actor in Negative Role (Female): ₹5,000/- Best Direction Awards 1st Prize: ₹15,000/-; 2nd Prize: ₹10,000/-; 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- Technical and Other Aspects Best Setting: ₹10,000/-; Best Light Effects: ₹10,000/- Best Live Music: ₹15,000/- (To be shared by all Musicians) Best Make-up: ₹5,000/-; Best Costumes: ₹5,000/- Best Background Music: ₹10,000/- Best Singer Awards (Solo) 1st Prize (Male): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Male): ₹5,000/- 1st Prize (Female): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Female): ₹5,000/- Child Artist (Male): ₹2,000/-; Child Artist (Female): ₹2,000/- Best Actor (Child Artists) Child Artist (Male): ₹2,000/-; Child Artist (Female): ₹2,000/- Other Songs Categories Best Duet: ₹10,000/-; Best Duo: ₹10,000/-; Best Trio: ₹15,000/- Best Quartet/Quintet: ₹20,000/- Best Choral Song (Maximum four singers): ₹10,000/- Best Comedy Kantar (solo): ₹5,000/- Script and Lyrics Awards Best Lyrics (1st Prize): ₹5,000/- Best Script (1st Prize): ₹10,000/- Best Script (2nd Prize): ₹5,000/- Additional Benefits Performance Fee: ₹5,000/- (only if the applicant gives consent to video record the performance). Free DVD Copy: One copy of the performance recording will be provided to the applicant. Video Recording: Expenditure on video recording will be borne by Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿ *Awards will be announced and distributed in a specially organized Award Distribution Ceremony. *All prizes are one-time cash awards. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must have completed at least 5 performances including Kantaram during the period from 1st April to 31st December. The applicant must perform in specified auditoriums including Ravindra Bhavan Margao, Gomant Vidya Niketan Margao, Hanuman Natyagraha Mapusa, Kala Academy Panjim, Rajiv Gandhi Kala Mandir Ponda, Ravindra Bhavan Vasco, Ravindra Bhavan Sanquelim, or Ravindra Bhavan Curchorem. The applicant must present popular tiatrs having traditional format of the tiatr. The applicant must maintain the traditional format strictly as specified. The applicant must communicate the date, time and place of staging of the tiatr in the competition to the organizers at least 15 days in advance from the date of performance. The applicant must arrange for 6 passes for the Judges and the Organizers at the performance of the Competition show. The applicant must ensure live music with a band consisting of at least 5 instruments which shall include drums, keyboard, bass, guitar and 2 blowing instruments. (Optional) The applicant may include child artists up to 12 years of age for special awards in singing and acting. Other Conditions The tiatr must be strictly presented as per the given traditional format wherever it is staged. If the format is not maintained, the tiatr will not be eligible for 1st, 2nd and 3rd prize, however individual prizes will be given for deserving artists. The decision to award or not to award the prizes shall depend entirely on the recommendations of the panel of judges. Political songs should be performed without exceeding the limits of freedom of expression, and criticizing individuals by taking name or displaying images or character assassination will not be allowed. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self Attested Copies of Aadhaar Card.
Self Attested Copies of Permanent Account Number Card.
Three Typed Copies of the Script of the Play (Handwritten Copies Will Not Be Accepted).
Three Typed Copies Each of the Lyrics of the Songs (Handwritten Copies Will Not Be Accepted).
No Objection Certificate (if the Script is Based on the Story of Some Other Writer).
Complete Details of 5 or More Performances of the Tiatrs.
Complete Cast and Crew Information Including Names of Characters and Artists.

application_process: Offline Applications will be invited by releasing press notes and advertisements in the local dailies
Applicants should regularly monitor these announcements for application opening dates
Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Await Scheduling Communication After successful submission, wait for communication from organizers regarding the date, time and venue allocation for the competition performance
The judgment will be conducted from 5th January 2019 to 5th February 2019 at respective auditoriums

Step 2: Confirm Performance Schedule Once the performance schedule is communicated, confirm participation and ensure all logistical arrangements including arranging 6 passes for judges and organizers at the performance venue
Step 3: Stage the Performance Present the tiatr performance strictly as per the traditional format at the assigned auditorium during the competition period
Ensure compliance with all technical requirements including live music band with minimum 5 specified instruments
*The judgment will be conducted in January-February at respective auditoriums
*The decision of the panel of judges will be final and binding, and no correspondence regarding results will be entertained

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Tiatr Related Activities
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Related Activities" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to support cultural institutions and individuals in organizing various activities related to tiatr in their respective villag
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Related Activities" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to support cultural institutions and individuals in organizing various activities related to tiatr in their respective villages and towns to preserve and promote the traditional Konkani theatrical art form. The scheme provides financial support for organizing Konkani musical shows, singing competitions, acting competitions, one act plays, and programs celebrating the contribution of local tiatr artists both deceased and living but non-active, while ensuring these activities are made accessible to the public free of charge. The applicant must be a cultural institution or individual willing to organize tiatr-related activities and must submit applications within specified advance notice periods ranging from 8 to 30 days depending on the activity type. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline through prescribed application forms available at the Tiatr Academy of Goa office. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Support Categories Category A1 - Konkani Musical Shows: Financial assistance for organizing shows with minimum 14 songs including duets, trios, quartets, choral songs, solos and at least 2 comedy skits. Category A2 - Singing Competitions: Financial assistance for organizing competitions with minimum 15 participants singing newly composed kantaram. Category B1 - Competitions: Financial assistance for acting competitions including monologue, dialogue, and one act play competitions. Categ
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Support Categories Category A1 - Konkani Musical Shows: Financial assistance for organizing shows with minimum 14 songs including duets, trios, quartets, choral songs, solos and at least 2 comedy skits. Category A2 - Singing Competitions: Financial assistance for organizing competitions with minimum 15 participants singing newly composed kantaram. Category B1 - Competitions: Financial assistance for acting competitions including monologue, dialogue, and one act play competitions. Category B2 - Celebrating Tiatr Artists: Financial assistance for organizing programs to remember and felicitate prominent tiatr artists. Conditions Programs must be staged free of charge to the public. All promotional materials must acknowledge collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa. Backdrop of minimum size 6 feet x 10 feet displaying Tiatr Academy of Goa logo is mandatory. No adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or content against caste, creed, and religion permitted. Chief Guest and Guest of Honour must be decided in consultation with Tiatr Academy of Goa. President or Vice President of Tiatr Academy of Goa will be the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a cultural institution or individual organizing tiatr-related activities in Goa. The applicant must organize activities in their respective villages or towns. The applicant must ensure the program is staged free of charge to the public. The applicant must agree to acknowledge Tiatr Academy of Goa collaboration in all promotional materials. The applicant must ensure content does not contain adverse remarks against governments, individuals, institutions, or content against caste, creed, and religion. For Konkani Musical Shows The applicant must ensure lyrics are newly composed and not recorded on any Audio/Video/Digital Versatile Disc Albums. The applicant must arrange a band with minimum 5 instruments including drums, keyboard, guitar and 2 blowing instruments. The applicant must organize minimum 14 songs including interactive duets, duos, trios, quartets/quintets, choral songs, solos and at least 2 comedy skits. The applicant must submit typed lyrics and skit scripts at least 30 days in advance. For Singing Competitions The applicant must ensure minimum 15 participants. The applicant must ensure participants sing newly composed kantaram not recorded on any Audio/Video/Digital Versatile Disc Albums. The applicant must arrange a band with minimum 5 instruments including drums, keyboard, guitar and 2 blowing instruments. The applicant must provide competition rules to Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must submit typed song lyrics at least 8 days in advance. For Other Competitions The applicant must submit application form at least 30 days in advance. For Celebrating Tiatr Artists The applicant must focus on prominent tiatr artists such as actors, singers, writers. The applicant must submit application form at least 15 days in advance. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card
Typed Set of Lyrics of Songs (For Musical Shows - Submit 30 Days In Advance)
Script of Comedy Skits (For Musical Shows - Submit 30 Days In Advance)
Typed Set of Song Lyrics (For Singing Competitions - Submit 8 Days In Advance)
Copy of Competition Rules (For Singing Competitions)
No Objection Certificate from Director/Writer (If Applicant Is Other Than Director/Writer)

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds

﻿ Application Deadline Submit the completed application form along with all required documents to Tiatr Academy of Goa office within the specified timeframe: 30 days in advance for Musical Shows and Competitions
15 days in advance for Celebrating Tiatr Artists
8 days in advance for submission of song lyrics in Singing Competitions

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Coordinate with Tiatr Academy of Goa After application acceptance, discuss and finalize the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour arrangements with Tiatr Academy of Goa, ensuring the President or Vice President of Tiatr Academy of Goa will serve in this capacity
Step 2: Setup & Conduct the Event Arrange for the mandatory backdrop of minimum size 6 feet x 10 feet displaying Tiatr Academy of Goa logo and collaboration statement
Ensure all promotional materials, advertisements, banners include the mandatory acknowledgment "This programme is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa"

Execute the approved tiatr-related activity ensuring compliance with all scheme norms including free admission to public, appropriate content guidelines, and proper collaboration acknowledgments throughout the program

Step 3: Financial Documentation & Payment Request After the event, prepare a comprehensive statement of expenditure supported by original bills and stamped receipts for any expenses exceeding ₹5,000/- as required for payment processing
Submit the statement of expenditure along with all original bills and stamped receipts to Tiatr Academy of Goa for payment processing, ensuring all documentation is complete and accurate

schemes.scheme_name: Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Activities
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Activities" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to create interest in Tiatr among students of educational institutions and tiatr lovers in villages and cities. The
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Activities" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to create interest in Tiatr among students of educational institutions and tiatr lovers in villages and cities. The scheme provides for the creation of awareness about tiatr, its song, and music through academic activities such as talks, symposia, seminars, and workshops. These activities, which must have at least 20 participants, can be organized by the Tiatr Academy of Goa alone or in collaboration with other institutions or individuals, with the Academy covering various expenditures and providing necessary materials. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa on a 'First Come First Serve' basis, and applications for this scheme are accepted as per the availability of funds. ﻿

benefits.summary: • Awareness Creation: Awareness about Tiatr, its song, and music will be created through academic activities such as talks, symposia, seminars, and workshops. • Resource Person Honorarium: Resource persons will be paid an honorarium, as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, for every session, with the amount dependent upon the distance from their residence to the venue. • Expenditure Coverage: The Tiatr Academy of Goa will cover the expenditure incurred on Resource Persons, refreshments, and food (
benefits.raw_benefits_text: • Awareness Creation: Awareness about Tiatr, its song, and music will be created through academic activities such as talks, symposia, seminars, and workshops. • Resource Person Honorarium: Resource persons will be paid an honorarium, as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, for every session, with the amount dependent upon the distance from their residence to the venue. • Expenditure Coverage: The Tiatr Academy of Goa will cover the expenditure incurred on Resource Persons, refreshments, and food (lunch or dinner) served to participants. Additionally, any other miscellaneous expenditure made in organizing the activity by an institution or individual by way of collaboration will be taken care of by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. • Provision of Materials: The Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide essential materials, including a backdrop, certificates for the participants, and stationery. • Documentation Coverage: The Tiatr Academy of Goa will document the Symposia, Seminar, or Workshop, and the expenditure incurred on this documentation will be borne by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿ Conditions *Prior approval will be required from the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing the resource persons, if the activity is organized in collaboration with others. *The cost of refreshments or food to be served must be verified and approved by the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalization. *The scheme will be implemented strictly on a ‘First Come First Serve’ basis. *Applications will be considered, and benefits disbursed as per the availability of funds. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility • The applicant must be an educational institution or an individual interested in collaborating with the Tiatr Academy of Goa to organize academic activities for promoting Tiatr. • The applicant must ensure the number of participants for conducting the Symposia, Seminar, or Workshop shall be at least 20. • The applicant must obtain prior approval from the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing resource persons, if the activity is organized by others in collaboration. • The applicant must get the cost of refreshments or food to be served verified and approved by the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing them. ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds

schemes.scheme_name: Production of Tiatr in Villages/Urban Areas/Educational Institutions
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Production of Tiatr in Villages/Urban Areas/Educational Institutions" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa, aims to explore hidden singing and acting talents among the youths in villages and provide encouragement to develop
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Production of Tiatr in Villages/Urban Areas/Educational Institutions" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa, aims to explore hidden singing and acting talents among the youths in villages and provide encouragement to develop such talents by promoting tiatr activities among villagers, addressing the need to nurture local artistic capabilities in rural and urban areas including educational institutions. The scheme provides financial and technical support for various aspects including direction, live band, outside artistes, stage setting, background music, costumes, make-up, and light effects, along with technical guidance through directors from Tiatr Academy of Goa's Panel of Directors. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Support: Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide financial support to the extent as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa towards various aspects: Direction, Live Band (with at least 2 blowing instruments), Outside Artistes, Stage Setting, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, Light Effects. Technical Guidance: Provision of director from Tiatr Academy of Goa's Panel of Directors who will direct village talents and produce the tiatr. Director Expenses: The expenditure incurred in engaging the director
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Support: Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide financial support to the extent as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa towards various aspects: Direction, Live Band (with at least 2 blowing instruments), Outside Artistes, Stage Setting, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, Light Effects. Technical Guidance: Provision of director from Tiatr Academy of Goa's Panel of Directors who will direct village talents and produce the tiatr. Director Expenses: The expenditure incurred in engaging the director will be borne by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Marketing Materials: Provision of one banner which should be compulsorily displayed on one of the two front side wings of the stage. Documentation: Tiatr Academy of Goa may video film the performance at Kala Academy. Observer Support: Tiatr Academy of Goa may depute an observer from its Panel of Observers to see whether the performance has been made as per the norms of the scheme. Payment Method: Payment will be made directly to the service providers. Sponsorship Policy: Sponsorship from businessmen, firms etc. may be taken. ﻿ Conditions *The performance of the tiatr should be staged in the village/urban area of production. *The tiatr should be shown to the people free without charging any tickets. *Submit statement of expenditure enclosing all original bills (stamped receipt if the amount exceeds ₹5,000/-). *Provide 20 invitation cards/entry passes to Tiatr Academy of Goa well in advance from the middle of rows A, B, or C. *Return banner to Tiatr Academy of Goa after the show is staged. *Payment will be made only after the receipt of the observer's certificate. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an Educational Institution, Cultural Association, Dramatic Troupe, or Individual. The applicant must be interested in promoting Tiatr culture in the village. The applicant must be from the particular village/urban area/parish (in case of Mumbai, Sindhudurg and other parts of the country). The participating artistes must be from the particular village/urban area/parish (Educational Institutions only). A maximum of 3 artistes from outside the village/urban areas/parish must be allowed to act as well as sing in the tiatr. The tiatr must be produced in its original format including 6 or 7 acts (podd'dde) with at least 4 'cantos' and comedy linked to the story of the play. The tiatr must include at least 14 'Kantaram' which includes at least 2 Duets, 1 Duo, 2 Trios, 1 Quartet/Quintet, 2 Choral Songs and Solos. The applicant must not make any adverse remark in any form either written or verbal against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the scripts/lyrics of songs/performances/speeches which may hurt the sentiments of anybody. The applicant must communicate the schedule of practices to Tiatr Academy of Goa well in advance. The applicant must discuss with Tiatr Academy of Goa and decide who will be the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour at the performance well in advance. The applicant must ensure this is the first performance of the tiatr for which financial assistance is sought from Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿ Script and Performance Requirements The script and songs may be written/composed by anyone from within the village or elsewhere but acting and singing must be done by the artistes from the particular village/urban area/parish. Musicians may be from anywhere and not necessarily from the village. Advertising Requirements: In all advertisements, oral, or print or electronic media, banners, etc. the following must be inserted/published/announced 'This Tiatr is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa'. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copy of Permanent Account Number Card
Typed Script of Tiatr and Lyrics of Songs
No Objection Certificate from the Original Writer (If the Applicant Is Not the Writer of the Tiatr)
List of Participants with Full Postal Address with House Number and Contact Number
Address Proof of the Artiste (In Case of Mumbai and Other Parts of the Country to Prove That the Artiste Belongs To That Particular Parish)
Statement of Expenditure Enclosing All Original Bills (Stamped Receipt If Amount Exceeds ₹5,000/-)
5 Photographs of the Performance for Records (Two Photographs Should Display the Tiatr Academy of Goa Banner During the Performance)
Observer's Certificate Confirming the Performance Was in Accordance with Tiatr Academy of Goa's Norms

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds
*The application should reach Tiatr Academy of Goa 30 days in advance of the date of staging the tiatr
*The cheque will be issued in the name appearing at Serial Number 1 of the application form (name of individual/registered association/dramatic troupes/educational institution)
﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Schedule Coordination & Chief Guest Arrangement The applicant must communicate the schedule of practices to Tiatr Academy of Goa well in advance
Discuss with Tiatr Academy of Goa and decide regarding the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour at the performance well in advance

Step 2: Collect Banner & Provide Invitation Cards The applicant must collect the banner from the office of Tiatr Academy of Goa and arrange for its compulsory display on one of the two front side wings of the stage during the performance

The applicant must provide 20 invitation cards/entry passes to Tiatr Academy of Goa well in advance, ensuring these seats are from the middle of the rows A, B, or C for proper viewing of the performance

Step 3: Stage Performance The applicant must stage the tiatr in the village/urban area of production ensuring all conditions are met including free admission for public, proper acknowledgment of Tiatr Academy of Goa collaboration in all advertisements and media, and maintaining the approved script and format

Step 4: Observer Coordination, Documentation and Reporting The applicant must cooperate with the observer deputed by Tiatr Academy of Goa from its Panel of Observers who will certify that the performance was in accordance to Tiatr Academy of Goa's norms, as payment will be made only after receipt of the observer's certificate

The applicant must document the performance through photographs and submit 5 copies to Tiatr Academy of Goa for records, ensuring two photographs show the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner during performance

Step 5: Submit Financial Documentation & Return Materials The applicant must prepare and submit a detailed statement of expenditure with all original bills (stamped receipts if amount exceeds ₹5,000/-) to Tiatr Academy of Goa for direct payment to service providers
The applicant must return the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner to the office after the show is staged to complete the programme requirements and maintain the academy's inventory

schemes.scheme_name: Rock Climbing Adventure Training Course
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Rock Climbing Adventure Training Course" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to develop a spirit of adventure, encourage physical endurance, and boost confidence and discipline among children belonging to Scheduled Tribes through a
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Rock Climbing Adventure Training Course" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to develop a spirit of adventure, encourage physical endurance, and boost confidence and discipline among children belonging to Scheduled Tribes through a structured training program. The scheme provides selected students with an opportunity to participate in a 6-day residential rock climbing adventure course conducted at either Mount Abu or Junagadh. It focuses on holistic development by engaging youth in outdoor sports activities, thereby fostering physical and mental growth. ﻿ ﻿

benefits.summary: Training: A 6-day rock climbing adventure course for 100 children aged 9 to 12 years, conducted at Mount Abu or Junagadh Center. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Training: A 6-day rock climbing adventure course for 100 children aged 9 to 12 years, conducted at Mount Abu or Junagadh Center. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. The applicant should be between 9 and 12 years. The applicant must be physically fit. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Self-Attested Copy of Date of Birth Certificate.
Self-Attested Copy of Scheduled Tribe (ST) Caste Certificate.
Consent Letter from the Applicant's Guardian.

Self-Attested Copy of Participation Certificate (Required if the applicant participated in National Parade on 15th August / 26th January or secured 1st to 3rd place in Taluka/District/State level Sports Festival).
Proof of Attachment to NCC/NSS (if applicable).

application_process: Offline Step 1: The applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: All required fields in the form should be completed carefully, and copies of the necessary documents must be enclosed (self-attestation may be required)
Step 3: Submit the properly filled and signed application form, along with all attached documents, to the District Youth Development Office
Step 4: Ensure to obtain a submission receipt or acknowledgment slip from the official receiving the application for future reference

schemes.scheme_name: Basic Rock Climbing Training for Tribal and Scheduled Caste Youth
schemes.brief_description: Details The "Basic Rock Climbing Training for Tribal and Scheduled Caste Youth" scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to promote adventure, enhance physical fitness, and tap into the latent potential of youth from Schedule
schemes.detailed_description: Details The "Basic Rock Climbing Training for Tribal and Scheduled Caste Youth" scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to promote adventure, enhance physical fitness, and tap into the latent potential of youth from Scheduled Castes (SC) and Scheduled Tribes (ST). Under this scheme, a basic rock climbing training program has been organized for 100 youth since 2010-2011, with the aim of improving physical capacity, fostering an adventurous spirit, and bringing out the latent potential in youth belongs to scheduled caste and Scheduled Tribe. ﻿

benefits.summary: Adventure Training Course: Free-of-cost basic rock climbing training for selected SC/ST youth. Skill Development: Enhances physical fitness, endurance, mental strength, and leadership qualities. Capacity Building: Promotes team spirit and encourages youth to participate in national adventure initiatives. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Adventure Training Course: Free-of-cost basic rock climbing training for selected SC/ST youth. Skill Development: Enhances physical fitness, endurance, mental strength, and leadership qualities. Capacity Building: Promotes team spirit and encourages youth to participate in national adventure initiatives. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category. The applicant must be between 18 and 35 years of age. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Consent letter from the applicant's guardian

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the documents to the office of the District Youth Development Officer

The scheme aims to promote physical fitness and well-being among rural youth by establishing open gyms in village communities. ﻿
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Rural Sports and Health Promotion Scheme" was launched by the Department of Youth Welfare and prantiy rakshak dal (PRD), Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote physical fitness and well-being among rural youth by establishing open gyms in village communities. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, an amount of ₹17,960/- is allocated to Mangal Dals for setting up community fitness equipment (open gym) in each Gram Panchayat to promote the health and fitness of the youth. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under this scheme, an amount of ₹17,960/- is allocated to Mangal Dals for setting up community fitness equipment (open gym) in each Gram Panchayat to promote the health and fitness of the youth. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility All Gram Panchayats in Uttarakhand are eligible. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Submission of documents is required in accordance with the department's guidelines to avail the benefits of the scheme.

application_process: Offline At the Gram Panchayat level, a site is selected for the construction of an open gym
The proposal is approved by the Gram Sabha and then submitted to the regional Youth Welfare and PRD officer
Once verified and approved, the allocated amount is disbursed to the Mangal Dal associated with the Gram Panchayat

schemes.scheme_name: Retired Sportsperson Pension Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Retired Sportsperson Pension Scheme" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to recognize and support the contributions of state-level sportspersons who have won medals in national-level sports events by offering them a financial pensio
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Retired Sportsperson Pension Scheme" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to recognize and support the contributions of state-level sportspersons who have won medals in national-level sports events by offering them a financial pension after the age of 50 years. The scheme ensures dignified post-retirement sustenance for these individuals, thereby encouraging younger generations to pursue sports professionally. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat. ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: A Pension of ₹3,000/- per month. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: A Pension of ₹3,000/- per month. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should be a male. The applicant should be a sportsperson. The applicant should be aged above 50 years at the time of application. The applicant should have won medals in national-level sports competitions representing the state. ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Remembering Tiatr Artistes of Yesteryears - Organisation of Special Dedicated Programmes
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Remembering Tiatr Artistes of Yesteryears - Organisation of Special Dedicated Programmes" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make the younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Remembering Tiatr Artistes of Yesteryears - Organisation of Special Dedicated Programmes" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make the younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of great tiatr personalities of the past who are no more with us, addressing the problem that today's younger generation does not know much about these pioneers whose contribution to Goan tiatr is immense. The scheme provides collaboration with troupes/institutions/individuals for producing special dedicated programmes on the lives of particular artistes and financial assistance with auditorium/hall facilities for staging programmes. The applicant must be a troupe/institution/individual willing to produce special programmes dedicated to particular artistes and must obtain No Objection Certificate from the nearest family members of the late artiste. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Assistance: Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for each show. Infrastructure Support: Provision of auditorium/hall to stage the programme. Village Performances: Financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for erecting temporary pandal, providing stage, sound, etc. for village performances. Additional Shows: Option for additional 2 shows in villages at an amount as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa plus additional amount as fixe
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Assistance: Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for each show. Infrastructure Support: Provision of auditorium/hall to stage the programme. Village Performances: Financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for erecting temporary pandal, providing stage, sound, etc. for village performances. Additional Shows: Option for additional 2 shows in villages at an amount as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa plus additional amount as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for Pandal/Hall/Auditorium including Stage, Sound, etc. Documentation: Tiatr Academy of Goa will document the programme and preserve it at Tiatr Academy of Goa's library. Marketing Materials: Provision of banner for tiatr performances and logo for musical shows. Number of Shows: Maximum of 4 shows at different places including 1 show at the area of residence. * Tiatr Academy of Goa has no objection if sponsorship is taken by the producer from other sources. ﻿ Conditions *All shows must be shown to the public free without charging any tickets. *Programme duration should be at least 2 hours for musical show and 3 hours for tiatr. *Display Tiatr Academy of Goa banner compulsorily on front side wing of stage for tiatr or minimum size of 6ft. x 10ft. backdrop with Tiatr Academy of Goa logo for musical show. *Return banner to Tiatr Academy of Goa after all shows are staged. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a troupe, institution, or individual. The applicant must wish to produce and stage a special programme dedicated to a particular artiste of yesteryears. The applicant must obtain No Objection Certificate from the nearest family members of the late artiste. The applicant must invite family members compulsorily for the function. The applicant must stage the inaugural show preferably in Panjim, Margao or in the village of the artiste where he resided. The applicant must submit the proposal well in advance giving all details of the programme including script and lyrics to be presented including the names of the artistes. The applicant must comply with all conditions specified by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must not make any adverse remark in any form either written or verbal against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions in the scripts/song lyrics/performances/speeches. In all advertisements, oral, print or electronic media, banners, etc., the following must be inserted/published/announced: 'This programme is held in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa'. * Tiatr Academy of Goa has no objection if sponsorship is taken by the producer from other sources. ﻿ Programme Content Requirements The programme must include staging of tiatr/one-act plays written by the artistes of yesteryears. The programme can include musical activities such as songs and music composed and sung by the late artiste if he/she was a singer or music composer/musician. The programme should include narration of history of the life of the late artiste to whom the programme is dedicated. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Prescribed Application Form Available In The Office Of Tiatr Academy of Goa
Self Attested Copy Of Aadhaar Card
Self Attested Copy Of Permanent Account Number Card
Lyrics Of All Songs (If It Is A Musical Programme)
Script Of The Tiatr And Lyrics Of Songs (If The Performance Is Of A Tiatr)
No Objection Certificate From The Nearest Family Members Of The Late Artiste
Statement Of Expenditure Enclosing All Original Bills (Stamped Receipt If Amount Exceeds ₹5,000/-)
5 Copies Of Photographs Of The Function For Records (Two Of Which Should Show The Tiatr Academy of Goa Banner During Performance)

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Alternatively, the applicant may visit the office of Tiatr Academy of Goa to collect the form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment
*Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds
*Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules
*If adverse remarks are proved, Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to disqualify the performance and refrain from making payment or recall the payment made

﻿ Post Application Processes Step 1: Coordinate with Tiatr Academy of Goa The applicant must discuss and decide about the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour well in advance with Tiatr Academy of Goa, as the President or Vice President of Tiatr Academy of Goa will either be the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour at the function

Step 2: Collect Banner and Materials The applicant must collect the banner from the office of Tiatr Academy of Goa before the performances (for tiatr) or arrange for backdrop with Tiatr Academy of Goa logo (for musical shows) and ensure proper display during all shows

Step 3: Stage Performances The applicant must stage the approved programme ensuring all conditions are met including free admission for public, proper acknowledgment of Tiatr Academy of Goa collaboration in all advertisements and media, and maintaining the specified duration for each type of performance

Step 4: Documentation and Reporting The applicant must document the programme through photographs and submit 5 copies to Tiatr Academy of Goa for records, ensuring two photographs show the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner during performance

Step 5: Submit Financial Documentation The applicant must prepare and submit a detailed statement of expenditure with all original bills (stamped receipts if amount exceeds ₹5,000/-) to Tiatr Academy of Goa for reimbursement of approved expenses
Step 6: Return Materials The applicant must return the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner to the office after all shows are completed to maintain the academy's inventory and complete the programme cycle
﻿ Application Deadline Applications must reach the office of Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days in advance along with typed script/lyrics
