schemes.scheme_name: Tiatr Competition for Educational Institutions at Higher Secondary/College/University Level
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Tiatr Competition for Educational Institutions at Higher Secondary/College/University Level" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage and develop Tiatr activities among students of educational
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Tiatr Competition for Educational Institutions at Higher Secondary/College/University Level" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage and develop Tiatr activities among students of educational institutions at higher secondary, college, and university levels, recognizing the enthusiasm shown by students in involving themselves in traditional Tiatr performances. The scheme provides financial support for production expenses and awards mementos and certificates to winners in various categories including best performance, individual artistes, direction, and technical aspects. ﻿

benefits.summary: Financial Support: Educational institutions receive financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa to meet expenses for music (live band with at least two blowing instruments), light effects, stage setting, background music, makeup, costumes, refreshments for rehearsals, and transport Performance Platform: 15 educational institutions get opportunity to participate in production and staging of Tiatr Awards and Recognition: Mementos and certificates (no cash prizes) awarded in multiple cate
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Financial Support: Educational institutions receive financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa to meet expenses for music (live band with at least two blowing instruments), light effects, stage setting, background music, makeup, costumes, refreshments for rehearsals, and transport Performance Platform: 15 educational institutions get opportunity to participate in production and staging of Tiatr Awards and Recognition: Mementos and certificates (no cash prizes) awarded in multiple categories including: Best Performance (1st, 2nd, 3rd prizes) Individual Artistes Acting (1st and 2nd prizes for male and female) Best Comedian (male and female) Best Direction (1st, 2nd, 3rd prizes) Technical categories: Best Setting, Light Effects, Music, Background Music, Makeup, Costumes Best Singer Solo (1st and 2nd prizes for male and female) Best songs categories: Duet, Duo, Trio, Quartet/Quintet, Choral Song Best Lyrics (1st and 2nd prizes) Best Script (1st and 2nd prizes) Video Documentation: One copy of Digital Versatile Disc provided free of cost to participating institutions Direct Entry Privilege: First three award winners of previous year's competition get direct entry provided their entries are received before due date *All payments made by cheques in the name of educational institutions. *Awards distributed at special function announced by Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿ Conditions The applicant must maintain adherence to traditional Tiatr format as approved by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must ensure Tiatr duration between 2 to 3 hours including interval of minimum 10 minutes and maximum 15 minutes. The applicant must ensure no adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion in scripts, lyrics, performances, or speeches. The applicant must submit final typed copy of script and songs 3 days before competition commencement. The applicant must limit prior performances of the script to maximum 2 shows before competition. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an educational institution at higher secondary, college, or university level. The applicant must ensure Tiatr script is either new or from any script published by reputed Tiatr writers. The applicant must ensure Tiatr follows traditional format with 6 to 7 acts with at least 4 cantos. The applicant must include comedy linked to the story of the play. The applicant must include at least 8 kantaram including 1 duet (interactive), 1 duo (interactive), 1 trio (interactive), 1 quartet/quintet (interactive), 1 choral song, and solos. The applicant must ensure not more than 2 shows of the given script have been performed prior to competition. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Complete Typed Copy of Tiatr Script
Typed Copy of Lyrics of Kantaram
Refundable Security Deposit Of ₹3,000/- (Cash or Demand Draft In Favour of Member Secretary, Tiatr Academy of Goa Payable at Panaji)
List of Artistes Including Technicians And Backstage Artistes

application_process: Offline Wait for the scheme announcement in local press which will provide details about application deadlines and requirements
Step 1: During the application period announced in local newspapers, visit the office of Tiatr Academy of Goa and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Within the stipulated time period announced in local press, submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 Provide refundable security deposit of ₹3,000/- in the form of cash or demand draft in favour of Member Secretary, Tiatr Academy of Goa payable at Panaji along with the entry form
Note that cheques will not be accepted for this payment
*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment

﻿ Post-Application Processes Step 1: Await feedback from Tiatr Academy of Goa within 10 days regarding script scrutiny, suggestions for improvement, or potential rejection if script does not meet format requirements

Step 2: If more than 15 applications are received, attend the meeting of all applicants where selection of 12 remaining troupes will be done by lots, with first three previous year winners getting direct entry

Post-Selection Processes Step 1: Submit final typed copy of script, typed copy of songs (kantaram), cast of the tiatr, summary of songs, and complete list of artistes including technicians and backstage artistes to Tiatr Academy of Goa during office hours 3 days before competition commencement date

Step 2: Prepare for performance at the place and day identified by Tiatr Academy of Goa, ensuring Tiatr duration is between 2 to 3 hours including interval of 10-15 minutes and follows all prescribed format requirements
Step 3: Stage the Tiatr performance according to the schedule announced in local newspapers, subject to evaluation by panel of judges appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa

schemes.scheme_name: Training Classes In Veda/Devaram
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Training Classes in Veda/Devaram" was launched by the Hindu Religious Institutions and Wakf Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. The scheme offers specialized training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham. These subjects are required for divine worship/Po
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Training Classes in Veda/Devaram" was launched by the Hindu Religious Institutions and Wakf Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. The scheme offers specialized training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham. These subjects are required for divine worship/Poojas. The classes are conducted in various Saivaite and Vainavaite temples in the Puducherry region to provide instruction to eligible candidates. The instructing pandits (teachers) are provided an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month. Applications are collected by receiving them from some of the important temples of the Puducherry region. ﻿

benefits.summary: Provision of training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham, which are required for divine worship/Poojas. Instructing pandits are provided an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month. The honorarium is given once every three months. The honorarium is disbursed upon the pandits furnishing attendance particulars of the students who attended the Veda classes. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Provision of training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham, which are required for divine worship/Poojas. Instructing pandits are provided an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month. The honorarium is given once every three months. The honorarium is disbursed upon the pandits furnishing attendance particulars of the students who attended the Veda classes. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be an eligible candidate to receive the training. The applicant must be a resident of Puducherry. The applicant must know how to read, write, and speak Tamil fluently. The applicant must be interested in receiving specialized training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Recommendation From Two Responsible Persons Of The Applicant's Locality.

*The processing time for the application shall be 15 days

schemes.scheme_name: Travel Grants To Goan Authors
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Travel Grants To Goan Authors" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to enable the Goan writers to come in close contact with the senior writers of a language-region other than their
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Travel Grants To Goan Authors" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to enable the Goan writers to come in close contact with the senior writers of a language-region other than their own within India to acquaint them with the writers and the people of that region, and to widen their awareness and sensibility about the country as a nation.

benefits.summary: The grant amount will be decided by Kala Academy with provision for an advance upto 75% of the total grant for a maximum of two Goan authors.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The grant amount will be decided by Kala Academy with provision for an advance upto 75% of the total grant for a maximum of two Goan authors.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a writer. The applicant should be from Goa. *A copy of the rules and regulations is available at Kala Academy free of charge.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The entries are invited by releasing press announcements in local print and electronic media
The announcement consists of the proforma prescribed by the Kala Academy for application to the scheme
Step 2: In the provided entry form, the interested applicant should fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the supporting documents
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed form along with the supporting documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Member Secretary, Kala Academy, Goa, Campal, Panaji
Step 4: Applications are placed before the Advisory Committee (Literature of Kala Academy) for their recommendation and subsequent approval by the authorities of Kala Academy
Authority for Redressal of Grievances: Member Secretary/Chairman, Kala Academy, Goa

schemes.brief_description: Details "The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibition Scheme" by the Department of Information & Publicity, Government of Goa, aims to encourage young talents in photography and photojournalism, promote self-employment, and provide a platform for local youths to exhibit their work. The scheme offers c
schemes.detailed_description: Details "The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibition Scheme" by the Department of Information & Publicity, Government of Goa, aims to encourage young talents in photography and photojournalism, promote self-employment, and provide a platform for local youths to exhibit their work. The scheme offers cash prizes of ₹20,000/-, ₹16,000/-, and ₹12,000/- in each category. Benefits also include exhibitions for selected entries. Applicants born and residing in Goa for at least 15 years are given preference.

benefits.summary: First prize: ₹20,000/- in each category. Second prize: ₹16,000/- in each category. Third prize: ₹12,000/- in each category. Five consolation prizes: ₹2,000/- each. Certificates are presented to the best entries. Judges' Honorarium: ₹5,000/- each for three judges.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: First prize: ₹20,000/- in each category. Second prize: ₹16,000/- in each category. Third prize: ₹12,000/- in each category. Five consolation prizes: ₹2,000/- each. Certificates are presented to the best entries. Judges' Honorarium: ₹5,000/- each for three judges.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Individuals who were born and residing in Goa for 15 years or more will be given preference, though the scheme does not bar others.

required_documents.document_name: Author Details: Name, Nationality, Postal Address, Mobile Number, Telephone Number, and Email Address (Written on the Back of Photographs in Block Letters).
Technical Details of the Camera Used.
Brief Description of Each Photograph (Not More Than 50 Words).
Bio-data of the Photographer (Not More Than 100 Words).
Certificate of Originality (Declaring Photographs as Original Work).
Latest Residence Certificate (as Proof of Eligibility).

application_process: Offline The interested individuals should send their entries along with the required documents and details to the "Director of Information & Publicity, 3rd Floor, Udyog Bhavan, Panaji, Goa", superscribing the envelope as “Entries for The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibition”
A soft copy of high-resolution photographs will also be required to be submitted

schemes.scheme_name: Trekking in Forest Area (Scheduled Castes)
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Trekking in Forest Area" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to instill a deep love for nature, pristine landscapes, wild animals and birds, trees, mountains, springs, and ravines among the youth of the state by directly engaging t
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Trekking in Forest Area" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to instill a deep love for nature, pristine landscapes, wild animals and birds, trees, mountains, springs, and ravines among the youth of the state by directly engaging them in a forest trekking experience. Under this initiative, a forest area rotation program is conducted for 100 selected young men and women, giving them immersive exposure to natural surroundings and biodiversity. ﻿

benefits.summary: Nature Immersion Experience: The selected beneficiaries will have the opportunity to participate in a guided forest trekking program designed to foster a love for nature and environmental awareness. Exposure to Biodiversity: Participants will get firsthand experience of pristine natural sites including forests, wildlife, birds, trees, springs, mountains, and ravines. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Nature Immersion Experience: The selected beneficiaries will have the opportunity to participate in a guided forest trekking program designed to foster a love for nature and environmental awareness. Exposure to Biodiversity: Participants will get firsthand experience of pristine natural sites including forests, wildlife, birds, trees, springs, mountains, and ravines. ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Taluka Level Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Scheduled Caste
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Taluka Level Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Scheduled Caste" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to facilitate holistic personality development—physical, mental, and spiritual—among Scheduled Caste youth aged
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Taluka Level Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Scheduled Caste" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to facilitate holistic personality development—physical, mental, and spiritual—among Scheduled Caste youth aged between 14 and 35 years by organizing 7-day free training camps. These camps are conducted across all 250 talukas in 41 Scheduled Caste-majority districts of Gujarat and are designed to empower 50 youth participants per taluka through structured personality enhancement and Yogasana sessions. ﻿

benefits.summary: Personality Development: Participants undergo structured sessions for enhancing communication, confidence, discipline, and overall character. Physical Development: Daily Yogasana training and exercises aimed at physical fitness. Mental and Spiritual Development: Yoga and related practices to foster mental peace and spiritual well-being. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Personality Development: Participants undergo structured sessions for enhancing communication, confidence, discipline, and overall character. Physical Development: Daily Yogasana training and exercises aimed at physical fitness. Mental and Spiritual Development: Yoga and related practices to foster mental peace and spiritual well-being. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste category. The applicant should be between 14 and 35 years of age. ﻿

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the office of the District Youth Development Officer
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted

schemes.scheme_name: Tanariri Music Awards Festival and Awards (National Level)
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Tanariri Music Awards Festival and Awards (National Level)" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to commemorate the legacy of legendary musical artistes Beldi Tana and Riri and promote the cultural heritage of Indian classical music
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Tanariri Music Awards Festival and Awards (National Level)" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to commemorate the legacy of legendary musical artistes Beldi Tana and Riri and promote the cultural heritage of Indian classical music by honoring two exceptional female artistes from across the country. These artists are felicitated at a prestigious national-level award ceremony held at Vadnagar, Gujarat, with a cash prize of ₹5,00,000, a shawl, and a certificate each. ﻿ ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prize: Each of the two selected female artists is awarded a cash prize of ₹5,00,000/-. Other Benefit: In addition to the monetary award, recipients receive a shawl and a certificate recognizing their contribution. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prize: Each of the two selected female artists is awarded a cash prize of ₹5,00,000/-. Other Benefit: In addition to the monetary award, recipients receive a shawl and a certificate recognizing their contribution. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a resident of India. The applicant must be a female artiste in the field of Indian classical music. The applicant must have made notable contributions to classical music and demonstrated a distinguished record of achievement. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Proof of Identity (Aadhaar Card, Voter ID, etc.)
Proof of Residence (Utility Bill, Domicile Certificate, etc.)
Resume or Portfolio Detailing Musical Achievements

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required)
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Sangeet Natak Academy
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted

schemes.scheme_name: Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research
schemes.brief_description: Details The Scheme “Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research” has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC) and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging Fellows/academicians to affiliate themselves w
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Scheme “Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research” has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC) and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging Fellows/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest. With a view to infuse fresh knowledge capital into the institutions, the scheme expects these Fellows/academicians to select specific resources of the institutions to use in their projects and take up research works that are related to the main objectives of these institutions. It is also expected that the research work would enrich the institution with a new creative edge and academic excellence. Nodal Institutions (Participating Institutions): The Scheme shall cover the institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC), as listed in the Guidelines, and may cover other such institutions in the future. The scheme will also cover Non-MoC institutions with cultural resources like manuscripts, artifacts, antiquities, books, publications, records, etc., and seek to take advantage of the scheme by engaging distinguished Fellows to work on its resources and also known for its rich publications. The nodal institutions (both MoC and non-MoC) are classified into four groups broadly based on their different areas of specialization, focus, and resources. The classification is as follows: 1. Group-A: Archaeology, Antiquities, Museums & Galleries 2. Group-B: Archives, Libraries and General Fellowship 3. Group-C: Anthropology & Sociology 4. Group D: Crafts, Performing/Visual/Literary Arts Scope of the Scheme: The scope of the Scheme is to enable the identified cultural institutions to engage Fellows of outstanding merit, to work on research projects in order to unravel their unexplored resources. For purposes of convenience, monitoring, accounting, and responsibility, one of the institutions listed above would be the ‘Nodal Institution’ for each project, and the Fellows will be attached/anchored to that institution. Duration of the Fellowship: The duration of the Fellowship will be for a maximum period of two years. In exceptional cases, the institution may recommend to the NSC an extension for a period of up to one more year, or a reduction to somewhat less than two years, if it is supported by its assessment of the quality of the work undertaken. However, in the case of extension, the fellow won’t be eligible for any remuneration including contingency. The award of the Fellowship will commence from the date of joining and the ‘months’ and ‘years’ will be reckoned accordingly. Number of Fellowships: The scheme envisages the granting of up to 15 Fellowships in a year. Each nodal institution can be awarded 1 Fellowship in a year. However, the MoC has the discretionary power to relax these numbers. Administration of the Scheme: The total number of Fellowships administered by the institutions may be decided by the Ministry of Culture from time to time, in consultation with the participating institutions. This will be based on certain criteria such as the size of its untapped holdings, physical facilities already existing in the institution, the capacity of the institution to guide and inspire the Fellows to get the best out of them, its past record in publication and research, need for research/study in a particular area, etc. An amount of up to 2% of the total allocation may be set aside for meeting expenses related to the administration of the scheme including monitoring, implementation, inspection, review, etc. of the research work carried out by the Fellows, through outsourcing or Consultants.

benefits.summary: Honorarium: A Tagore National Fellow who is from a University, College, Research Institute, or Government setup in India would be entitled to the same pay, including grade pay, etc., which he/she would have drawn had he/she continued in his/her parent organization. Essential or mandatory contributions of the employer to Provident Fund etc. would be paid by the parent organizations as would have been paid by them had he/she continued in his/her parent organization. A Fellow from abroad or from a
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Honorarium: A Tagore National Fellow who is from a University, College, Research Institute, or Government setup in India would be entitled to the same pay, including grade pay, etc., which he/she would have drawn had he/she continued in his/her parent organization. Essential or mandatory contributions of the employer to Provident Fund etc. would be paid by the parent organizations as would have been paid by them had he/she continued in his/her parent organization. A Fellow from abroad or from a set-up other than University, College, Research Institute or Government service, or who has retired from active service and/or is on pension, would be entitled to a fixed honorarium of ₹80,000/- per month. No payment of honorarium would normally be made to a Fellow receiving full funding from other sources up to the level of the honorarium, but such Fellow will, however, receive a Contingency Grant, other allowances, and facilities, as decided by the NSC. Contingency Grant: In case of foreign and Indian research fellows residing or serving abroad and having been selected as Tagore Fellows under Non-MoC institutions, to and fro economy class airfare from their country of residence will be provided/reimbursed by the Ministry once during the course of the Fellowship. Similarly, all fellows under Non-MoC institutions who take up the Fellowship under the Scheme will be reimbursed, on an ‘actual’ basis, contingent expenses for making academic trips, engaging research assistants, etc. up to a maximum ceiling of ₹2.50 lakhs per annum, during the tenure of Fellowship subject to verification of requisite bills by the Nodal Institutions. Note: For Fellows selected under MoC Institutions, the expenditure in this regard will be borne by the concerned MoC Institution from the grant-in-aid received by them from their administrative Division of the Ministry. Accommodation: A Fellow who is not a bona-fide resident of the place of the Participating Institution to which he has proposed to be affiliated and who intends to take up rented accommodation in the city of the desired Institution will be required to indicate this fact at the time of applying for Fellowship. The selected Fellow will be entitled to receive a House Rent Allowance of up to 30% of the honorarium. However, with respect to Fellows from Universities, colleges, Research institutes, or Government setups HRA will be paid by the Parent Organization as per entitlement. The MoC Institutions will bear the expenditure in this regard from the grant-in-aid received by them from their administrative Division of the Ministry. In respect of Non-MoC Institutions, the Ministry of Culture will reimburse the House Rent Allowance directly to Fellows on submission of rent receipts (in original) to the Participating Institutions who will verify and forward the same to the Ministry for reimbursement. Settling Allowance: A Fellow from outstation will be given, if required, a lump sum grant of ₹1.00 lakh as settling allowance for packing/transportation, etc., of his personal belongings from the old station to the new station of his stay during the tenure of Fellowship, if he moves station or otherwise transports books and academic effects. Allowance of an equal amount will also be given at the conclusion of the Fellowship for moving out of station. On a case-to-case basis, economy airfare from his/her place/country of residence will be provided/reimbursed upon joining and at the conclusion of the Fellowship. In this regard, Non-MoC Institutions will bear the expenditure and thereafter seek reimbursement from the Ministry after submission of certified copies of Bills along with justification. Support to Fellows: Infrastructural support will be provided by the Nodal Institution to the Fellows to enable them to conduct their research. This may include the provision of a computer with peripherals and connectivity, working space in the institution’s premises, providing a congenial atmosphere to carry out research, etc. Other facilities, like appropriate seating arrangements, library facilities, etc., will also be made available. One important advantage of this scheme will be the access of the Fellows to national institutions for study and avail original and rare research material. In respect of foreign fellows engaged under this scheme, necessary political/security clearances from the concerned Ministries/Departments shall be obtained by the Ministry of Culture. Encouragement and financial support may also be given to enable the Fellows to present papers at conferences hosted by the concerned institution or other related organizations and institutions, which will be met out/reimbursed, on an ‘actuals’ basis, with a ceiling of ₹1.00 lakh per annum, provided adequate academic interaction is arranged

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Fellows who have sound academic or professional credentials and have made significant contributions to knowledge in their respective fields will be eligible to apply for Tagore National Fellowship. Preferably the Fellows who have 5 years of experience in conducting/guiding research or the same experience in performing/any other arts can apply for Tagore National Fellowship. The applicants must have an impressive list of publications into their credit, at least two monographs (single-authored). Fellows to be engaged must have both the credentials as laid down in the preceding paragraph, as well as a strong reputation in the field covered by the Nodal Institution. Those who have in the past directly engaged with major projects at the Nodal Institution and fulfilled the above-mentioned eligibility criteria for a Tagore Fellow are encouraged to apply for the Tagore National Fellowship. Once awarded a Tagore National Fellowship, a candidate cannot apply again for a Fellowship under this scheme, either at the same or any other institution covered under the Scheme. The Scheme will be open to both Indian and foreign nationals. However, the proportion of foreigners will not normally exceed one–third of the total fellowships awarded in a year. Note 01: Interested Fellows are required to enclose a research proposal prepared on the guidelines provided in Appendix A. Note 02: Fellows are also required to prepare a short write-up on how the proposed research would be beneficial for the respective nodal institution. Note 03: The honour and the honorarium are both of a very high order; the Institution Level Search-cum-Screening Committee (ILSSC) of the sponsoring institution and the National Selection Committee may keep these in mind while recommending/ selecting the Tagore National Fellows. Note 04: In short, a person selected for the Tagore National Fellowship should be one who has already become a ‘legend’ in his area of work or is regarded very highly. It is appropriate that those who do not come near this description may not apply or be considered for the highest honour and honorarium accorded to a Fellow in India under this Fellowship. Areas of Research and Eligible Projects: The selected Fellows will normally work on a project that benefits the Nodal Institution in terms of unraveling its resources. The subject of research should be one that can be usefully pursued with the resources and facilities of the Nodal Institution awarding the Fellowship, though he/she will be free to draw on the resources and facilities of other institutions, as well. If the subject of research extends to more than one institution or the Fellow otherwise needs to draw upon the resources and facilities of other institution(s), the Nodal Institution awarding the Fellowship would recommend the Fellow to such other institution(s). In rare cases, where two institutions appear to be of almost equal importance to the Fellows, the second institution may be deemed to be the ‘Co-institution’ and the two may sign a Tripartite MoU regarding Intellectual Property, Publication, Credit sharing, facilities, etc. but accounting shall be with the Nodal Institution. Since the Scheme is focused on unraveling the cultural resources of the Nodal Institution, the project must be driven in that direction, that is, to use substantially the resources of the Nodal Institution. The inputs required for the project should have a very strong linkage with the resources available with the Nodal Institution and (in rare cases) the Co-institution. At the end of it, the project outcome must be beneficial for the Nodal Institution or co-institution, if any, and must add to the existing knowledge of the institution/subject.

required_documents.document_name: Details of Publications, if any (including publication presentation of papers, performances, awards, recognitions etc. if any, separately)
A write-up/synopsis of proposed research work
A short write-up along with application - How the proposed research project is going to be beneficial to the Nodal Institution.
NoC, if a regular Central/State Govt. Employee

application_process: Offline Application Process: Step 01: The Ministry of Culture and/or the concerned institution will widely advertise the Fellowship in the leading national/regional newspapers and on its website (which should give all details) and also disseminate the scheme through professional associations/forums in the relevant fields, so that maximum publicity is accorded to the Scheme

Step 02: The eligible fellows who can spare time of about two years to do a project based on the resources of any of the participating institutions can only apply during the prescribed timeline mentioned in the advertisement

Step 03: The candidates may submit their application form , prepared according to the prescribed guidelines of the Scheme, to any one of the Nodal Institutions of his/her choice depending upon the area of research proposed to be undertaken

Step 04: The candidates may submit their application form along with a biocatalyst of publications and other relevant documents including a write-up on the proposed work (guidelines are in Appendix A), the applicant should enclose a declaration stating that if selected for the Fellowship, he/she will complete the tenure of the Fellowship

Note: The list of nodal institutions along with the other relevant details of the Scheme and application form is available on the website of the Ministry of Culture ﻿ ﻿ and Prime Ministers Museum and Library (PMML) (erstwhile Nehru Memorial Museum and Library (NMML) under the Scheme Head of the website

Process of Selection: Step 01: The received applications will be examined by the Institution Level Search-cum-Screening Committee (ILSSC) constituted by each participating institution for the purposes of this scheme
Step 02: The applications found worthy of consideration will be shortlisted by the ILSSC
Step 03: The selection will be based on the relevance of the study, the benefits of the nodal institution from that particular study, and the credentials and reputation of the scholar

Only such proposals may be selected that seek to (a) engage fellows who have achieved national or international recognition and proven acceptance of their work in national/ international circles; (b) bring out resources that are not yet fully out in the public domain; and (c) publish the work for the benefit of the concerned institution
The selection will be done in two stages
Step 04: The first stage will be of shortlisting of projects and candidates by the ILSSC, according to the criteria broadly specified as part of the Search-cum-Screening process

Apart from considering the applications received, the ILSSC is also expected to adopt a proactive approach to identify relevant projects and search for reputed fellows in that field, contact such fellows, and encourage them to submit their proposals
If the received proposals are not worthy of consideration, the ILSSC need not feel compelled to recommend any proposals for consideration by the NSC
Step 05: At the second stage, applications/names of short-listed candidates will be considered by the NSC for each institution
Contact Details: Director, Nehru Memorial Museum & Library, Teen Murti Bhawan, New Delhi-1100011
011-23013152 or through E-mail: aroresearch
in Section Officer (S & F, Ministry of Culture), Puratatava Bhawan, 2nd Floor, D-Block, GPO Complex, INA, New Delhi-110023, Ph
011-24642133 Between 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM or through e-mail @scholar-culture@nic

in Note: Correspondences (In relation to queries/submission of six monthly progress reports only) through e-mail to the Ministry of Culture and Nehru Memorial Museum and Library would be considered as an approved mode of communication regarding the scheme

schemes.scheme_name: Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award
schemes.brief_description: Details The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Government of India confers the National Adventure Award called “Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award” (TNNAA) in order to recognize the achievements of persons associated in the field of adventure and to encourage young people to develop the spir
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Government of India confers the National Adventure Award called “Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award” (TNNAA) in order to recognize the achievements of persons associated in the field of adventure and to encourage young people to develop the spirit of endurance, risk-taking, cooperative teamwork and quick, ready and effective reflexes in challenging situations. ﻿ The award consists of a bronze statuette, a certificate, a blazer with a silken tie/a saree, and award money of ₹ 15,00,000. The Awards are presented to the winners along with Arjuna Awards by the Government of India. ﻿ Usually, One Award is given in four categories namely, Land Adventure, Water (Sea) Adventure, Air Adventure, and Life Time Achievement for adventure activities on Land, Sea, and Air. Achievements for the last 3 years are considered for the 3 categories namely Land Adventure, Water (Sea) Adventure, and Air Adventure and for the Life Time Achievement award, the achievement of the entire career is considered. ﻿ The nominations for the TNNAA are invited through the portal https://awards.gov.in. Any person having excellent performance and outstanding qualities of leadership, a sense of adventure discipline, and continuous achievement in one particular field of adventure viz. Land, Air, or Water (Sea) may apply for the award through the above portal.

benefits.summary: The award consists of a bronze statuette, a certificate, a blazer with a silken tie/a saree, and award money of ₹ 15,00,000. The Awards are presented to the winners along with Arjuna Awards by the Government of India. The Status of the Award will be the same as the Arjuna Awards conferred in the field of Sports by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports.' The Awards will be presented to the winners along with Arjuna Awards by the Government of India. The Awardees will be reimbursed to and fro a
benefits.raw_benefits_text: The award consists of a bronze statuette, a certificate, a blazer with a silken tie/a saree, and award money of ₹ 15,00,000. The Awards are presented to the winners along with Arjuna Awards by the Government of India. The Status of the Award will be the same as the Arjuna Awards conferred in the field of Sports by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports.' The Awards will be presented to the winners along with Arjuna Awards by the Government of India. The Awardees will be reimbursed to and fro airfare (economy class) and such other fare of conveyance as relevant in the journey through the shortest route from his/her place of stay to the place of the award ceremony and back subject to production of the original boarding passes/ Tickets etc. along with duly filled in proforma. Awardees would be given reimbursement for AC 1-tier rail journey if opted. Awardees will also be provided free boarding and lodging in a suitable place for the award ceremony. One companion with each lady and the physically handicapped awardee will be provided with the same traveling and boarding/lodging facilities as that of the awardee himself/herself. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility CATEGORIES 1. Awards can be given in four categories namely, Land Adventure, Water (Sea) Adventure, Air Adventure, and Life Time Achievement for adventure activities on Land, Sea, and Air. 2. Ordinarily not more than one Award will be made in each category. 3. The Ministry may increase the number of awards in a particular year for specific reasons recorded in writing and with the approval of the Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports. ﻿ ELIGIBILITY A person should have excellent performance and outstanding qualities of leadership, a sense of adventure discipline, and continuous achievement in one particular field of adventure viz. Land, Air, or Water (Sea). The award may be given posthumously if such an occasion arises.

required_documents.document_name: Proof reg. the Educational Qualifications (Marksheets, Degree)
Duly Filled and Signed Description of Achievements as per the format given in the scheme guidelines.
If a candidate is selected for the award, he/ she would be required to furnish the following to the Ministry:
a) bank mandate form duly authorized by the bank.
b) high-resolution photographs wherein the candidate is visible performing the adventure activity.

application_process: Online RECEIPT OF APPLICATIONS 1

Entries for the Awards will be received in a Pro-forma Annexed to these guidelines, giving the past performances of the persons recommended in general and for the year of the Award in particular within such date as is specified on year to year basis
The last date of entry may be relaxed at the discretion of the Government of India in exceptional cases

Candidates applying for the award may get their applications recommended by the Youth/ Sports Department of the State Government concerned, or a recognized adventure institute like the Indian Mountaineering Foundation for Land Adventure, National

Institute of Water Sports for Water (Sea) Adventure and Aero Club of India for Air Adventure or by the Adventure Promotion Cell of the Army/ Navy/Air Force or Indo-Tibetan Border Police or similar other para-military forces
However, they may obtain such recommendations and upload the scanned copy themselves while applying online for the award
All nominations in respect of serving personnel of the Army/Navy/Air Force should be recommended by their respective Adventure Cell/Directorate
However, they may obtain such recommendations and upload the scanned copy themselves while applying online for the award
The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports can also nominate any person on its own or seek nominations from such other organizations/agencies as are deemed fit, for this award

The Ministry will receive the applications/ nominations for the award through an online portal, the link for which will be provided on the website of the Ministry at the time of calling for the nominations
﻿ SCRUTINY 1

All the nominations received in the Ministry will be sent categories-wise to the three apex bodies namely, the Indian Mountaineering Foundation, National Institute of Water Sports, and Aero Club of India as defined in the NPYAD Scheme guideline for verifying achievements in Land, Water (Sea) and Air respectively
Upon which they will confirm from official records the achievements/performance of all nominated persons within a maximum period of one month of receipt of the nominations from the Ministry
For the first three categories viz
Land, Water (Sea), and Air adventure, and achievements of the last three calendar years will be taken into consideration
﻿ PROCEDURE FOR SELECTION 1
The applications will be first scrutinized at the Division level
Ineligible applications will be discarded at this level
The eligible applications will be placed before the Committee
The Committee will discuss the achievements of all the applicants and will recommend suitable candidates for the award
The decision of the Government of India in respect of the Award will be final

schemes.brief_description: Details The Scheme “Tagore National Scholarship for Cultural Research” has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC) and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging scholars/academicians to affiliate themselves
schemes.detailed_description: Details The Scheme “Tagore National Scholarship for Cultural Research” has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC) and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging scholars/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest. The nodal institutions (both MoC and non-MoC) are classified into four groups broadly based on their different areas of specialization, focus, and resources. The classification is as follows: 1. Group-A: Archaeology, Antiquities, Museums & Galleries 2. Group-B: Archives, Libraries and General Scholarship 3. Group-C: Anthropology & Sociology 4. Group D: Crafts, Performing/Visual/Literary Arts Scope of the Scheme: The scope of the Scheme is to enable the identified cultural institutions to engage Scholars of outstanding merit, to work on research projects in order to unravel their unexplored resources. Number of Scholarships: The scheme envisages the granting of up to 25 Scholarships in a year. Each nodal institution can be awarded 1 Scholarship or a maximum of 2 scholarships in a year. However, the MoC has the discretionary power to relax these numbers. Administration of the Scheme: The total number of Scholarships administered by the institutions may be decided by the Ministry of Culture from time to time, in consultation with the participating institutions. This will be based on certain criteria such as the size of its untapped holdings, physical facilities already existing in the institution, the capacity of the institution to guide and inspire the Scholars to get the best out of them, its past record in publication and research, need for research/study in a particular area, etc. An amount of up to 2% of the total allocation may be set aside for meeting expenses related to the administration of the scheme including monitoring, implementation, inspection, review, etc. of the research work carried out by the Scholars, through outsourcing or Consultants.

benefits.raw_benefits_text: Honorarium: The scholarship honorarium will be ₹50,000/- per month. However, if the scholar is from a University, College, Research Institute, or Government set-up in India, he/she would be entitled to the same pay, including grade pay, etc., which he/she would have drawn had he/she continued in his/her parent organization. Note: Essential or mandatory contribution of the employer to Provident Fund etc. would be paid by the parent organizations had he/she continued in his/her parent organization. Contingency Grant: In case of scholars selected as Tagore Scholars under Non-MoC institutions, will also be paid a contingency grant by the Ministry on an ‘actuals basis’ up to a maximum ceiling of ₹10,000 per month and such other allowances/benefits provided in this scheme, and to the extent, as may be specifically decided in each case by the ILSCC/NSC (within the limits applicable in the case of Tagore National Fellows), depending on the nature and the duration of the project subject to the verification of the bills by the Nodal Institutions. Note: For scholars selected under MoC Institutions, the expenditure in this regard will be borne by the concerned MoC Institution from the grant-in-aid received by them from their administrative Division of the Ministry. Accommodation: A Scholar who is not a bona-fide resident of the place of the Participating Institution to which he has proposed to be affiliated and who intends to take up rented accommodation in the city of the desired Institution will be required to indicate this fact at the time of applying for Scholarship. However, with respect to Scholars from University, College, Research Institute or Government set up, HRA will be paid by the Parent Organization as per entitlement. MoC Institutions will bear the expenditure in this regard from the grant-in-aid received by them from their administrative Division of the Ministry. In respect of Non-MoC Institutions, the Ministry of Culture will reimburse the House Rent Allowance directly to Scholars on submission of rent receipts (in original) to the Participating Institutions who will verify and forward the same to the Ministry for reimbursement. Settling Allowance: A Scholar from outstation will be given, if required, a lump sum grant of ₹1.00 lakh as settling allowance for packing/transportation, etc., of his personal belongings from the old station to the new station of his stay during the tenure of the Scholarship, if he moves station or otherwise transports books and academic effects. Allowance of an equal amount will also be given at the conclusion of the Scholarship for moving out of station. On a case-to-case basis, economy airfare from his/her place/country of residence will be provided/reimbursed upon joining and on the conclusion of the Scholarship. In this regard, Non-MoC Institutions will bear the expenditure and thereafter seek reimbursement from the Ministry after submission of certified copies of Bills along with justification. Intimation in advance is also required to be given to the Ministry by the Non-MoC Institutions. MoC Institutions will bear the expenditure in this regard from the grant-in-aid received by them from their administrative Division of the Ministry. Support to Scholars: Infrastructural support will be provided by the Nodal Institution to the Scholars to enable them to conduct their research. This may include the provision of a computer with peripherals and connectivity, working space in the institution’s premises, providing a congenial atmosphere to carry out research, etc. Other facilities, like appropriate seating arrangements, library facilities, etc., will also be made available. One important advantage of this scheme will be the access of the Scholars to national institutions for study and avail original and rare research material. In respect of foreign Scholars engaged under this scheme, necessary political/security clearances from the concerned Ministries/Departments shall be obtained by the Ministry of Culture. Encouragement and financial support may also be given to enable the Scholars to present papers at conferences hosted by the concerned institution or other related organizations and institutions, which will be met out/reimbursed, on an ‘actuals’ basis, with a ceiling of ₹1.00 lakh per annum, provided adequate academic interaction is arranged.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility A scholar with good academic credentials at least one publication, either a book or a research paper in reputed journals, and 2 years of research/teaching experience will be eligible to apply for the Tagore National Scholarships. This scheme also gives opportunities to young artists/performers to apply for the scholarship. The scholars also need to identify a nodal institution from the list given in Appendix B according to their preferences/expertise to conduct original research preferably by using the sources of the same institution. The research work may also include the identification and cataloging of sources available with the institution or the archiving and creation of new sources that the institution should have. (Guidelines for preparing research proposal are given in Appendix A ) Areas of Research and Eligible Projects: The selected Scholars will normally work on a project that benefits the Nodal Institution in terms of unraveling its resources. The subject of research should be one that can be usefully pursued with the resources and facilities of the Nodal Institution awarding the Scholarship, though he/she will be free to draw on the resources and facilities of other institutions, as well. If the subject of research extends to more than one institution or the Scholar otherwise needs to draw upon the resources and facilities of other institution(s), the Nodal Institution awarding the Scholarship would recommend the Scholars to such other institution(s). In rare cases, where two institutions appear to be of almost equal importance to the Scholars, the second institution may be deemed to be the ‘Co-institution’ and the two may sign a Tripartite MoU regarding Intellectual Property, Publication, Credit sharing, facilities, etc. but accounting shall be with the Nodal Institution. Since the Scheme is focused on unraveling the cultural resources of the Nodal Institution, the project must be driven in that direction, that is, to use substantially the resources of the Nodal Institution. The inputs required for the project should have a very strong linkage with the resources available with the Nodal Institution and (in rare cases) the Co-institution. At the end of it, the project outcome must be beneficial for the Nodal Institution or co-institution, if any, and must add to the existing knowledge of the institution/subject.

required_documents.document_name: Details of Publications, if any (including publication presentation of papers, performances, awards, recognitions, etc., if separately)
A write-up/synopsis of proposed research work
A short write-up along with application - How the proposed research project is going to be beneficial to the Nodal Institution.
NoC, if a regular Central/State Government Employee

application_process: Offline Application Process: Step 01: The Ministry of Culture and/or the concerned institution will widely advertise the Scholarship in the leading national/regional newspapers and on its website (which should give all details) and also disseminate the scheme through professional associations/forums in the relevant fields, so that maximum publicity is accorded to the Scheme

Step 02: Eligible Scholars who can spare time of about two years to do a project based on the resources of any of the participating institutions can only apply during the prescribed timeline mentioned in the advertisement

Step 03: The candidates may submit their application form , prepared according to the prescribed guidelines of the Scheme, to any one of the Nodal Institutions of his/her choice depending upon the area of research proposed to be undertaken

Step 04: Candidates may submit their application form along with a biocatalyst of publications and other relevant documents including a write-up on the proposed work (guidelines are in Appendix A ), the applicant should enclose a declaration stating that if selected for the Scholarship, he/she will complete the tenure of the Scholarship

Note: The list of nodal institutions along with the other relevant details of the Scheme and application form is available on the website of the Ministry of Culture and Prime Ministers Museum and Library (PMML) (erstwhile Nehru Memorial Museum and Library (NMML) under the Scheme Head of the website

Process of Selection: Step 01 : The received applications will be examined by the Institution Level Search-cum-Screening Committee (ILSSC) constituted by each participating institution for the purposes of this scheme
Step 02: The applications found worthy of consideration will be shortlisted by the ILSSC
Step 03: The selection will be based on the relevance of the study, the benefits of the nodal institution from that particular study, and the credentials and reputation of the scholar

Only such proposals may be selected that seek to (a) engage Scholars who have achieved national or international recognition and proven acceptance of their work in national/ international circles; (b) bring out resources that are not yet fully out in the public domain; and (c) publish the work for the benefit of the concerned institution
The selection will be done in two stages
Step 04: The first stage will be of shortlisting of projects and candidates by the ILSSC, according to the criteria broadly specified as part of the Search-cum-Screening process

Apart from considering the applications received, the ILSSC is also expected to adopt a proactive approach to identify relevant projects and search for reputed Scholars in that field, contact such Scholars, and encourage them to submit their proposals
If the received proposals are not worthy of consideration, the ILSSC need not feel compelled to recommend any proposals for consideration by the NSC
Step 05: At the second stage, applications/names of short-listed candidates will be considered by the NSC for each institution
Contact Details: (i) Director, Nehru Memorial Museum & Library, Teen Murti Bhawan, New Delhi-1100011
011-23013152 or through E-mail: aroresearch
in (ii) Section Officer (S & F, Ministry of Culture), Puratatava Bhawan, 2nd Floor, D-Block, GPO Complex, INA, New Delhi-110023, Ph
011-24642133 Between 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM or through e-mail @scholar-culture@nic

in Note: Correspondences (In relation to queries/submission of six monthly progress reports only) through e-mail to the Ministry of Culture and Nehru Memorial Museum and Library would be considered as an approved mode of communication regarding the scheme

schemes.scheme_name: Tiatr Research Scholarship Program
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Tiatr Research Scholarship Program" was launched by the Tiatr Academy (TAG) under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage young students to undertake research in different aspects of Tiatr, its song, and music. The scheme provides
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Tiatr Research Scholarship Program" was launched by the Tiatr Academy (TAG) under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage young students to undertake research in different aspects of Tiatr, its song, and music. The scheme provides scholarships to college and university students for research related to Tiatr, which must be conducted in English and Konkani (Roman script only). It also includes the publication of the approved research work in book form by TAG, with 100 copies provided to the student concerned in addition to the scholarship amount. The applicant must submit a report of the research carried out duly signed by either the guide or the head of the institution. ﻿

benefits.summary: Scholarship Amount The amount of each scholarship will be decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) from time to time. Publication of Research Work The research work of the students will be printed by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) in book form after approval by the Recommendation Board. Copies of Published Work Each student concerned will receive 100 copies of their printed research work in addition to the scholarship amount. Number of Scholarships TAG will offer scholarships in three categories every
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Scholarship Amount The amount of each scholarship will be decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) from time to time. Publication of Research Work The research work of the students will be printed by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) in book form after approval by the Recommendation Board. Copies of Published Work Each student concerned will receive 100 copies of their printed research work in addition to the scholarship amount. Number of Scholarships TAG will offer scholarships in three categories every year: ◦ PhD: 1 scholarship ◦ Post-Graduation: 3 scholarships ◦ Graduation: 6 scholarships *Scholarships will be for every academic year. *A scholarship will be given only once in a particular category; however, the same applicant is free to apply for other categories in subsequent academic years. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a bonafide student who does research work or a project related to Tiatr. The applicant must conduct research work in English and Konkani (Roman script only). The applicant should have secured at least 50% marks in the last examination. The applicant must submit a report of the research carried out, duly signed either by the guide or the head of the institution. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Report of The Research Carried Out (Duly Signed Either By The Guide Or The Head of The Institution)
Copy of Mark Sheet / Certificate of Last Examination (Inferred, to substantiate the requirement of at least 50% marks)
Proof of Bonafide Student Status / Enrolment In College/University (Inferred, for undertaking research work related to Tiatr)
Copy of Research Work (Duly certified by the guide, as undertaken in the application form)

schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Scheme for Providing Incentives to Coaches of Athletes who have Won Competitions at the National and International Levels” scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to honour coaches who have significantly contributed to the success of athletes in the field of sports. Under this scheme, financial incentives are provided to coaches of athletes who have won competitions at national and international levels. ﻿

benefits.summary: Under this scheme, financial incentives of up to 10% of the prize money awarded are provided to coaches of winning players in national and international level competitions, subject to a maximum limit of ₹10 lakh. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Under this scheme, financial incentives of up to 10% of the prize money awarded are provided to coaches of winning players in national and international level competitions, subject to a maximum limit of ₹10 lakh. ﻿

The scheme is applicable to coaches of players who have received cash sports talent awards in the year 2015-16 and onwards. The coach should be employed in the Sports Department of the State Government on a permanent or contract basis. The coach must have trained at least five players. The coach must provide supporting evidence from the players who have undergone training. Online, postal, or telephonic coaching will not be considered. ﻿

schemes.scheme_name: Tiatr Script Writing Competition
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Tiatr Script Writing Competition" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to encourage new generation of Tiatr playwrights to script better quality of Tiatrs and enrich the Konkani language through annual script writing competitions. The scheme provides cash prizes up to ₹15,000/- for w
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Tiatr Script Writing Competition" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to encourage new generation of Tiatr playwrights to script better quality of Tiatrs and enrich the Konkani language through annual script writing competitions. The scheme provides cash prizes up to ₹15,000/- for winning scripts and opportunities for publication with honorarium payments, along with certificates for recognition of literary excellence in traditional Konkani theatre. The applicant must write original scripts in traditional tiatr format with minimum 6-7 podd'de and at least 4 Cantos, and must submit scripts that have not been published or performed earlier. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications are accepted through offline submission of typed copies with duly filled application forms. ﻿

benefits.summary: Cash Prizes 1st Prize: ₹15,000/- 2nd Prize: ₹10,000/- 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- Additional Benefits Certificates: Provided to first three prize winners. Publication Opportunity: Prize winning scripts can be printed in book form at Tiatr Academy of Goa's cost (subject to No Objection Certificate from script writer). Honorarium: ₹5,000/- one-time payment for published scripts (in addition to prize money). Complimentary Copies: 100 copies of the published book provided to script writer. Conditions Script
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Cash Prizes 1st Prize: ₹15,000/- 2nd Prize: ₹10,000/- 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- Additional Benefits Certificates: Provided to first three prize winners. Publication Opportunity: Prize winning scripts can be printed in book form at Tiatr Academy of Goa's cost (subject to No Objection Certificate from script writer). Honorarium: ₹5,000/- one-time payment for published scripts (in addition to prize money). Complimentary Copies: 100 copies of the published book provided to script writer. Conditions Scripts must comply with content guidelines - no adverse remarks against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion For publication benefits, script writers must provide No Objection Certificate to Tiatr Academy of Goa. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility Basic Requirements The applicant must write scripts on themes as specified by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must ensure the script has not been published or performed earlier. The applicant must write original scripts only. Script Format Requirements The applicant must write scripts in traditional tiatr format. The applicant must include minimum 6 to 7 podd'de in the script. The applicant must include at least 4 Cantos in the script. The applicant must write scripts in Konkani language using Roman script. The applicant must ensure comedy is inter-related to the main plot (however, comedy may be absent in religious tiatr). Content Guidelines The applicant must ensure scripts do not contain adverse remarks against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions. The applicant must ensure scripts do not contain content against caste, creed and religion that may hurt sentiments. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Three (3) Typed Copies of the Complete Tiatr Script
*Scripts must be submitted in typed format only.
*All copies must be complete and identical.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields
Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment Post-Application Processes Step 1: Evaluation Process The submitted scripts will be evaluated by a panel of judges appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa, whose decision will be final and binding
The judging process will assess scripts based on quality, format compliance, and adherence to specified themes

Step 2: Result Declaration and Prize Distribution Winners will be announced after the judging process is completed, and the first three best scripts will receive cash prizes and certificates as specified
Prize winners will be contacted for any additional procedures related to publication opportunities

The objective of the scheme is to enrich and promote the writing skills of Tiatr playwrights and to have a healthy and constructive discussion on
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Tiatr Script Writing Workshop" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to enrich and promote the writing skills of Tiatr playwrights and to have a healthy and constructive discussion on various aspects of Tiatr script writing amongst the Tiatr writers, participating institutions and artistes. All the Goan tiatr playwrights, artistes and institution representatives, besides experts invited by Kala Academy, are eligible to participate. A hall with infrastructural facilities is made available free of charge. Experts are paid honorarium and travelling expenses. Lunch and refreshments are provided to all participants.

schemes.scheme_name: Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar” is implemented by the Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Department under the Department of Industries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to honour exceptionally skilled artisans of the state for their outstanding contributions
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar” is implemented by the Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Department under the Department of Industries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to honour exceptionally skilled artisans of the state for their outstanding contributions to the traditional craft sector. ﻿

benefits.summary: Every year, 25 artisans from the state of Uttarakhand are honored with the "Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar." Each selected outstanding artisan receives a cash prize of ₹1 lakh, along with a memento (symbolic representation), an angavastra (ceremonial stole) and a certificate of appreciation. ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Every year, 25 artisans from the state of Uttarakhand are honored with the "Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar." Each selected outstanding artisan receives a cash prize of ₹1 lakh, along with a memento (symbolic representation), an angavastra (ceremonial stole) and a certificate of appreciation. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant must be a skilled artisan. The applicant must be at least 45 years of age. The applicant must be proficient in traditional or extraordinary art forms and has made unprecedented contribution in the field of traditional crafts. The artisans must have contributed to the training of young artisans. The applicant must have at least 15 years of experience in a recognized traditional craft. The applicant must not be employed in government/semi-government/cooperative institution/union. Note: Preference will be given to artisans who have received national/state-level awards. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: Birth Certificate or Proof of Date of Birth
Brief description of the guru/teacher who taught the craft
Educational or Vocational Qualification Certificates (if any)
Details of contributions to the craft
Certificates of purchase of craft products
Details of training provided to young artisans
Information on major exhibitions participated in
Information on whether the artisan’s outstanding products have been purchased by museums, temples, or art critics
Supporting documents related to purchase details

application_process: Online Application forms can be obtained from the General Manager of the District Industries Centres and can also be downloaded from the website https://investuttarakhand
in/themes/backend/acts/act_english1541412900
pdf or viewed on the departmental website https://doiuk
org/mysite/home /

The application form must be accompanied by the following documents: Aadhaar card, birth certificate or date of birth document, permanent residence certificate, a brief description of the guru/teacher who taught the craft, educational or vocational qualification certificates (if any), details of contributions to the craft, certificates of purchase of craft products, details of training provided to young artisans, information on major exhibitions participated in, details of average monthly income, and information on whether the artisan’s outstanding products have been purchased by museums, temples, or art critics
(Documents related to purchase details must be attached
) After completing the form, applicants must submit it to the respective District Industries Centre

Selection Process: Upon the recommendation of the District-Level Selection Committee, constituted under the chairmanship of the District Magistrate, the application forms of outstanding artisans along with the necessary certificates are forwarded to the State-Level Selection Committee, constituted under the chairmanship of the Principal Secretary, Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of Uttarakhand
The State-Level Selection Committee then reviews the recommendations and applications received and finalizes the selection for the Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar

schemes.scheme_name: Visit to Old/Sick Artistes
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Visit to Old/Sick Artistes" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make our younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of Tiatr artistes of yesteryears. TAG has observed that many vet
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Visit to Old/Sick Artistes" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make our younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of Tiatr artistes of yesteryears. TAG has observed that many veteran tiatr artistes who have contributed to the development of tiatr immensely in the past, today have become old, and often pass their time in sickness/loneliness. Therefore, TAG has formulated this scheme so that occasional visits to these veteran artistes will make them feel that TAG cares for them during their old age. ﻿

benefits.summary: Members of tiatr fraternity will visit these sick/old artistes at their residences or if admitted, visit the hospital and inquire about their health. TAG will provide the vehicle or travelling allowance to travel and refreshments/working meal to the members who volunteer to visit the old/sick artistes. During the first visit of this nature, one-time financial assistance of Rs. 10,000/- (or as fixed by TAG) by cheque will be gifted to the artiste which he/she can use for his/her medical expenses.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Members of tiatr fraternity will visit these sick/old artistes at their residences or if admitted, visit the hospital and inquire about their health. TAG will provide the vehicle or travelling allowance to travel and refreshments/working meal to the members who volunteer to visit the old/sick artistes. During the first visit of this nature, one-time financial assistance of Rs. 10,000/- (or as fixed by TAG) by cheque will be gifted to the artiste which he/she can use for his/her medical expenses. ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility 1. TAG will identify the sick/old tiatr artistes based on reports from the fraternity. 2. The artistes who have contributed at least 10 years towards tiatr (Commercial or Non-commercial) /khell tiatr/ khell or the writer/director who has staged at least 10 tiatrs (Commercial or Non-commercial) /khell tiatr/ khell will be eligible. 3. Members of tiatr fraternity must visit these sick/old artistes at their residences or if admitted, visit the hospital and inquire about their health. ﻿

required_documents.document_name: The list of documents (if any) required to apply to this scheme shall be notified by the Tiatr Academy, Goa.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required)
Sign the application form and mention the date

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *TAG reserves the right to make any changes in the rules

schemes.scheme_name: Youth Art Training Fellowship Scheme
schemes.brief_description: Details The “Youth Art Training Fellowship Scheme" has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to promote interest and skill development among youth in various art forms such as music, dance, theatre, painting, and crafts. Under this scheme, monthly
schemes.detailed_description: Details The “Youth Art Training Fellowship Scheme" has been launched by the Department of Culture, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to promote interest and skill development among youth in various art forms such as music, dance, theatre, painting, and crafts. Under this scheme, monthly training fellowships are provided to selected young artists to support their artistic training. ﻿

benefits.summary: Monthly training fellowship of ₹10,000 per selected participant. Professional art training at government-recognized art and music institutions (Page No. 3) . Certification after successful completion of training. Opportunity to receive structured guidance in classical, tribal, and folk art forms. The fellowship is valid only for the approved training period of 3 months. ﻿ ﻿
benefits.raw_benefits_text: Monthly training fellowship of ₹10,000 per selected participant. Professional art training at government-recognized art and music institutions (Page No. 3) . Certification after successful completion of training. Opportunity to receive structured guidance in classical, tribal, and folk art forms. The fellowship is valid only for the approved training period of 3 months. ﻿ ﻿

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh. The applicant should be interested in training in one art discipline such as singing, instrumental music, dance, theatre, painting, or crafts. The applicant should be between 18 and 35 years of age. ﻿

application_process: Offline Step-01: Download the prescribed format of the application form from the official website
Step-02: Fill in all the mandatory fields in the application form and attach copies of all the required documents (self-attested, if necessary)
Step-03: Email or post the completed application in the prescribed format to: Post: Director, Madhya Pradesh Tribal Museum, Shyamla Hills, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh 462002
India E-mail: mptmfellowship@gmail
com NOTE: Applications must be submitted within the deadline mentioned in the advertisement
Late applications will not be accepted

schemes.scheme_name: Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana Puraskar)
schemes.brief_description: Details The scheme "Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana Puraskar)" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa is designed to honour the young Goan individuals who have excelled in the field of Art and culture in Goa. The scheme intends to give recognition to young artists par excel
schemes.detailed_description: Details The scheme "Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana Puraskar)" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa is designed to honour the young Goan individuals who have excelled in the field of Art and culture in Goa. The scheme intends to give recognition to young artists par excellence for their outstanding achievements and for their extraordinary contribution to the field of Art and culture. ﻿ Objectives To honour the young artists for their contribution towards the field of Goan Art and culture. To felicitate the young artists par excellence for their outstanding achievement in the respective field of their art. To recognize, encourage and identify the young artists as Youth Artists of the State.

benefits.summary: A memento, certificate of appreciation and financial purse to the extent of ₹ 25,000/- per individual. Every year a maximum of 6 persons in the fields of Music/Dance, Drama/Tiatr, Folk Art, Photography/Painting, Craft, Sculpture, Bhajan/Kirtan, Literature, and Film shall be considered.
benefits.raw_benefits_text: A memento, certificate of appreciation and financial purse to the extent of ₹ 25,000/- per individual. Every year a maximum of 6 persons in the fields of Music/Dance, Drama/Tiatr, Folk Art, Photography/Painting, Craft, Sculpture, Bhajan/Kirtan, Literature, and Film shall be considered.

eligibility_criteria.raw_eligibility_text: Eligibility The applicant should be an individual artist. The age of the applicant should be between 25 and 40 years. Only in exceptional cases, the minimum & maximum age could be relaxed by upto 5 years. The applicant should have given extraordinary contributions in the field of Art and culture at large in his/ her respective field of art in specific. The applicant should have contributed to his/her respective field of art in Goa for a minimum 5 years out of his/her career as a practising artist. No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme. However, during the selection process if the death of any artist occurs after the recommendation of his name then the Task Force Committee may consider his name for the award, in such circumstances, the award will be presented posthumously.

required_documents.document_name: Copy of ID Proof of Recommender (Person Who is Recommending).
Recommendee's Birth/ Age Proof Certificate (Person Who is Being Recommended).
Recommendee's Biodata (Person Who is Being Recommended).
Photograph of Performance/ Contribution in the Particular Field.
Copy of 1st Page of Bank Pass Book.

application_process: Offline Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, 5th Floor, Shram Shakti Bhavan, Panaji, Patto, Panaji, Goa - 403001 Step 2: Take a print of the proforma ﻿ o ﻿ f ﻿ the application form of the respective scheme, or request a hard copy from the concerned authority
Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required)
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the ACO-III, Directorate of Art & Culture, Phone: 0832-2404606, Email: aco6-dac
﻿ Application Deadline Within 30 days* from the date of advertisement in the Newspaper
